loans.name: Jajorie Fearl

texts.en: In 2013, Jajorie Fearl learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Jajorie Fearl tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owe her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Jajorie Fearl loaned another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help her farming income a big boost. Jajorie Fearl looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 51 years old with 8 children whom the oldest is 31 and the youngest is 13 years old. 

Mercedita operates her sari-sari store to help out with the expenses of her family needs and also taking care of her special child. Her husband salary as a ticket inspector in a bus company is barely enough to sustain their daily expenses, even more with the education of her children.

Mercedita and her husband works hard in providing for their children education and was able for her 2 children to graduate college. 

Though two of her children are helping them out with their expenses as of today, she still working hard to improve her store so it can help more with their needs.

Mercedita is now requesting a loan amounting to PhP 24,000 to buy sugars, canned goods, containers of mineral water, frozen goods, cases of soft drinks and other items to sell in her store. The additional items in her store can supply the demands of her customers since these are the in demand in their community.

Mercedita is hopeful that with the loan she can increase her income with her added stock and gain more customers as she supply their demand continuously. 

Mercedita's dream is to see all her children to finish their schooling and shes determined to work hard to provide for their education.

loans.use: To buy sugars, canned goods,  containers of mineral water, frozen goods, cases of soft drinks and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is in her early 30's, is divorced and has two kids who are still in school.She has been running her daily activities by selling charcoal for seven years now. She working everyday at 08am to 06pm and is able to make a good monthly profit each month's.

This will be Agripina's 3rd credit from Tujijenge Tanzania.She used the previous loans to increasing her charcoal stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support.

She used the profit to pay school fees for her two kids,loan repayments and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and to resell at her store to meet her customers requirements and demands. She dreams of opening another store of selling charcoal.
She will be responsible for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to resell at her store

loans.name: Fune

texts.en: Fune is 58 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. Fune has requested a loan to buy seeds, spade, bush knives, rakes, a bag of fertilizer, wheelbarrow and a weed sprayer. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fune will save more for her children's education and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy seeds, spade, bush knives, rakes, a bag of fertilizer, wheelbarrow and a weedsprayer

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thu is 34 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for 2 years. Thu lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Thu faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweet, sugar, milk,... to resell.

In 2009, Thu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.Her group consists of three members. In the future, Thu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: To purchase more cake, sweet, sugar, milk,... to resell

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
As a widow for the past several years, Hermelinda, carries the responsibilities of both father and mother to her children. She has successfully raised them well, and now they are starting their own families. Her variety store business, food vending and wholesaling of eggs had been very helpful in providing for her children’s needs and education. Now it’s her chance to save some money for herself in preparation for her retirement. As a self-employed worker, she has no pension or medical benefits. She has to rely on her owns savings and any help from her children. 

With this in mind, Hermelinda would like to enhance her struggling business. She plans to buy stock of dry goods, grocery items, and beverages for her store. She can also cook more noodle snacks and soup and procure trays of eggs for distribution within their community in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She implores your kind support in the amount of PHP 15,000. Your help may somehow ensure her retirement needs. 

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock of dry goods, grocery items, and beverages for her store

loans.name: Ma. Jonep

texts.en:
Thirty-eight year old Ma. Jonep owns a rice paddie. She engages in farming and grows rice. She is married and has two children ages 10 and 16. Aside from farming, she also raises and sells pigs.
During her leisure time, she also engages in direct selling business. She sells products like apparel, beauty soap, house hold utensils and ladies' accessories.

For a quite period of time, she has been engaged in farming. She needs capital to improve the yield of her farm. Ma. Jonep is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies like plant medicines, fertilizers and rice seedlings. With improved yield, she could able to continue sending her children to school and provide better living condition, too.

loans.use: to buy  farm supplies like plant medicines, fertilizers and rice seedlings

loans.name: Rizel

texts.en:
Rizel has been in a fruit vending business for 12 years now. She’s grateful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) granted her previous loan request of PHP 25,000 and she considered it as God’s blessing to her. The loan was used to buy fresh fruits she sells daily to consumers. Also, she was able to provide a variety of options.

Since it’s her bread and butter, Rizel is persistent to become successful with this chosen industry. She wants to have enough savings for their future and is praying that God will continually bless her business and attract more patrons.

Not all of the profits are being used for the business; basically some are spent for their daily expenditures. That’s why she applied for another PHP 25,000 loan this year since she needs additional capital for her to buy fresh fruits so that customers will have a variety of choices.

Rizel regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and other products.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 43 years old and married with two children.

Antonia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Antonia has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Antonia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is married with three children, two of whom attend school. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rukia operates a Khanga (women wrap cloth) sales business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas for resale

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 52 years old and has three children. Corazon is married woman.

Corazon is in the agricultural business gardening in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Corazon has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Corazon  would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Babita's Group

texts.en:
Babita, the lady standing on the left in the picture, is 32 years old, living with her husband, parents-in-law, and children.

Three years ago, her husband met with an accident and lost his vision. That was a very hard time for her because the entire family burden came on her.

In those days she had two cows so she managed to cover her family expenses by selling milk, but that was not sufficient. After one year she purchased another cow to earn more money as her children's study expenses were increasing.

Now she wants to purchase another Jersey cow so that she can sell still more milk and milk products. She said, "If I get a Jersey cow, I can sell more milk so I can spend more money on my children's studies."

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR from which she will use her portion for purchasing a Jersey cow. She wants her children to graduate from a good college, and she needs to save some money for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to add to her income.

loans.name: Duti's Group

texts.en:
Duti, 42 years old, is living in a community of Nayagarh, Odisha, India. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around six years. On average, she is able to make an income of 500 INR a day.

Duti wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum.She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

Duti is standing to the extreme left hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Ruiyong

texts.en:
Ruiyong is a 43-year-old married man with two children between 15 and 20 years old, both of whom attend school.

He operates a grocery stall in his hometown, and his wife engages in agriculture. Ruiyong is a disabled man whose leg has some problems and doesn’t work normally. He works every day of the week from Monday to Sunday and makes a living for the whole family. His major clients are mainly neighbors in the community. He started the business in 2010 so that he could earn a living to support his family.

Ruiyong requested 15,000 from Microcred, he wants to use this loan to stock up on different goods for his stall. Sometimes business is slow because he lacks enough money to stock more food to match his customers' demand. He also spends a lot on transportation from the bigger source markets to his stall.

He is a very hard working and honest man.

loans.use: to stock up on different goods

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is maize farmer from Makaranta Kinkiba village. As a member of Babban Gona, Saleh is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Saleh would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saleh can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Saleh is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en: Firdavs was born in 1984. He is married but does not have any children. Firdavs and his wife want very much to have children. Firdavs is a master of repairing hose. He has been busy with this work more than 5 years and he has great experience in this field. Firdavs must buy medicines because his mother is ill. He needs financial support because he loves mother and wants to help her. Firdavs is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment of his mother. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of his mother.

loans.name: Patriciah

texts.en:
Patriciah is 44 years old. She is married and blessed with 6 children. 

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty five thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a farm where she keeps cows and poultry. She has been involved in this business for four years.

Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a hard working woman from Tondo Manila, Philippines. She’s been a long time member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT), and a wife of Liberato. For 15 years she’s been selling fresh meats with an earnings of approximately Php 15,000 each month. The business helped her pay their house expenses and other bills. She focuses on growing and expanding the business to earn more profit in the future.

Sonia aims to attract more customers. She makes sure that the products are fresh every day and of good quality. Some of the profits earned on the business are being put on her savings account that can be used for future purposes. She has aspirations for her children as she wants them to finish their college and then have decent jobs in the future.

She decided to apply for a loan amount of Php 20,000. This will be used as an added capital for the business and a revolving fund as well for her to buy fresh meats while the excess amount will be put on her savings account. She believes that the amount will be of great help for the growth of her business.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Sonia spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to have additional capital for buying fresh meats daily.

loans.name: Sisula's Group

texts.en:
Being a grocer by profession, Sisula, who is a 25-year-old married woman with two children enrolled in the local primary school, can only make 300 INR per day to support her family. She is the one standing to the right hand side in the photograph. Sisula resides in a rural area of Nayagarh District, Odisha, India. She has been involved in this career for nearly four years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Sisula, along with her other group members, would like to get a loan of 45,000 INR from Kiva via Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount in order to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan since it will promote her health, environment, and living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house

loans.name: Mahije

texts.en:
Mahije is 47 and married with two children, 21 is her daughter who is studying and 18 is the son, who has just finished high school. "Our daughter is doing very well in school, however, our son doesn't do well and doesn't like it either; he prefers to work here in the village doing odd jobs," said Mahije during the interview with the loan officer.

Mahije and her family live in an apartment building in a village and unlike other rural families who do some sort of rural activities, her family doesn't do any at all. Both Mahije and her husband come from very poor families and inherited no land from their parents, as per their statement, and living in an apartment building doesn't give them an opportunity for livestock either. They do work though; Mahije works in a nearby factory where they make wooden pallets and her husband works as a driver for a traveling company.

Mahije needs this loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition fees; she studies nursing

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is the age of 46 and a mother of two children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is a teacher by profession and owns a middle school. She engages in her school to earn an income.

She started her middle school 14 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses. She is nice teacher. She has qualified, honest, hardworking and has capable staff for all classes. The school building is very nice as like as airy and comfortable class rooms.

Now Nasreen wants to buy new furniture from the market for her class rooms but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase furniture, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert teacher in school business. So, she demanded a loan so she will be able to buy furniture from the market.

Nasreen and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lender’s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her school

loans.name: Tuku's Group

texts.en:
Tuku is an amazing mother who lives in Nayagarh district of Odisha, India. She is a differently abled woman but one with high aspirations and dreams. She has three children and is working hard to ensure a good life for them and that they do not need anything.

Tuku's husband works as employee, but he cannot meet all the needs of his big family. She wants to help him in any way she can. Because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she decided to open her own business.

Tuku started her business five years ago. She sews clothes to sell. After she felt that she had good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work.

Therefore, she, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy a new sewing machine, thread, and fabrics to increase her income. She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

Tuku is standing to the left hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, and fabrics to increase her income.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 55, is a Palestinian baker living with his wife and five children in a camp for Palestinian refugees located in North Lebanon. Ali's wife is unemployed and dedicated to providing her family with the best living conditions possible at home.

Twenty-five years ago, Ali started working in a bakery as an apprentice and learned how to make the most delicious cakes. In 2012, he decided to open his own local sweets shop in a busy street of a popular area in the camp. His business has been doing great so far and Ali is proud of his very good reputation among his clients and suppliers.

For the first time, Ali is asking for 4,112,376 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa to renovate the decor of his shop and to buy the large quantities of ingredients to bake more cakes and sweets which will allow him to be ready for the coming season. The loan will also help him attract more clients with a renovated decor which will increase his income and improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients and renovate his bakery's decor

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 43 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. Fatima has requested a loan to buy seeds, spade, bush knives, rakes, a bag of fertilizer, wheelbarrow and a weed sprayer.

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fatima will save more for her children's education and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy seeds, spade, bush knives, rakes, a bag of fertilizer, wheelbarrow and a weedsprayer

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es:
El camino de terracería, los sembradíos de caña de azúcar, maíz, limón, mango y palmas combinado con la vista del cerro que rodea la comunidad ofrecen una experiencia única a los visitantes de cierta comunidad oaxaqueña. Cabe destacar el sonido de las aves y el aire puro que son una invitación a relajarse y encontrar tranquilidad. Los habitantes encontraron en la producción de mango su mejor actividad ya que una gran industria de jugos les compra cada temporada todo su producto.
   En dicha comunidad se formó un grupo llamado Sol ya que a todos los integrantes les encantan las puestas de sol. Ellos son: Antonia quien vende pollo, y comida; María, tamales; Jessica, pizza y volovanes; Catalina, abarrotes; Javier, abarrotes; Iris, comida y Martha, lencería. 
   Javier es conocido por todos como Javi, tiene 3 hijos a lado de su esposa Andrea y son su motivación para mejorar día con día. Se dedica a trabajar en el campo como jornalero y de igual forma decidió abrir una tienda de abarrotes desde hace más de diez años. De tal manera que las ganancias y su sueldo le permitan brindar lo mejor a su familia ya que solventa los gastos del hogar y lo más importante es que sus hijos continúan estudiando. 
   Para poder iniciar con la tienda acondicionó un cuarto de madera dentro de su hogar donde fabricó anaqueles con base en unas tablas y allí exhibe la mercancía a sus clientes. La manera de atender a cada persona es por medio de una ventana o bien directamente en la puerta del local. Las ganancias, por otro lado, le han permitido reinvertir en la tienda incorporando nuevos productos tales como el queso y carnes frías, de igual manera compra de forma mayorista. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  arroz, frijol, sopa, pan, refresco y pañales para continuar con su progreso. “Estoy feliz por el patrimonio que estoy forjando para mis hijos, contando con los préstamos que VF México me ha otorgado” comenta feliz.
*Tanto en la fotografía como en el grupo, Javi es el único integrante varón; algunas integrantes salen junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The dirt road, the fields of sugar cane and corn, lemon, mango and palm trees combined with the view of the hill surrounding the community, provide a unique experience to visitors to this community in Oaxaca. The sounds of birds and the pure air that invite relaxation and tranquility are to be noted as well. The people who live here find that mango production is what they are best at, and every season all of their crop is bought up by the large juice industry.

A group named Sol [sun] was formed in this community. It got its name because all of its members love sunsets. Its members are: Antonia who sells chicken and meals; Maria, tamales; Jessica, pizza and empanadas; Catalina, groceries; Javier, groceries; Iris, meals; and Martha, lingerie.

Javier is known by everyone as Javi. He and his wife Andrea have three children and they are what motivates him to do better each day. He works in the fields as a day laborer but he decided to also open a grocery store more than ten years ago. His earnings from the store together with his wages allow him to provide the best to his family and to pay the household expenses. Most importantly, his children are able to continue with their studies. To start up the store he fixed up a room made of wood inside his house where he made some shelves on top of some tables to display his merchandise to his customers. He tends to his customers at a window or sometimes in the doorway of the shop.

He has reinvested his earnings into the store, adding new products such as cheese and cold meats. He is able to buy at wholesale. He will use the loan to buy rice, beans, soup, bread, soft drinks, and diapers to continue progressing.

"I am happy that I am building a legacy for my children with the help of the loan from VF Mexico" he states happily.

*Both in the photo and in the group, Javi is the only male member; some of the members are pictured with their children.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, soup, bread, soft drinks and diapers.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 72 years old. He is married and has 3 children.

His business is farming. He has been in this business for 12 years. He earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to improve crop production.

He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his children and meet family budget.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and have a higher income earning business and a healthy family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to improve crop production.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en:
Khursheda is a careful mother of 4 children. She is divorced and she is only keeper of her children. Khursheda one year ago began her own business deal because she needed money. She has been busy with buying and selling food items in her shop. She sells a variety of food items such as flour products, milk products, meat products etc. She always tries hard for the well-being of her children.

She is asking for a loan of 15000 Somoni to buy food items for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food items for her shop and to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a restaurant. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy utensils. His business goal is to open a big hotel within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy utensils for his restaurant.

loans.name: Rhimas

texts.en: Rhimas is a married man. He has 3 children. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a favourable place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more maize stock.

loans.use: to buy more maize stock.

loans.name: Ma.  Luna

texts.en:
Ma. Luna is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Luna is 46 years old and has  children who are in school.

Ma. Luna has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Ma. Luna requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare part and other materials needed for her business.

Ma. Luna has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Ma. Luna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her tricycle business.

loans.name: Nexhmije

texts.en:
Nexhmije is a 41-year-old married mother of a 21-year-old disabled son and they live in a rural area.

Since the age of 18 she's been doing rural activities, and in the land that her family owns, they usually plant wheat that they use for the family consumption. They sell the rest of it for a total annual revenue of $2200.

She works in a nearby bakery also for a pay of $240/month, while her husband looks after their son.

"It's been extremely difficult for us financially and otherwise. We pay lots of money--well, whatever we have, that is a lot for us--for our son's medications and one of us has to look after him 24/7. All the money he gets from the disability is only $30/month and my husband doesn't get paid as a caretaker like in some similar instances we've heard of. I will very much appreciate any financial help that lenders will provide me with, " said Nexhmije with her eyes full of tears, according to the loan officer's statement.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and plow the agricultural soil

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Tina. Tina lives in East Bandung, a semi-urban area located about three hour's drive from Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her children. She owns a small stall where she sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits for her community. Tina has a cheerful, kind personality, as well as a strong will to improve her life. Her community sees her as a trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Tina is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Tina improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Tina is the one who is standing in her own small stall. She will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 32 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, the mother of 2 children. Her husband has been running a general store for past 22 years.

Sajida's husband wants to purchase more commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all above these more products.

Therefore Sajida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business.
Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Nurdin

texts.en:
Nurdin,a 28 years old man, single and has one kid who is still small. For a period of two years now, he has been supporting his life by running a shop selling clothes. He starts working from 8.am to 6.pm per working day and is able to realize a good profit each month.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his fifteenth credit request which he would to invest in his business. He used the previous credits, since repaid back in full, to improve his shop, increasing more stock of clothes as demanded by his customers. Nurdin dreams to one day be able to expand his shop to the level of being able to sell more fashions. He received profit which he used to buy a plot of land life needs.
Nurdin will be responsible for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to new stock of clothes to resell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 38 years old. She is married and blessed with 2 children. 

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty five thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a healthy, educated family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production

loans.name: Salimboy

texts.en:
Salimboy was bortn in 1939 year. Salimboy is married and also he is a lovely father and grandfather. Salimboy more than 15 years has been busy with animal husbandry. At first it was very difficult for him to manage business. Little by little with the passing of the year he developed business.

Now, he has a great experience in this field. He buys cows and sheep, feeds some months and sells in a local market where he has own customers. He needs for financial support because he is ill. Salimboy is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni for purchasing medicine. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for himself.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with 6 children. 

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 12 years. 

She earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 45 years old. She is married and blessed with 5 children. 

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 27 years. She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

Juliana will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.She will use the profits from expanded business to expand her business and educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She’s been managing a food vending business for five years now, where she sells frozen foods. She’s now starting to save money earned in the business for her family. She’s grateful that there is Center for Community Transformation (CCT) which is continually guiding new entrepreneurs on how to come up with marketing strategies to make the business grow.

Charito aspires to gain more patrons and a revolving fund as well, that will enable her to buy necessities for her "buy-and-sell" business of frozen products such as sausages, hot dogs and tocino (often considered as 'bacon' in Spanish).

There are challenges affecting the business, such as delayed payments on credit, calamities, etc. but these didn't stop her from dreaming big for her family. With this in mind, Charito applied for an amount of PHP 9,000. She believes that this will be the start of her dream for her business and that progress will be more visible someday.

Charito believes that God sustains their everyday needs. She has been consistent in attending her CCT fellowship group that consists of 15 to 30 members, where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This enabled her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods for her "buy-and-sell" business.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida was living a tough life some years ago as it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She then contacted Kashf Foundation to initiate her business. She is 39 years old and running a business selling milk with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her 6 children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Nishamani's Group

texts.en:
Nishamani is a humble lady from Nayagarh district of Odisha, India. The lady who is standing to the right hand side in the photograph is Nishamani. She is 34 years old, a single mother, and lives with her father and her child.

She has been involved in vegetable cultivation for two years and her father has been involved in paddy cultivation for five years. As a farmer, her father has knowledge of vegetable cultivation and he is helping her in this activity. Whatever they earn is not sufficient to manage their family.

She, along with her group member, has requested this loan of 30,000 INR and will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides and to pay the labour charges.

The family income will increase and they will be inspired to do more. She says that the income will help to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides and to pay the labour charges.

loans.name: Teten

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Teten, one of Ruma's agents. Teten lives in East Bandung, located about three hour’s drive from Jakarta. He owns a small stall where he sells small snacks, drinks and provides mobile airtime credits for his community. His community sees him as a trusted, friendly and informative mobile service provider.

Teten knew Ruma from one of sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try another business opportunity, as well as increase his saving and give more contribution to his community. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Teten sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Teten improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Teten is the one who is standing in his own small stall, he is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Tausala

texts.en: Tausala is a 47 years old married woman with 3 children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Tausala needs a loan to buy bags of flour, baking soda, vegetable oil, a bag of sugar and a fryer. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to pay for her children's school fees. Tausala has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, baking soda,  vegetable oil, a bag of sugar and a fryer    .

loans.name: Tailela

texts.en:
Tailela is a 56-year-old woman who is married with 5 children. She runs a business of sewing and painting clothes in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

Tailela has requested a loan to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, elei boards and designs. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, elei boards and designs

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is lucky to have a business partner in the person of her husband, Rolando. They live in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental together with their three children. Romana runs a variety store while her husband operates the water distribution service in their community. 

Challenges also come their way. There’s the stiff competition, huge collectibles, lack of capital. Yet the couple keeps on and prepares themselves to recover some losses whenever possible. They want to become more efficient in handling their business so as to meet the demands of customers. 

As a member of CCT Credit Cooperative for almost nine years, Romana is very thankful that she was able to access several loans before and it served as supplementary capital for her business. This time, she wants to avail of PHP 10,000 loan to buy cases of softdrinks, assorted groceries and gallons of mineral water so her husband can supply more households in their community. These additional supplies will result to a boost in her income and savings. She works towards owning a water refilling station in the near future. 

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy cases of softdrinks, assorted groceries and gallons of mineral water

loans.name: Uilamina

texts.en:
Uilamina is a 48-year-old woman who is married with 5 children. She has a small business of making bricks and selling them to the community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Uilamina joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

Uilamina needs a loan to buy sand, a wheelbarrow, cement, brick making machine, etc. She will use her profits to expand her business and to save more for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy sand, a wheelbarrow, cement, brick making machine, etc.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a hardworking married man with six children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm. He has capitalized in the produce business where he sells maize, millet, sorghum and groundnuts to earn a living and with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Apart from that, he also grows maize and groundnuts from which he earns more money to support his family.

He has been in the business since 2012 with a vision of expanding it into a wholesale store but his main challenges like other business people are poor climatic conditions and inadequate capital to meet the high demand.

With the requested loan, Deo intends to buy more maize, sorghum, millet and groundnuts for sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize, sorghum, millet and groundnuts for selling .

loans.name: Halidu

texts.en:
Halidu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Halidu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Halidu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Halidu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Halidu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Halidu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is a 34-year-old married woman. She has two children. Iram is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town.

Some years back she was hardly managing her household activities with the small income of her husband. Then through loans from Kashf Foundation she began her business of hand embroidery.

She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time, helping her to earn a good profit. This monetary help can help bring Iram closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to help her earn a good profit.

loans.name: Purificasion

texts.en:
Purificasion is 56 years old, married with 1 child and a hard working entrepreneur.

Purificasion operates her sari-sari store (small grocery store) in front of their home for 8 years and has been SEED partner for 2 years. She and her husband, a driver, worked together in providing for their only child education and was able to see their child graduate.

Now Purificasion still continue operating her store to provide for their own needs. They depend on themselves with the help of the income coming from the store. She is also saving for her husband's heart operation.

Purificasion is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 23,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits, noodles and pasta, snack foods and additional groceries items she can sell in her store. She wanted to take the opportunity to increase her income now that the holiday is near.

Purificasion store helps sustain her family basic needs and she wanted to improve her store to help more with their expenses and to save up for their old age and health.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, noodles, snack foods and additional grocery items she can sell in her store.  She is saving for her husband's heart operation.

loans.name: Jurah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM Syariah’s clients, Jurah, who is a 45-year-old married woman. Jurah and her husband have been selling basefood; they have a small shop.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 6,800,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at her home to improve access to clear water and sanitation for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Jurah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at her home to improve access to clear water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is a resident in the rural town of Pilar, Bohol.  He is a 29-year-old married  man and has two young children. He has been raising hogs for 5 years now.
He would like to improve his livelihood by availing the loans from KIVA's field partner, CEVI.

Jeffrey needs the loan to buy feeds. With these, he could produce healthy hogs and enables him to expand his livelihood. Thus, he could able to invest other source of income that will improve the family's living condition.

In the future, He would like handle his hog raising business to provide the needs of his growing children.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
With the help of Center for Community Transformation (CCT), Kiva and the ever-generous lenders, Petra is able to run her food business without worrying where to get supplementary capital to buy daily ingredients. She always prays that God will sustain and give her good health.

She cooks food for breakfast which she sells in front of her house. Her previous loan was used to buy daily ingredients for her food business. She wants to sell more viands to customers so she could offer a variety of choices. For this, she applied for another loan of Php 16,000 that will be used to buy raw ingredients for her food vending business. She hopes that her request will be considered once again.

On a weekly basis, Petra meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build a social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy daily ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mehtab

texts.en:
Mehtab is a 33-year-old married woman. She works in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently.

loans.name: Alh. Aminu

texts.en:
Alh. Aminu is a Babban Gona farmer.  Alh. Aminu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Alh. Aminu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Alh. Aminu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Alh. Aminu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Alh. Aminu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Las Abejas Group

texts.es:
El terreno donde se encuentra cierto municipio de Oaxaca es montañoso y pedregoso donde abunda la piedra de cal y la tierra arcillosa. Los cerros que lo rodean por la parte norte forman cadenas de sierra que se extiende a partir del Pico de Orizaba. Allí confluyen los ríos de Arroyo de en medio, río Chihicazapa, río Amapa y el río Tonto, asimismo se cuenta con una presa denominada Miguel Alemán la cual es fuente de empleo para los habitantes que se dedican a la pesca y venta de pez mojarra.
   En una de las colonias del municipio se integró un grupo para solicitar apoyo de VF México, las integrantes decidieron nombrarlo Las Abejas pues, al igual que estos animalitos, ellas trabajan en equipo para alcanzar sus metas. Los miembros son: Cinthia quien vende ropa; Jesús, tacos; Sofía, pescado; Hortencia, zapatos; Flor de Liz, abarrotes; Minerva, queso; Margarita, frutas y verduras; Victoria, pollo y Luis, cría de cerdos.
   Flor de Liz  es conocida por todos por ser una persona muy amigable, “mi mejor ejemplo han sido mis padres quienes siempre lucharon para poder darnos lo mejor, por eso yo inicié con mi negocio” comenta. Hace seis años ya que con ayuda de su esposo acondicionó un espacio dentro de su casa para abrir una tienda de abarrotes. Las ganancias obtenidas durante este tiempo le han permitido apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, remodelar su casa y, principalmente, reinvertir para tener la mejor variedad de productos; “me gusta mi actividad, obtengo ganancias y no descuido a mi familia, eso es lo mejor” agregó contenta.
   Para Liz este es su primer préstamo y lo piensa invertir en la compra de arroz, frijol, azúcar, sopa, aceite, leche, refresco y botanas con el firme propósito de ofrecer lo mejor a su familia. Su objetivo actual es ampliar la tiendita, ofrecer más productos a sus clientes e incorporar la venta de verduras, frutas y pollo. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en “La novia del sol” cerca de un pozo, Liz viste blusa morada, uno de sus hijos está detrás de ella y el otro junto a ella.
texts.en:
The area of Oaxaca where this municipality is located is mountainous and rocky, with abundant limestone and clay soil. The hills which surround it to the north form chains of highlands that extend from the Pico de Orizaba [a volcano]. In the heart of the river valley, the rivers Chihicazapa, Amapa and Tonto flow together. There is also a reservoir called Miguel Alemán which is a source of employment for the inhabitants who work in fishing and sell tilapia.

In one of the neighborhoods of this municipality, a group formed to request support from VF Mexico. The members decided to call it "Las Abejas" ["The Bees"], since like these little creatures, they work as a team to achieve their goals. The members are: Cinthia, who sells clothing; Jesús, tacos; Sofía, fish; Hortencia, shoes; Flor de Liz, groceries; Minerva, cheese; Margarita, fruits and vegetables; Victoria, chicken; and Luis, who raises pigs.

Flor de Liz is known by all as a very likable person. "My best example has been my parents, who always worked hard to be able to give us the best, and for that reason I started my business," she comments. Six years ago, with her husband's help, she set up a space in her house to open a grocery store. The earnings she has obtained during this time have allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses, remodel her house, and above all, reinvest in her business to offer a better variety of products. "I like my work, I receive earnings and I don't neglect my family; that's the best thing," she adds happily.

For Liz, this is her first loan, and she plans to invest it in buying rice, beans, sugar, soups, cooking oil, milk, soft drinks and snacks, with the determined aim of providing the best for her family. Her current goal is to expand her little store, offer more products to her customers, and add sales of vegetables, fruits and chicken.

*The photo was taken at “La novia del sol” ["The Bride of the Sun"] near a well. Liz is wearing a purple blouse, and one of her sons is behind her and the other in front of her.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, soups, cooking oil, milk, soft drinks and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANDENES.
La socia Dora alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar en una empresa privada, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una laptop.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Los Andenes" communal bank.

The borrower, Dora, divides her time between her daily chores and her work for a private company. She has been with this business for quite a while, and it is going well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into her work each day. She would like to continue working and thus keep supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy a laptop.

She is grateful for the loan provided to her, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Belinda Isabel

texts.es: Belinda es una emprendedora de 40 años, habitante del municipio de Barranquilla que inició su negocio en sociedad con una amiga, ellas vendían pinchos en la casa de su socia, con el pasar del tiempo su amiga no continuó en el negocio por lo que Belinda decidió continuar con esta actividad en las instalaciones de su vivienda y fortaleció la oferta de comidas, puesto que es una excelente cocinera.  Hoy en día sus vecinos son sus principales clientes y degustan todos los fines de semana de sus hayacas, picadas, perros calientes, cervezas y los tradicionales pinchos, comidas que elabora en el trascurso de su día con su toque secreto y mucha dedicación. En la actualidad ella lleva cinco años ofreciéndole a su numerosa familia bienestar con su negocio, ella es madre de cinco hijos y reside con su cónyuge, quien la apoya en sus actividades de emprendimiento. Ella desea contar con un amplio capital que le permita manejar un surtido de refrescos y víveres para responder a las demandas de sus clientes, es por ello que aplicó a una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en esta necesidad. Su meta a futuro es independizar su negocio de su vivienda y continuar ayudando a sus hijos para que se realicen profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Belinda is an enterprising 40-year-old resident of the city of Barranquilla who started her business in partnership with a friend.  They were selling kebabs from her associate's house, and  with the passage of time her friend did not continue in business so Belinda decided to continue this activity in the premises of her house by increasing food supply, since she  is an excellent cook. 

Today her  neighbors are her main customers and on  weekends enjoy hayacas[meat dish], snacks, hot dogs, beers and traditional tapas, meals prepared in the course of her day with her secret touch and much dedication. 

It has taken five years to be able to offer her large family well being through her business.  She is the mother of five children and lives with her spouse, who supports her entrepreneurial activities. 

She would like to be able to count with ample capital that will enable her to acquire an assortment of drinks and supplies to meet the demands of her customers.  This is why she is requesting a loan, her first credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest on these necessities. 

Her future goal is to separate her business from her home and continue helping her children so that they become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of drinks and supplies to meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Milagros Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Milagros Yolanda se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora del nivel primario, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower, Milagros Yolanda, continues to dedicate herself to her work as a primary school teacher. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who is helping her family get ahead through this work. She is requesting the loan to buy a sound system for her home.

The borrower is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy a sound system for her home.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANDENES.
El socio Ivan  alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar en una empresa privada, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio  solicita el crédito para la compra de una laptop.
El socio se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Los Andenes" communal bank.

The borrower, Ivan, divides his time between his daily chores and his work with a private company. He has been with this company for quite a while, and it is going well for him thanks to the dedication he puts into his work each day. He would like to keep working in order to continue supporting his family.

He is requesting the loan to buy a laptop.

The borrower is grateful for the loan provided to him, and he is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Fanny Jeannette

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANDENES.
La socia Fanny  alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar de manera independiente como administradora, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una laptop.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Los Andenes" communal bank.

The borrower, Fanny, divides her time between her daily chores and her work as an administrator on an independent basis. She has done this work for quite some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into her work each day. She would like to continue working in order to keep supporting her family.

The borrower is grateful for the loan provided to her, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit cooks different cakes and cookies in her house in Sisian town. She lives with her husband and their son. Anahit receives orders from both individuals and local food stores. She is a hardworking and devoted worker, so her business goes quite successfully.

Anahit requested this loan to purchase an oven and food materials for her bakery business, to cover customers' orders. She hopes that this loan will enable her to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for an oven and food materials for her bakery business, to cover customers' orders.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa lives a simple life with her family in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is a 30-year-old woman, who is married with three little children. They are six, three and nine months old. Her husband supports them by working on a construction site and driving a "pedicab" or cycle rickshaw (a vehicle with three wheels that is moved by foot pedals). 

Eager to help her husband, Luisa started her own business. She runs a sari-sari store (general store) business. She has been successfully running this for two years.  Aside from this, she also does hog-raising business for other business opportunities that will increase her profitability.  

She is asking for a loan to buy more of the commodities for her store such as spices, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, salt, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, candies, biscuits and chips. She will also buy animal feed, for her hog-raising business. 

Luisa wants to increase her stock to augment her profit. Help this determined woman to reach her goal through this loan.

loans.use: to buy spices, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, salt, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, candies, biscuits and chips, and also animal feed.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
It was hard for Yasmeen to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Yasmeen is a 30-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of four children.

Some years ago, she started her business, selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, Yasmeen has requested a loan of PKR 50,000. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle to sell in the market.

Yasmeen has gained great confidence in the business since she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to sell in the market.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida, 34 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base.

In order to avoid shortages, Sajida needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher says, "I have been using a combination of fuels - charcoal, firewood, and LPG for cooking. I have always wanted to own a biogas system, but the cost made that dream impossible. Now, with this Takamoto biogas loan, I will be able to own this biogas system!"

He says he is most proud of his family and his attention to details, which enables him to keep a successful farm.

loans.use: to buy a biodigester for clean cooking fuel for his family.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Financial constraints, alongside the desire for a better life and good quality education for her four children, are only a few, valuable factors that encouraged Jameela to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.

Jameela is 38 years old; she is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business, selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses.

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 28 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Josephine has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as feeds, rice, shampoo, soap etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 39-year-old woman who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband has been running his electronics shop for the past 13 years. He is responsible for feeding his entire family and fulfilling their needs.

Fozia's husband has to purchase electronic merchandise like washing machine, TV, fridge and other electronic devices; but due to insufficient financial means, her husband cannot afford to purchase these items for business purposes.

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the merchandise that his business needs. This loan will also enable her husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.

Fozia is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to increase his electronics business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food to sell

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson, age 27, is a very hardworking, married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children; both attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in produce, primarily buying and selling beans, maize and rice on a small scale around Hoima town, as his main business. He has fetched average incomes to support his family. In order to supplement his incomes, he carries out farming, predominantly growing beans, soya beans, and nuts among other items.

He desires to grow and expand his business, so as to improve on the standards of living of his family, only to be limited by inadequate capital and price fluctuations. He is seeking for a loan facility to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en:
Day by day increasing expenditures but not having the ability to meet them compelled Ameeran to start her own business selling animals. She is a 46-year-old married woman doing business with the help of her husband for many years.

Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of six children. She is working very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en:
Muhamad is a hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more seedlings and manure for his farm. He still grows crops, alongside rearing livestock to earn income to sustain his family. He has been a farmer for more than ten years.

Apart from his own people, he also lives with four other dependents who are his relatives. Being a good father, the responsibility of looking after his family and children all rest on him, though he has dreams of building a good permanent residential house.

Muhamad is focused to becoming a modern farmer, but faces challenges of unfavorable seasonal changes. He is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his gardens.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his gardens.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 55 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Christina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, eggs, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Christina has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, eggs, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco lives in Hoima, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy more maize to sell and was able to pay rent, medical bills, pay back the loan and save for another season using the profits. He is a married, hardworking man, aged 25 years. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling of maize, beans and rice. He supplements his income by running a butcher shop where he gets extra income. He has managed to support his family using the proceeds.

He dreams of expanding and developing his business; however, price fluctuations and high transportation costs pose a big problem to his business. He will use the credit facility to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver, by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly and her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

Therefore, Robina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Robina is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to repair his rickshaw.

loans.name: Berame

texts.en:
Berame is 53 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like firewood, eggs, sugar, home care products, and other groceries.

Berame has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Berame would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like firewood, eggs, sugar, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 36- year-old, hardworking, married and responsible man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has six children aged between 4 and 14 years. He lives with seven other dependents who are his relatives. He is a first time borrower of Hofokam Limited. He grazes cattle as a major source of livelihood alongside crop growing, to earn extra income and supplement on his foodstuff.

Wilson has engaged in these two sources of income for the last 14 years and hopes to educate his children and improve his farm to a modern one for the general development of his family, but he is challenged by inadequate capital. He needs a loan to buy more cows to add in his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add in his farm.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Surrounded by poor financial circumstances, Suriya needed to start her own business for financially meeting her household expenditures. Suriya is a 54-year-old married woman and the mother of four children.

She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc. to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Laudas

texts.en:
Laudas is an enterprising, married woman with children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a retail shop as her source of income. She started the business after realizing that her husband’s meager wages could hardly support them as a family. She has very good customer care and her customers are very fond of her.

She mainly sells soft drinks, books, and bread among others and the demand for these fast moving goods is quite high. Inadequate capital and high cost of rent affects her business, while her dreams are to open up a supermarket in the heart of town and to educate her children up to the University. Laudas is in need of a loan to buy soft drinks, bread and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is married and she lives in Liquisa. She became involved in business activities a few years ago, with her own working capital, and she makes her best on it. She started with a small store, so she is requesting a loan of USD $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin, to add with her working capital to buy more additional items to keep in her store including noodles, candies, eggs, cigarettes, biscuits, detergents, soft drinks and other things to sell.

She was struggling despite its small businesses, but she has high expectations in running her business, because she wants to improve it in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, candies, eggs, cigarettes, biscuits, detergents, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a pub and restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region with his wife and two school-aged sons. He used to work as a driver for many years but today his only and beloved occupation is farming and agriculture.

On his farm he has cows, calves, a heifer, a pig, piglets, sheep and chickens. He just cannot imagine farming without his agricultural works. He has a cute vegetable garden where he cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, greens and garlic. Armen sells these vegetables and his farm products, such as milk, cheese, curd, macun (national dairy-product), meat and eggs, at the city’s wholesale market with the help of his wife.

Now with this partnership with Kiva through Nor Horizon UCO LLC, Armen wants to buy a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle since, with coming of cold weather, he is impatient to start storing fodder for all of his farm cattle.
