loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle since, with the coming of cold weather, he is impatient to start storing fodder for all of his farm cattle.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a hardworking, married man with three children, who all attend school in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more bulls for fattening. He still grazes cattle and also does motor vehicle transport. He loves being active and works all days of the week. From his hard work, he has been able to provide for his family and pay school fees for his children.

He plans to expand and develop his animal farm into a modern one, though he is challenged by inadequate water for the animals, especially in the dry seasons. Francis seeks a loan to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a hard-working, married man, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock as his main source of income, along with farming, where he earns extra income.

Julius is experienced and determined in livestock-rearing and farming and he has done this work for over seven years. He hopes of buying more land for expanding the animal farm and educating all his children, although he faces challenges of inadequate capital.

He requests a loan to buy more bulls and cows for fattening on the farm.

loans.use: to buy more bulls and cows for fattening on the farm.

loans.name: Araqsya

texts.en:
Araqsya is nurse from Gyumri town of Shirak region. She lives with her husband and two children. Besides her main work in the clinic, Araqsya also provide individual medical treatment service for people in the town.
Araqsya receives patients in her house, and sometimes makes also visits herself.
She requests this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for providing people in community medical treatment. She hopes to receive lenders' support and continue her work as a nurse.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for providing people in community medical treatment

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en:
Day by day increasing expenditures, but not having ability to meet them compelled Ameeran to initiate her own business, selling animals. She is a 55-year-old, married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchases and sales with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of three children. She is working very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married mother of six children, one of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 47-year-old married woman. She is the mother of 8 children. It was hard for Parveen to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Parveen has gained great confidence in the business as she has learnt how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is 36 years old and she lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She has a nice large family; she lives with her husband, two sons and a son, and all her children are still school-aged. Seda never has been employed and with her husband she runs the farm. In the farm she has cows, calves, a pig, sheep and lambs. She is very happy for her farming activities, through which she also provides fresh and very healthy dairy products for her children. She sells her farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, butter, curd and also meat to her regular customers, who buy it right from her farm. Seda makes all the assortments of dairy products very skillfully, tasty and accurately.

As she mentions she likes her farm and greatly wants to make it richer with cattle. Seda surely decided to use this loan of 700,000 AMD for the purchase of one more cow for her farm, and she also plans to buy as much fodder as possible for her farm cattle, for the long lasting cold season.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow for her farm, and she also plans to buy as much fodder as possible for her farm cattle for the long-lasting cold season.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
This young man is Sargis and he is 29 years old. With his beloved mother he lives in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Here he is busy with farming and potato cultivation. In the farm now he has cows, calves, a bull, piglets, a pig and chickens. With his mother, Sargis sells his farm products (potatoes, milk, meat, cheese, curds and eggs) taking them to the city’s wholesale market. Sargis mentions that being the only breadwinner in his family, his sense of duty and responsibility is so great that he is ready to do any work with any difficulty just to provide his mother with good living conditions.

Sargis asks now for this loan of 700,000 AMD, as he wants to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle, and this is just the beginning for getting prepared for coming winter months, which last so long and cause a lot of hardships to any farmer.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle, and this is just the beginning for getting prepared for coming winter months.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a widowed woman and she has six children. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman and she has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, and fish. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of onions, tomatoes, and fish. She hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standards of her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions, tomatoes, and fish.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en: Samah is a 19 years old university student majoring in Mathematics, and she is in her second ‎year. She lives with her family that consists of three members. Samah is only one step close ‎to reaching her aim of graduating from the university with her bachelor degree and find a ‎job in her field which is considered as one of her interests. But because she doesn’t have ‎enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.‎

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees for her 2nd year studies in Mathematics

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a repeat borrower of UGAFODE Nakasero branch. She applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to pay the school fees for her daughter's school and the balance to add to her small business service.

She is married and has four children. She is grateful for the support that UGAFODE has always given to the active poor to pull them out of poverty. She is hard working and resilient.

Pictured is Prima (right) and the UGAFODE credit officer (left).

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 46-year-old widowed woman, from Rustavi city. She has an unemployed son and daughter who works as a waitress and gets her own salary. Manana had no source of income, until she has started a trading business with food products at the local open market. She started the business two months ago, and now gets some income for covering her family's increased needs.

Manana wants to expand her trading business and make it more productive. The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables poor people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program, to get a loan of 5,000 GEL for purchasing stock of food products and to get the additional place for the store.

The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to tackle the financial difficulties and live better. Manana and her children await your support and kindness.

loans.use: to expand her trading business with food products.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 43 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Marjorie works very hard to provide for them.

Marjorie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marjorie has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marjorie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Hilman

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Hilman. Hilman lives in East Bandung, located about three hour’s drive from Jakarta. He lives there with his spouse and his only daughter. He owns a small stall where he sells small snacks and provides mobile airtime credits and bill payment services for his community. His community sees him as a trusted, friendly and informative mobile payment service provider.

Hilman knew Ruma from one of of the sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try another business opportunity, as well as increase his savings and contribute more to his community. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Hilman sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community.

Hilman is the one who is standing in his own stall. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a repeat client of UGAODE microfinance. She deals in livestock farming at her home in the city outskirts. She will use the acquired loan to purchase livestock medicine for her cows.

She greatly enjoys her business because it is strategically located near the market. Her challenge is that the cows get diseases. She hopes to get new loans and increase stock of her cows.

loans.use: to purchase veterinary drugs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en:
Ishaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Ishaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Ishaya now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell beverages.  Josefina is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a maize farmer from Toka village. As a Babban Gona member, Jonathan is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Jonathan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Jonathan will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Jonathan no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Jonathan hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Figoa

texts.en: Figoa is a married woman of 41 years old with 6 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a bag of sugar, bags of flour, vegetable oil, oven and baking soda. In the future, Figoa hopes to save more of her profit to expand her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in September this year 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, bags of flour, vegetable oil, oven and baking soda

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes and has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es: Doña Mabel de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su nuera, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Mabel, age 53, lives in her own house with her son and her daughter-in-law. She has been making and selling 'pupusas' [stuffed tortillas] for several years. Her business is located close to her house in a heavily traveled area. With what she gets from her sales, she manages to pay for some of her household expenses.

Mabel is requesting a loan to buy pork rinds, soft cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients. This way she will be able to continue with her work, which generates good earnings for her.

loans.use: to buy pork rinds, soft cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak is a mother of 4 children. She looks after her children because she is divorced. Muborak has been busy with own business deal for a year. She has a little shop where she sells a variety of food items. Muborak little by little develops her business.

Now, she plans to repair her little food shop and in this way to attract more customers. She will use the profit from business for education of her children. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy building materials as paint, cement etc. for repairing the food shop. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her food shop.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old and widowed with one child in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is a farmer who carries out cattle fattening. He is a fifty six year old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His cattle farm has a number of animals which look healthy, however it would be more nice-looking if he was not limited by capital 
As a result he has decided to re invest in other businesses like crop farming for increased household income.

John Bosco is requesting for a loan to buy more cows to add in his farm. With the profit from cattle fattening he hopes to have enough income to give his wife and the school going children quality education and improved standard of living. A loan would help him to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add in his farm

loans.name: Mwanamtama

texts.en:
Mwanamtama is a married woman with five children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor  piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one  and half years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Soso

texts.en:
Soso, 44 years old, lives in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He is married and has 3 children; his wife is a hospital nurse. Soso works at the national security service and earns a fixed salary. He wants to create a private source of income to improve his family's living conditions and to help him to lead the family more effectively.

Soso applied for credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting people to start or re-start businesses. Soso has been approved for a loan of $1,100 US, which he will use to purchase a significant quantity of cement and sand and to open a block workshop. Soso already owns all the necessary equipment and machinery and will start making blocks for selling at the local open market.

Soso is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his children with good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Soso is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate private and significant income.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand and to open a block workshop

loans.name: Ununio Group

texts.en: Clara is in her early 40s. She is single and has three children, one of whom is in school. The others are grown up. She has been a food vendor for seven years. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Clara’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock in her mama lishe (food stall). She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit from her business to pay for school fees, to repay her loan, and cover household expenses. With this loan, she will restock items in her mama lishe store. Clara dreams of being a big business woman and to build her own house. She will share this loan with her loan group Ununio, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock items in her food stall.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 30 years old. She is married and blessed with 3 children. 

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 6 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty two thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children and expand her business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer for improved production.

loans.name: Mti Mrefu Group

texts.en: Joyce, who is in her mid- thirties, is single and has no children. She has been selling secondhand clothes for three and a half years. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be Joyce's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy best-quality, secondhand clothes to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of buying and selling the most secondhand clothes. She will share this loan with her loan group Mti Mrefu, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy best-quality, secondhand clothes to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with 4 children. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile place and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida, a 53-year-old housewife, is from the Zestaponi district. She is married and has a son, who lives abroad. The only breadwinner in the family is Lida's husband, who works at the local factory and earns a fixed income, which is hardly enough for the family's well-being. Lida wants to do her bit and generate her own income to cover some family costs on her own. She couldn’t receive a loan from local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or a stable revenue. However, the Start Up program, a joint product of Kiva and Credo, allows rural poor people like Lida to get a chance to start or restart a business.

Lida is going to use her loan to purchase stock of various products for a general store, which will be opened near her house. Lida will work as a saleswoman and will have customers among local people and passersby. This opportunity will give Lida a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Thanks to the Start Up program, she will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of products and to open a general store near the house.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he offers transport services. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service his vehicle. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase soda, mineral water and beer.

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en:
Hanifan is 56 years old, widow. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son who is also shown in the photo. He assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands .

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 41 years old and is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses, she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Lynet

texts.en:
Lynet is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, salt, cooking oil,flour and other items and has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil, flour and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have a wholesale business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil, flour and other items

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en: Bertha, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two kids who are still in school. She has been selling clothes and shoes for eight years. She works from 7:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. This will be Bertha's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her inventory of  clothes and hand bags and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees for her two kids, to renovate her house, to repay loan, to reinvest in her business, and to pay household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her stock of up-to-date clothes and hand bags for resale. She dreams of expanding her business. Bertha, will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date clothes and hand bags for resale.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is 44 years, lives with her two kids and her husband in Marka, her husband is ‎working with low income and her barely can cover the household expenses.
‎
Munira is a woman who likes to work to help her husband succeed. She sells a variety of ‎products, such as accessories and soaps that she is making. She likes her work, because this is where she earns enough for herself as well as what is ‎needed to care for her son.
‎
Munira wants to expand and develop her work. Therefore she applied for a loan to use it to ‎buy equipment and materials to make more products to sell.‎
Her dreams are to move forward, with the help from the loans.‎

loans.use: to ‎buy equipment and materials to make more accessories and soap to sell.‎.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus, who works under the artistic name "J. Blas", is an artisan from Mexico who specializes in iron wall art. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including sheet metal and paint, as well as new metal cutting tools for his workshop.

Jesus has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"When I was 17, I started my own ceramic workshop. But I changed directions and began to work in wrought iron and blown glass. I experimented with sheets of iron to give my works more movement. We cut the metal sheets, hammer them into shape and weld them before treating to retard rust. Every piece created at my workshop goes hand in hand with originality, design and quality. We are always developing new designs and products.

I'd like to thank you from the bottom of my heart for your generosity and vision through this microcredit. This will help us continue with our craft and provide a better future for our children."

Use the link below to view Jesus's iron wall art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3675

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including sheet metal and paint, as well as new metal cutting tools for his workshop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Idibek

texts.en:
Idibek was born in 1994. He is single and lives with his parents in Tajikistan. He is a hardworking and smart young man. He is a student.

Idibek studies at the fourth course. He studies well and he is one of the best students. Idibek reads a lot of books and he wants to be a good specialist in future.

Idibek is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to pay for university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Daylin

texts.en: Daylin has been running her fishing business for many years. She works very hard to earn more profit to support her family's daily needs and to pay her children's school fees. With the help of her husband who fishes, Daylin has been able to sell plenty of fish in the market. She wants to improve and expand her business. She recently took a new loan to cover the maintenance costs of her pumpboat, in order to catch more fish and deliver it to her customers. Daylin wants to improve the living conditions of her entire family.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance costs of her pumpboat.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells beauty products and has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Riza is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like towel, school uniform, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing retail business.

Riza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like towel, school uniform, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a weaver from Mexico who specializes in traditional handwoven Zapotec rugs and accessories. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of thread and firewood and bring on additional weavers at his workshop.

Alberto has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

Alberto is the fourth generation in a family dedicated to Zapotec weavings. "I remember as a child watching my father working on the loom while my mother and grandmother carded and dyed the wool. We shear the fleece, spin it and dye it with tints from the cochineal insect, pomegranate peel, bark from the huajal tree that thrives here, as well as oak and pecan bark. Stones, dried flowers, almost all the rocks and flowers here yield natural colors."

"We are very grateful for your support of our family workshop. This microcredit will allow us to continue working in this craft that we love."

Use the link below to view Alberto's traditional handwoven Zapotec rugs and accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4559

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of thread and firewood and to bring on additional weavers at his workshop.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is 37 years old. She is married and is a business woman. She is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop where she sells second-hand clothes; she also sells in the market.

Domingas has been involving in business activities for the past year. She started the business with her own working capital. She is earning a good income from selling second-hand clothes because many people like to buy them, and because they are cheap and unique compared to new clothes. She is still happy to do her business.

loans.use: to buy girl's trousers, men's trousers, shirts, and other second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old and deals in charcoal buying and selling to the local people in her home area. This is supplemented by cocoa growing for income generation. She is single mother of one child living in Bundibugyo Uganda.

She started charcoal selling 2 years back to raise income to support the family’s increasing demands. Her family desire is to buy more land and increase cocoa growing and she also has a business dream of establishing a bigger charcoal store and be able make bigger sales and profits. Her business is affected by unpredictable changes in weather and high transport costs hindering her returns. She is requesting for a loan to buy charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rabi

texts.en:
Rabi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Rabi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabi would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Rabi can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Rabi will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Rabi is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Qorihuayrachina Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORIHUAYRACHINA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maritza ,la socia continua con su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y también ,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en: The members belong to the communal bank “QORIHUAYRACHINA”. This bank is located in the district of Chinchero, belonging to the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco. Maritza is a member. She continues with her business selling and raising animals, and she has been working a long time in her business thanks to the hard work she puts in it every day. Maritza keeps raising her small animals in order to sell them later to the customers who request them. She wants to keep on working so she can continue supporting her family this way. She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs, among other things. The other members work in the businesses of sweets, sale of clothes, grocery store and restaurant.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, among other things.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en: Mely has owned and managed her vegetable garden for many years. She's earning well and has been sustaining her living and the business. Mely was able to use her generated income to successfully repay her previous loan. Improving her business is easier with her access to GDMPC. Mely recently took a new loan to buy fertilizer for her crops. She plans to use the additional profit generated by the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her garden

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak lives with his parents, brother and elderly retired grandfather. He opened an internet cafe in Noyemberyan town three years ago. There, he provides different types of computer services and receives his clients with pleasure. He does everything to satisfy his clients' needs and stay competitive in the market.

After his first profit started to appear, Artak decided to enlarge the services he provides. He is asking for this loan to purchase chairs for the internet cafe. The loan will be helpful for him to enlarge his business and give him an opportunity to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for chairs for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en: Lucresia, 60 years old, is married and has six children. For the past four years, Lucresia has been raising livestock in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. Lucresia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Yohanna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Yohanna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Yohanna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Yohanna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Pretze

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Pretze works hard to support her family.

She raises livestock in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Pretze is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Pretze has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ulpat

texts.ru: Улпат, 51 год, замужем, есть 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении 15 лет она, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Улпат, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы. Для собственного потребления выращивает овощи и фрукты в огороде. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 37,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Улпат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, также хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Ulpat is 51 years old, married, with three children.  She has a secondary education.  In order to provide her family with a source of income, she has been involved in animal husbandry for the past 15 years, having started with a capital of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has three cows on her farm.  She also has an orchard where she grows fruits and vegetables for the family's own consumption.  Her monthly income comes up to about 37,000 som (KGS).  

Eager to further develop her farming business, Ulpat has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum bank, and she is taking a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy three heifers and increase her cattle headcount.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further growing her farming business.  She also intends to save enough money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy three heifers in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional items to sell in her kiosk, such as rice, phone cards, hard drinks, and other things. She has a kiosk in her house, and she also sells in the market on market days. The photo shows her selling in the market. Marciana started her kiosk a few years ago, with her own working capital. She is happy with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to give her more working capital to buy more goods.

She also raises animals like cows, pigs, dogs, and chickens.

loans.use: to buy rice, phone cards, hard drinks, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Heriberto con 46 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, en el distrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Heriberto cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Heriberto se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de café,con una experiencia de más de 10 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y para invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera obtendría mayores rendimientos,mejorando la calidad de vida de él y la de su familia.

Heriberto es recurrente para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, ha manejado tres créditos los cuáles lo a cancelado de manera puntualmente.
texts.en:
Heriberto, who is 46 years old, in a common law relationship, lives with his common law spouse and three children in the Colasay district, in the province of Jaen, department of Cajamarca in Peru.

Heriberto has good personal and professional references from the inhabitants of his area. Most of the population in this area works in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry.

Heriberto is an agricultural farmer, specifically, he cultivates coffee. He has more than ten years of experience.

He is requesting this loan to buy manure and invest in the maintenance of his farm. This way, he can obtain higher earnings, improving the quality of life for him and his family.

Heriberto is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa institution as he has managed three previous loans which he has paid off punctually.

loans.use: buy manure and invest in the maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro con 44 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Pedro cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Pedro se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, ubicado en el caserío Sondor del distrito de Pomahuaca, con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarias, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para deshierbo de sus parcelas del cultivo de café. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Pedro es socio nuevo para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
44-year-old Pedro lives with his common law partner and children in their own home made with rustic materials. They live in the district of Pomahuaca, province of Jaen, region of Cajamarca in Peru. Pedro has very good personal and work references in his region. The area's inhabitants work mainly in agriculture, commerce and cattle raising. 

Pedro works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 15 years of experience in this occupation. He will use the loan to pay for agricultural works, application of phytosanitary products, fertilizers and to cover the labor for weeding his coffee crops. This will improve his crops physiologically, morphologically and in terms of productivity. These actions will also help him have a timely harvest and larger production, which will lead to a better quality and ease at selling his product.

Pedro is a new member of the Edpyme Alternativa association.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural works, application of phytosanitary products, fertilizers and to cover the labor for weeding his coffee crops.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 45 years old, married, and has children. She is applying for a loan of 800 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a kiosk in her house, and she also sells in the market. She always brings her goods to sell in the market on market days. Filomena has been involved in business activities since 2011. She started with her own working capital of 100 USD. She is earning a good income from her business because many people are interested in her goods.

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more items such as detergents, hand lotion, perfume, hair oils, shampoo, soaps, toothpaste, and other things to sell. She is still happy to do her business.

She also has animals like buffalo, cows, pigs, chickens, goats, and dogs.

loans.use: to buy detergents, hand lotion, perfume, hair oils, shampoo, soaps, toothpaste, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 46 years old, married, and has three children to provide for. To earn a living and be able to help her husband in providing for the needs of her family, she engaged in a banana production business. She plants bananas and sells them to the market.

She aims to increase her income because of the increasing price of commodities nowadays, so she decided to borrow a loan to pay the replanting labor cost for her banana farm. In this way, she can produce a good quality of bananas and can deliver more bananas in the market, which will generate more income.

Merlyn's plan for the future is to save money out from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to pay the replanting labor cost.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cecil is 30 years old, and her two children are in school.

Cecil has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and ingredients for her business.

Cecil has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy, tiene la edad  de 32 años, está soltero,  vive con sus hermanos y sus padres que se ayudan mutuamente. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de maíz de buena calidad y germinación y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Roy is 32 years old. He is single and lives with his siblings and parents who help each other. With his loan he wants to buy good quality corn seed, fertilizers and other products to use in his cultivation. Also he wants to pay for hand labor to use these products, and to help with the crop once it has grown in order to ensure doing a good job. What he wants is to take advantage of the good climate and soil conditions of this area for this type of crop, and also to put into practice the experience of many years planting basic grains. Also, he will be able to buy the best products of best quality so that his crops develop well and are healthy, as well as to have an adequate harvest and an important production in the short term. The income from the harvest that he expects to get, he wants to use in the well being and education of his family, to achieve some family goals and to keep on investing more in his crops. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had any other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow corn.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 children. Her business is running a food cafe and farming. 

She has been in the business for 5 years. She earns a monthly income of fifty eight thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to purchase milk, sugar, rice, cooking oil, wheat and maize flour etc. for the restaurant.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to service the loan and educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and educate her children to tertiary level.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, rice, cooking oil, wheat and maize flour etc. for the restaurant.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, soap, sugar, flour, salt and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years. he will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items.

loans.name: Reiner

texts.es:
Reiner con 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge e hijo, en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Reiner cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Reiner se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café ,con una experiencia en el rubro de 6 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cuál no tendrá problemas en vender su producto. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo como maíz, fréjol, yuca, rocoto, ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el crédito.

Reiner es socio recurrente para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Reiner firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
39-year-old Reiner lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his common law partner and their son. They live in the district of Pomahuaca, province of Jaen, region of Cajamarca in Peru. Reiner has very good personal and work references in his region. 

Reiner works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 6 years of experience. He will use the loan to pay for agricultural works, application of phytosanitary products, fertilizers and for labor costs. This will help his crops physiologically, morphologically and in terms of productivity. These actions will also help him have a timely harvest, a larger production, better product quality and will make it easier to sell his product. He also grows corn, beans, yucca and rocoto. The extra income he makes from growing these products will help him repay the loan. 

Reiner is a member of the Edpyme Alternativa association.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural works, application of phytosanitary products, fertilizers and for labor costs.

loans.name: Jolimel

texts.en:
In the past, Jolimel didn’t know where to get supplementary capital to buy necessities for her food business. Some of her earnings are compromised for settling bills and other daily expenses of the family. She’s grateful when she was introduced to Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and has assisted her with the business several times now including the Php 9,000 she has received five months ago. She was able to buy business’ essentials and keep the needed capital rolling. She want to thank lenders for the financial provision which was extended to her.

She also considers the health problem of her family to be her challenge since medicines are expensive that add to her bills. She’s praying that God will continually give them good health so that she can focus and make improvement on her business. She is applying for another loan worth Php 9,000 for her to buy raw ingredients needed for her food business. She’s praying that lenders would consider her story once more.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Jolimel spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to be used for buying more raw ingredients for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Swarnalata's Group

texts.en:
Swarnalata is a resident of Nayagarh district, Odisha, India. She managed managed to establish a general store on the sidewalk. These areas lack this type of business because the majority of families eat what they produce in the fields.

Swarnalata is a divorced mother of two children, ages 6 and 9, who mean the world to her. She works between 10 and 12 hours per day just so they have a better future by going to school and having the opportunities that she could not have due to the lack of resources.

She learned the business empirically, and now she has a plan. She wants to strengthen her business. You can help increase her income so she is able to pay for her children to attend school.

She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. With the help of a loan, she will use her portion to buy an assortment of items, mostly products that are not produced by the land, such as cleaning supplies in general, spices, biscuits, and some grains and vegetables that are not commonly grown. This loan will help her to improve her sales and diversify the products she offers.

Swarnalata is standing to the right hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase products that are not produced by the land, such as cleaning supplies in general, spices, biscuits, and some grains and vegetables.

loans.name: Raima

texts.ru: Райма, 63 года, вдова. У нее среднее образование, с 1985 года занимается сельским хозяйством. Несколько лет назад произошел форс-мажор, до фундамента полностью сгорел ее дом и все нажитое имущество. Райма с детьми отстроили дом заново. Благодаря упорному труду Раймы, ей удалось восстановить дом и развить ее хозяйство. На сегодняшний день имеется: 13 коров, 4 овцы. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнес деятельности Раймы составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойное содержание семьи и воспитание детей. В целях развития своего дела, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров с телятами. Доходы от кредита позволят Райме развить ее бизнес, улучшить благосостояние семьи и приобрести грузовой автомобиль для бизнеса.
texts.en:
Raima is a 63-year-old widow.  She has a secondary education and she has been working in agriculture since 1985.  A few years ago, she was the victim of an unforeseeable event: her house burned down to its foundations and Raima lost all possessions.  Raima and her children had to rebuild the entire house.  Thanks to her incredible effort, she was able to rebuild and to start developing her farming business again.  She currently has 13 cows and four sheep on her farm, and she makes about 20,000 som (KGS) every month from her business.  However, this amount of money is not enough for the family to enjoy a decent life nor to pay for the children's education.

Eager to develop her farming business, Raima has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum bank, and requested a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy a few dairy cows with their calves.  The profits from her loan will allow her to grow her business, improve her family's well-being, and buy a truck for her business.

loans.use: to buy a few dairy cows with their calves in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Tammy

texts.en:
Tammy Davis started Unique Styles and Apparel for people who want the boutique experience without the boutique prices. Operating out of Bartlett, Tennessee, Tammy owns her own storefront boutique. As a new startup, she prides herself on providing excellent customer service and makes it her goal to get customers coming back and again and again.

She has always had a passion for fashion, so opening Unique Styles and Apparel was an obvious choice. “I just jumped out there and started ordering from different vendors,” said Tammy. However, demand outweighed supply, and Tammy found herself running short on inventory.

With her loan, Tammy will not only be able to purchase additional inventory, but she’ll be able to expand her customer base.

“I consider myself very fortunate to be able to own my own business, and I’ve worked so hard for this,” said Tammy. “I have the opportunity to bring other women happiness in making them feel good about what they wear and good about themselves – that is the best part.”

loans.use: to pay for inventory for her boutique.

loans.name: Yessenia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yessenia, administra una venta de pupusas y de tortillas, vive con dos hijos y su madre, aprendió a realizar estas actividades desde muy pequeña con el apoyo de su madre, en el negocio su madre le colabora para atender a los clientes.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de harina de arroz, maíz, leña, aceite, quesillo, tomates, aderezos, etc., para preparar la venta de pupusas y tortillas, espera tener clientes satisfechos, aumentar ventas e ingresos.
Su visión es continuar trabajando para salir adelante con sus obligaciones y darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Yessenia has a business selling "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) and tortillas. She lives with her two children and her mother. She learned these activities since she was very young with her mother's support. In the business, her mother helps her assisting customers. She will use the loan to buy rice flour, corn, firewood, oil, fresh cheese, tomatoes, spices, etc. to prepare "pupusas" and tortillas to sell. She hopes to have satisfied customers and improve her sales and income. Her vision is to continue working to move ahead with her obligations, and to give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice flour, corn, firewood, oil, fresh cheese, tomatoes, spices, etc. to prepare "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) and tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 42 years old, married woman. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Nusrat expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Zhanargul

texts.ru: Жанаргул, 32 года, замужем, 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день Жанаргул имеет хороший бизнес, у нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы. На 2,0 Га земли она выращивает клевер и рис для реализации. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жанаргул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует направлять в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Zhanargul is 32, married, with four children.  She has a secondary education and she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for the past 10 years.  She currently has a nice farming business which includes three cows as well as two hectares of land on which she grows clover and rice for resale.  She makes a total monthly income of about 13,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her business, Zhanargul has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy ten sheep for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her farming business and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Alimhan

texts.ru: Алимхан, 41 год, вдова, мать 4 детей. У Алимхан - среднее образование, она на протяжении 15 лет работает воспитателем в детском саду. Дополнительно занимается животноводством. Алимхан очень любит свою деятельность в хозяйстве есть 10 овец. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. Накопления Алимхан старается вкладывать в образование и воспитание детей, а также в развитие бизнеса. В этом году Алимхан потребовалось сделать дома ремонт, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря кредиту, Алимхан сможет улучшить условия проживания ее семьи, сохранив поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Alimhan is a 41-year-old widow with four children.  She has a secondary education and she has been working as a preschool teacher for the past 15 years. In addition to her job, she also raises livestock, an activity which she loves.  She currently has 10 sheep and she makes a monthly income of 7,000 som (KGS), which is not enough for a decent standard of living.  Alimhan tries to reinvest her savings into her children's upbringing and education and also into her business' expansion.

This year, Alimhan needs to perform some repairs in her house, and for this reason she has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum bank, and requested a loan of 60,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and to keep her livestock.

loans.use: to buy some construction materials to perform some repairs in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a new griddle and other products for the sale of pupusas and food, thus improving her sales.

loans.name: Maria Lizeth

texts.es: María es una mujer emprendedora que a sus 40 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad la cual logro comprar hace 10 años y en la que vive con sus 3 hijos de 11, 7 y 2 años y su esposo. María es una mujer que se esfuerza cada día para poder brindar lo mejor a su familia, es por ello que se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante desde hace 5 años, por lo que cada día cuenta con más clientes que solicitan sus productos, siendo su negocio de mucho éxito. María desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena y pines para cambiar el techo y brindar protección a su familia.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising woman, who at 40 years of age lives in a home she owns and bought 10 years ago, where she lives with her three children aged 11, 7 and 2, and her husband.

María is a woman who makes an effort every day to provide the best to her family and that's why she is an ambulant salesperson, selling clothing for the last 5 years. She has more clients every day and they solicit her products because her business is successful.

María hopes to change the roof on her home, since this one has deteriorated, and so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized aluminum, cement, sand and nails in order to change the roof and provide protection for her family.

loans.use: invest in galvanized aluminum, cement, sand, and nails in order to change the roof and provide protection for her family.

loans.name: Rosa Armida

texts.es:
Rosa, se encuentra acompañada, no tiene dependientes, vive con su pareja, su negocio es cultivar y vender hortalizas, para realizar esta actividad ella tomo clases, no tiene un horario definido y cuenta con experiencia en el área.
Ella invertirá en abono, semilla  de chile y tomate, también podrá reparar el invernadero, de esta manera protegerá su  plantación de plagas y desarrollara sus actividades con normalidad, su intención es tener su negocio funcionando para subsistir.
Su aspiración es cambiar el estilo de vida familiar teniendo acceso a mejor alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
Rosa cohabits, has no dependents and lives with her partner. Her business is cultivating and selling vegetables. She took classes for this occupation. She doesn’t have a defined schedule and counts on experience in the area.

She will invest in fertilizer, chili and tomato seeds. She’ll also be able to fix the greenhouse, protecting her farm from plagues and will develop her occupation normally. 

Her intention is to have her business running in order to survive. Her aspiration is to change the family lifestyle through access to better food and health.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizers, chili and tomato seeds. She’ll also be able to fix the greenhouse, protecting her farm from plagues.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 34 años de edad vive muy feliz en su vivienda propia la cual logro adquirir con mucho esfuerzo hace 18 años, y en la que vive en compañía de su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijas de 18, 13 y 1 años de edad. Esmeralda buscando la manera de sobre llevar la economía de su hogar se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de ropa, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante, por lo que ha logrado una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Esmeralda ha observado que cada día el techo de su vivienda se encuentra más deteriorado y en época de invierno el agua se filtra, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI que le permita cambiar el techo de su vivienda, invirtiendo en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar el techo y brindar protección a su familia.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a hardworking 34-year-old woman. She lives very happily in her own home, which she was able to acquire through much effort eighteen years ago. She lives there with her life partner and three daughters, ages 18, 13, and 1. Looking for a way to deal with her household expenses, Esmeralda has been working for five years as a street vendor selling clothing. She has gained a large number of customers who seek out her products.

Esmeralda has observed that every day, the roof of her home gets more and more deteriorated, and it leaks in the winter. She is requesting a FUSAI loan to be able to replace the roof of her home, investing in galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire, in order to replace the roof and provide protection to her family.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire, in order to replace her roof and provide protection to her family.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo con 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Lorenzo cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Lorenzo se dedica al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder abonar su finca de café.De esta manera con la compra de abonos podrá incrementar sus rendimientos en su cosecha venidera.

Lorenzo es socio recurrente para nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa, a manejado tres créditos los cuáles a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 33, lives with his wife and children in the district of Cañaris, in Ferreñafe province, department of Lambayeque, in Perú. Lorenzo has good references both personal and professional from the inhabitants in the area.

Lorenzo is a coffee farmer with 10 years of experience in this work.

He is requesting this loan to buy the tools he needs to fertilize his coffee crops. That way, with the manure purchase, he can improve the yield of his crops.

Lorenzo is a recurring member of the Edpyme Alternativa communal bank, as he has managed three previous loans, which he has paid off.

loans.use: buy the tools he needs to fertilize his coffee crops.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe con 46 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su cónyuge y sus tres hijos de 18,16,13 años de edad, en el distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Guadalupe cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Guadalupe se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café , ubicado en Caserio de chilasque – cañaris con una experiencia en el rubro de 20 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá una mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cuál no tendrá problemas en vender su producto. Adicionalmente se dedica a labores de peón agrícola.

Guadalupe es socio recurrente para nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con cónyuge.
texts.en:
Guadalupe at 46 years of age is in a common-law relationship. He lives in his own house made of basic materials together with his spouse and his three children aged 18, 16 and 13 years old. They live in the district of Cañaris, Ferreñafe province, in the department of Lambayeque, Perú. Guadalupe has very good references both personal and from work from the inhabitants of the area.

Guadalupe works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee in the village of Chilasque – Cañaris. He has 20 years of experience in the field. He will use the loan that he has been awarded for his agricultural work, applying and incorporating phyto sanitary products, fertilizer and pay for labor for his harvest. Doing this will help him improve his crops physiologically, morphologically and productively so he can have a timely harvest. In the end he can have better production, a higher quality product so he will have no problem selling his product. He also works as an agricultural laborer.

Guadalupe is a repeat client of the Edpyme Alternativa financial institution. He is signing with his spouse.

loans.use: to use in agricultural work, applying and incorporating phytosanitary products, fertilizer and pay for labor to harvest.

loans.name: Jovanna Lucia

texts.es: Jovanna es una joven de 20 años que se encuentra comprometida con su cónyuge y reside en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, ella aprendió de su padre un comerciante empírico que la encaminó a entablar su propio negocio por medio de la venta de mercancías varias, labor que le ha dado la oportunidad de generar ingresos y tener un mejor nivel de vida. Con el apoyo de su cónyuge quien le suministró sus ahorros para su capital de negocio, ha logrado cumplir con los encargos que le solicita su clientela conformada por vecinos y amigos, sin embargo su capital no le es suficiente para abastecer todas las demanda de sus clientes es por ello que aplicó a una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar prendas de vestir para toda la familia; blusas, jeans, pantalones y calzado, así mismo invertirá en una nueva línea de productos para el hogar; mecedoras, multimuebles, closet entre otros.  Su meta de negocio es ampliarlo y formalizarlo en un espacio de su vivienda en el que pueda exhibir vitrinas con productos, así garantizará un mayor ingreso.  Su meta familiar es comprar su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Jovanna is a 20 year-old young woman who is engaged to her partner and lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquilla. She learned from her father, a self-taught businessman, who inspired her to start her own business selling various kinds of merchandise. This has allowed her to generate income and have a better standard of living.

With the help of her partner who lent her his savings to start her business, she has been able to fill the orders from her customers, who are neighbors and friends. Nonetheless she does not have enough money to fulfill all of her customer orders.

This is why she has requested a loan, her first with Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy clothing for the whole family: blouses, jeans, pants and shoes. She will also invest in a new line of household products: rocking chairs, entertainment centers and wardrobes, among other things.

Her goal is for her business to grow, and to finish out a space within her home where she can have display cases with her products, thereby securing a greater income.

Her goal for her family is to buy a larger home.

loans.use: to buy clothing for the whole family: blouses, jeans, pants and shoes. She'll also invest in a new line of products for the home: rocking chairs, entertainment stations, and wardrobes, among other things.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Arístides convive con su familia integrada por su esposa e hijos, comenta que sus hijos trabajan y no dependen de él, su fuente de ingresos principal es dar el servicio de sastre, sus clientes son las personas que viven en las cercanías de su comunidad, fabrica pantalones y camisas, no tiene ayuda de parientes en el extranjero.
Necesita de un crédito para comprar telas, hilos, botones, broches, etc., el resto lo utilizará para pagar el mantenimiento de las máquinas de coser, con la inversión tendrá los materiales necesarios para trabajar por una larga temporada y mejorara el servicio que ofrece, espera que la afluencia de clientes crezca.
Sus aspiraciones son generar más ingresos para tener un estilo de vida mucho más digndo.
texts.en:
Arístides lives with his family, composed of his wife and kids. He mentions that his kids work and do not depend on him. His principal source of income is working as a tailor. His customers are the people that live near his community. He makes pants and shirts. He does not receive help from family members living abroad. 

He needs a loan to buy fabrics, string, buttons, clasps, etc. The rest he will use to pay for maintenance on the sewing machines. With the investment, he’ll have the necessary materials to work a long season and will improve the service he offers. 

He hopes that the influx of clients will grow. His aspiration is to generate more income to have a much more worthy lifestyle.
