loans.use: to buy fabrics, string, buttons, clasps, etc. The rest he will use to pay for maintenance on the sewing machines.

loans.name: Mirian Noemi

texts.es:
Mirian cumple con el rol de madre y padre para su hija de 7 años de edad, para sacar adelante a su hija se dedica a vender productos de belleza y de uso personal como: lociones, cosméticos, cremas, desodorantes, etc., inicio esta actividad hace 10 años, su horario es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, se esmera por mantener su negocio pues es su única fuente de ingresos.
Planea ofrecer un inventario más surtido a sus clientes, por tal motivo solicita un crédito con el que comprara labiales, lociones, cremas corporales, rubores, etc., así tendrá la oportunidad de cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, espera que tanto las ventas como las ganancias crezcan.
Su visión es tener un negocio más grande y popular en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mirian serves as both mother and father for her seven-year-old daughter. In order to provide for her daughter, she works selling beauty and personal use products such as lotions, cosmetics, creams, and deodorants. She began this business ten years ago. She works from 8 am to 5 pm. She works hard to maintain her business, since it is her only source of income.

She plans to offer her customers a more varied product inventory, so she is requesting a loan which she will use to buy lipstick, lotion, body cream, blush, etc. This will give her the opportunity to cover her customers' needs. She hopes that both her sales and profits will increase.

Her vision is to have a larger and more popular business in her community.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, lotion, body cream, blush, etc., to have the opportunity to cover her customers' needs.

loans.name: Minati's Group

texts.en:
Minati, 42, standing in the middle in the photograph, lives in her own humble home made of daub and wattle in a small village in Nayagarh district, Odisha, India. She has lived there for a number of years with her husband and their two daughters, ages 14 and 16.

Minati works as a grocer in the community and provides quality service to a large customer base. This is how she has been able to support the household finances. Minati is well known by her neighbors for being an honest and hardworking woman.

Minati, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy sand, cement, a flush toilet, steel, and other materials to build a septic system so that she can provide her family with better hygiene.

She hopes to be able to rely on this loan because she wants to do this project as soon as possible so that she can provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, a flush toilet, steel, and other materials to build a septic system.

loans.name: Ruchina

texts.en:
Ruchina is 40 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Ruchina works very hard to provide for them.

Ruchina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like biscuits, snack foods, juice, candies, soft-drinks, etc. to sell. Ruchina has been in this business for seven years and she sells a variety of items.

In the future, Ruchina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like biscuits, snack foods, juice, candies, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 57 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for three years and earns additional income from selling rice grains.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Her name is Emerenciana, aged 60, from the province of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is widowed and has not remarried, for she has dedicated her life to raising her children. She feels a sense of fulfillment now that her children are already working. Her source of livelihood is her mineral water selling and her boarding house rental.

She would like to request a PHP 8,000 loan to pay for several gallons of mineral water. She is glad that there are CCT and Kiva, who support and encourage small businesswomen like her. Her income allows her to live independently and not burden her children with her daily needs.

Emerenciana aims to expand her water distribution and boarding house to enable her to save for her senior years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for several gallons of mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 49 years old and single.

Flordeliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries such as milk, juice, canned goods, noodles, vinegar, etc. to sell. Flordeliza has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as milk, juice, canned goods, noodles, vinegar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jesilinda

texts.en:
Jesilinda is 43 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are currently in school.

Jesilinda is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Jesilinda has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jesilinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Margie requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 50 years now.

Margie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc. for her business

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Дилорам 48 летняя швея. Она занимается швейной деятельности около 6 лет. В течение 6 лет Дилором освоила много чего швейной деятельности. Она сейчас хорошо справляется со своей работой. Она в день шьет 2 платье за 35 TJS. У нее имеется постоянный доход. 
Дилором живет в городе Турсунзаде. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. У нее один сын и две дочери. Сын вместе с отцом на рынке занимается торговлей деятельности. У Дилором дома идет стройка и ремонт, она хочет купить стройматериалы и другие принадлежности для ремонта. У нее план взять кредит и закончит стройку и ремонт. Дилором верит в Вас и на Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilorom is a 48 year old seamstress. She has gained significant expertise during the six years that she has worked in this sphere, and is now very skilled. She can sew two dresses a day, earning 35 TJS each, which provides her a reliable income. Dilorom lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. Her son and his father work as salespeople in the market.

Dilorom's home is currently being remodeled. Her plan is to obtain a loan to finish the remodel. She believes in you and your kindness.

loans.use: pay for home remodeling

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en: Diosdado is a hard-working father from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 53 years old and a businessman who makes copra. He buys whole coconuts for this. Diosdado has signed his membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. He applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Diosdado hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 40 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are currently in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teresita has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 49 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are currently in school.

Charita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Charita has been in pig fattening for nine years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Charita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sahondra Marie Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Marie Jacqueline a 43 ans, elle est mariée. Le conjoint est un maçon Le couple a quatre enfants dont deux sont déjà mariés, les deux autres scolarisés sont, âgés respectivement de 14 ans et 5 ans. 
Marie Jacqueline a commencé l’activité d’élevage de poulets de chair en 2014. C’est une activité à cycle court, le cycle d’élevage ne dure que 45 jours.  Elle est actuellement à son troisième prêt pour développer l’activité. Elle s’adonne également au lavage de linge comme activité génératrice de revenus. .  La réussite d’une activité d’élevage de poulets de chair dépend de la régularité de la production pour l’approvisionnement des clients et de l’existence d’une quantité suffisante de provende pour le suivi des normes liées à l’alimentation du cheptel.  
Son rêve est de pouvoir toujours développer l’activité d’élevage de poulets de chair en augmentant petit à petit l’effectif du cheptel  et abandonner la deuxième activité ( lavage de linge ) qui est devenue de plus en plus fatigante à son âge.
texts.en:
Marine Jacqueline is 43 years old and married. Her husband is a bricklayer They have four children: two of them are already married, and the two youngest (14 and 5 years of age, respectively) attend school.

Marie Jacqueline started raising  broiler  chickens in 2014. This business has a short cycle as raising poultry takes only 45 days. She is now on her third loan intended to help grow her business. She also washes linens to earn an income. The success of a poultry business depends on being able to  provide a delivery to customers on a regular basis and to keep an ample stock of feed in accordance with the nutritional  norms for poultry.

Marie Jacqueline's dream is to keep developing her poultry business, increasing the number of chickens, and to drop her secondary business (washing linens), which is becoming more and more tiring at her age.

loans.use: to buy 100 broiler chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Простая женщина Саодат. Ей 44 года. Она жительница района Хуросон. Саодат семейная женщина. Ее муж на данный момент находится вдали от семьи, на заработках в Российской Федерации. Он уехал по причине, что не смог найти себе подходящую работу в стране. Ее муж любить свою семью, и он старается ради детей и жены. Саодат тоже заботливая и трудолюбивая жена. Она на районе занимается животноводством. Саодат 13 лет выращивает скота. Она хочет приобрести еще пару коров для увеличения их численность. Саодат решила взять кредит и за счет кредита расширить животноводческую деятельность.
texts.en: Saodat is a simple woman. She is 44 years old and lives in the Khuroson district. She is a family-centered person, though her husband is currently far away, working in Russia. He left because he couldn't find good work in their country but he loves his family and works hard for the benefit of his children and wife. Saodat is a caring and hard-working wife. She practices animal husbandry, as she has for the past 13 years. She wants to buy another pair of cows to expand her herd. Saodat decided to request a loan and to use it to expand her business.

loans.use: buy livestock to expand her business

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Rosalia is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Chuchi

texts.en: Chuchi has been selling a variety of food for many years. The business is earning well, and it allows her to earn 10,000 PHP a month. With this generated income, she will be able to repay her previous loan and send her children in school. To expand and improve her business, she took out a new loan to buy more fruit to sell to her customers. In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Marsel

texts.ru: Марсель, 26 лет, женат, есть двух летняя дочь. У него средне-специальное образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством вот уже 7 лет. Благодаря упорному труду ответственному подходу и трудолюбию Марселя, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, Марсель обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров. Доходы от кредита Марсель планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение его бизнеса.
texts.en: Marsel is 26 years old, married, and has a two-year-old daughter. He has a vocational high school education, and has practiced animal husbandry for the past seven years to support his family. Thanks to his persistence, responsibility, and hard-working nature today Marsel owns two cows. His monthly income is 17,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop his business Marsel asked Bai-Tushum Bank for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to buy dairy cows. He plans to invest earnings from use of the loan into further expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy additional dairy cows in order to increase his livestock headcount.

loans.name: Zhanylkan

texts.ru: Жанылкан, 59 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав около 20 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Жанылкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жанылкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 22,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена для корма скоту.  Кредитные средства помогут инвестировать в бизнес, сохранив поголовье скота. Доходы от кредита Жанылкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и закончить строительство дома.
texts.en: Zhanylkan is 59 years old, married, and has four children with her spouse. She has a high school education, and to earn income for her family she has raised livestock for the past 20 years. Thanks to her tireless work Zhanylkan today owns a cow and ten sheep. Her monthly income is around 13,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business Zhanylkan asked Bai-Tushum Bank for a 22,000 som (KGS) loan to buy hay to feed the livestock. The financial assistance will help her invest in the business by maintaining the livestock she has. She plans to invest income made from use of the loan into further increasing the number of livestock she owns and finishing construction of a house.

loans.use: to purchase hay as a feed for livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina está progresando con la ayuda de financiamientos, sus cultivos dan mejores cosechas por lo que puede mantener estabilidad económica, actualmente ya no cuenta con la tienda de productos de la canasta básica, su familia se mantiene con el mismo núcleo.
Hace la petición de un nuevo crédito con el que podrá comprar fertilizantes, abono e insecticidas con estos materiales la milpa tendrá un buen desarrollo, otra parte será destinado a pagar la preparación del terreno, tiene fe que la cosecha sea abundante.
texts.en:
Reina is progressing with the help of financements. Her crops yield better harvests through which she can maintain economic stability. Currently, she no longer has the general store. Her family remains with the same unit.

She’s petitioning for a new loan with which she’ll be able to buy fertilizers, manure and insecticides. With these materials, the milpa will have a good development. The other part will be  allocated to pay for the land’s preparation. She has faith that the harvest will be abundant.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and insecticides. With these materials, the milpa will have a good development.

loans.name: Maria Imelda

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora que  a sus 53 años de edad vive en casa de su propiedad la cual logro comprar hace 15 años y en la que vive con sus hijos y sus nietos, ya que luego de la pérdida de su esposo son su única compañía. María se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos en su comunidad, además de apoyar a sus hijos con el cuido de sus nietos, por lo que recibe ayuda económica por parte de sus hijos. El servicio sanitario de la vivienda de María se encuentra deteriorado, además como se observa en la fotografía no cuenta con un cuarto adecuado, por lo que solicita un  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y lámina para construir un nuevo servicio sanitario para cuidar de la sanidad de su hogar, ya que a causa del deterioro del servicio se contamina el aire en su vivienda y comunidad.
texts.en:
María is a working woman who, at 53-years old, lives in a house on her property, which she managed to buy 15 years ago and where she lives with her children and grandchildren. After losing her husband, they are her only company.

María works providing domestic services in her community, as well as supporting her children by taking care of her grandchildren for which she receives economic help from her children. The bathroom in María's house is deteriorating, and, as seen in the picture, it is not an adequate room. So, she is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and metal sheets to build a new bathroom in order to take care of her home's health, since the deterioration contaminates the air of her home and community.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and metal sheets to build a new bathroom.

loans.name: Ángela Del Socorro

texts.es: Ángela es una microempresaria de 56 años de edad que fue víctima del conflicto armado en su región y para salvaguardar su integridad y la de su familia, salió desplazada de sus tierras ubicadas en el Carmen de Bolívar en compañía de sus familiares. En medio de esta situación de incertidumbre se trasladó a un barrio en el municipio de Barranquilla y emprendió su negocio con unos ahorros ahorros e invirtió en gallinas criollas que propuso a los  vecinos del sector.  Hoy en día su oferta de productos no es tan limitada, ella también vende carne de cerdo por encargos y cuenta con diez años en esta actividad con la que ha logrado brindar bienestar a su hijo que aún es menor de edad y depende económicamente de ella. Su cadena de comercialización se expandió a tiendas de barrios quienes solicitan de sus productos por pedidos, en la actualidad aplicó a una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en gallinas criollas y carne de cerdo puesto que su capital le es insuficiente para cumplir oportunamente con la demanda.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio y contar con muchas más utilidades con las que pueda ofrecer estudios profesionales a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ángela is a 56 year old micro-entrepreneur who was victim of the armed conflict in her region. To safeguard her integrity and that of her family she fled her lands located in el Carmen de Bolívar with her family. In the midst of this uncertain situation she moved to a neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquilla and started a business with some savings. She invested in creole chickens that some of her neighbors of the area offered her.

Today her selection of products is not as limited as she also sells pig meat on order. She has been in the business for ten years and she has been able to provide for her son's well-being who is still a minor and is economically dependent on her. Her marketing chain has expanded to neighborhood stores who request her products on order.

She is currently applying for her first financing from Kiva made through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in creole chickens and pig meat. Her capital is insufficient to adequately fulfill her demand. Her goal for the future is to expand her business and be able to count on more profit with which she can offer professional studies to her son.

loans.use: invest in creole chickens and pig meat.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Carmelita requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Carmelita has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Desiree Ann Marie

texts.en:
Desiree Ann Marie is 25 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Desiree Ann Marie has a raising livestock business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Desiree Ann Marie has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Dorothy requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Dorothy has been in this business for 6 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Dorothy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 56 years old and has one child. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Andrea is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Andrea requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Andrea would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Ean is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Ean is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Ean has been raising pigs for 5 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 31 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Linda works very hard to provide for them.

Linda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Linda has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, fabric conditioners, candies, biscuits, coffee, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Linda would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Las Ovejas De Cristo Group

texts.es:
lAS OVEJAS DE CRISTO ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES SIETE MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE PADRES Y MADRES RESPONSABLES DE QUINCE HIJOS TODOS MENORES DE EDAD, ORGINARIOS DE MALPAISILLO, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGION, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE SU FAMILIA, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHA PARA SALIR ADELANTE DIA A DIA Y BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES DE VIDA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES ERNESTINA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE CUAJADA EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS OCHO HORA DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y COMPRA LECHE Y CUAJO PARA LA ELABORACION DE LA CUJADA Y LA VENTA A CLIENTES FIJOS EN DIFERENTES PULPERIAS DE LA LOCALIDAD. LAS OVEJAS DE CRISTOA AGRADECE LA AYUADA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES  NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The "Ovejas de Cristo" [Lambs of Christ] communal bank is made up of eight members, seven women and one man. They are responsible mothers and fathers of fifteen young children. They are from Malpaisillo, which is located in the north of the region. They are hardworking, responsible people who strive to get ahead. 

In their free time they like to spend time with their families. Currently they are struggling to get by day by day and offer their children better opportunities in life. Thanks to her desire to succeed, the group coordinator is Ernestina, who works in her business eight hours a day offering her products. The goal of the loan is to invest in capital and purchase milk and rennet to produce cheese curds and sell to regular clients in different grocery stores in the neighborhood. 

The "Ovejas de Cristo" communal bank is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders offer for people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that people can have dignified employment.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as milk and rennet for producing cheese curds.

loans.name: Ma. Eliza

texts.en:
Ma. Eliza, 43, is married with one child who is still in school.

Ma. Eliza is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ma. Eliza has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ma. Eliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 46 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Marife runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marife has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, shampoo, powder, sugar, noodles, canned goods and other household products.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 42 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Mary Joy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her business.

Mary Joy has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Sharie Mae

texts.en:
Sharie Mae is 23 years old and married with one child. Sharie Mae works very hard to provide for the family.

Sharie Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock such as detergent soap, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, etc., to sell.

Sharie Mae has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, etc.

In the future, Sharie Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as detergent soap, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina ,47, is a married woman with eight children, 4 of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Monina has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Monina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Monina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Welcilsa

texts.en:
Welcilsa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Welcilsa is 47 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Welcilsa has a general store business in the Philippines. Welcilsa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Welcilsa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Welcilsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susan is 39 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Susan has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc., for her business.

Susan has been in this business for five years. Susan would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Ernita

texts.en:
Ernita works hard to support her family. Ernita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ernita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Ernita has been in this business for 10 years now.

Ernita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vilma is 42 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Vilma has a bamboo strips weaving business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bamboo for her business.

Vilma has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo for her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nenita is 49 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Nenita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc., for her food production business.

Nenita has been in this business for five years. Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc., for her food production business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Delia has been in this business for one year. Delia earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary is 46 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Mary has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mary requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials and gear for her fishing business.

Mary has been in this business for five years. Mary would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 40 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Susana works very hard to provide for them.

Susana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Susana has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, breads, cooking oil, noodles, etc.

Susana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Merelie

texts.en:
Merelie is 46 years old and married with three children.

Merelie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, toothpaste, sanitary pads, etc., to sell.

Merelie has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Merelie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, toothpaste, sanitary pads, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Mercy Gay

texts.en: Mercy Gay started her small-time business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and she rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she makes good sales since she has the only store in their barangay. Recently, she approached Paglaum for much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to mount a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en: Nelie has always had an enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their crop land in Calamba and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Nelie knows that she has to get things right to yield more income during this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 48 years od, married and a mother of four children. She owns and manages her retail store just to earn more profit. For more than 18 years she has been selling goods to the local community. The business is earning well and it allows her to keep her business open in order to continue serving more variety of goods to satisfy her customers' needs. Recently, she took a new loan to buy more grocery goods to sell that will result in higher sales and a higher income for Marilou. She tells us that her biggest desire is to continue working and offering better service to her customers. By doing this, she will have more financial stability and can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends to microfinance members like her. She tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Lolita borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Lolita looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Meretsil

texts.en:
Meretsil works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Meretsil requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

Meretsil has been in this business for two years now and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Meretsil would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.en:
Mohamed, who is in his late 20's, is single with one child attending school. He has been selling second-hand clothes for five years now. He works from 10am to 8pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mohamed's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep increasing and buying better quality second-hand clothes. Mohamed has paid back all of his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay his loan, to buy a plot of land and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy first class second-hand clothes. He dreams of buying big bales of second-hand clothes.  

Mohamed will share this loan with his loan group MAVUNO, which consists of three members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy first class second-hand clothes

loans.name: Edilfredo

texts.es:
Edilfredo con 35 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive junto a su esposa e hijo, en el distrito de Callayuc,provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Edilfredo se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, realiza esta actividad hace aproximadamente 02 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en compra de más productos para su bodega, así como para invertir en realizar algunas remodelaciones en su vivienda. Posee experiencia en el negocio. Adicionalmente brinda servicios de peonaje y tallado de madera con motosierra.

Edilfredo es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, a manejado siete créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Edilfredo, 35 years old and married, lives together with his wife and son in the district of Callayuc, Cutervo province, department of Cajamarca. Most people in this area work in agriculture, commerce, or raising livestock.

Edilfredo works in the sale of basic necessities. He started this work two years ago. He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more products for his store, which will then enable him to invest in completing some renovations to his home.

He has experience in business, and provides additional services, like manual labor, and woodcutting with power saws.

Edilfredo is a recurring member in our institution, Edpyme Alternativa, having completed seven loans which he paid back on time.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more products for his grocery store, enabling him to then invest in completing some renovations on his home.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45-years-old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Teresita works in agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requests a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Teresita has been raising cattle for 4 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle

loans.name: Venceremos Group

texts.es:
lA ASOCIACION COMUNAL VENCEREMOS ESTA CONFORMADA NUEVE INTEGRANTES OCHO MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE, PADRES Y MADRES RESPONSABLES CON VEINTE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DE MALPAISILLO LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGION, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DIA A DIA PARA SUPERARSE ECONOMICAMENTE, Y BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS LA OPORTUNIDADES QUE ELLOS SE MERECEN.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES BENITA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA PULPERIA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO:ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZUCAR, LECHEN, PAN, HUEVOS, QUESO, CUAJADA, TISTE , HIELO, JUGOS, GALLETAS, ETC. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU PULPERIA PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL VENCEREMOS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The “Venceremos” (“we will overcome”) communal bank has nine members: eight women and one man. They are responsible parents with twenty children in their care. They are from Malpaisillo, which is located in the northern part of the region. They are known for being hard-working and responsible with a desire to get ahead in life. They currently fight each day to get ahead financially and give their children the opportunities that they deserve.

The coordinator’s name is Benita and her source of income is her grocery store. It is a small store that sells food products, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, curd, ice, juices, and cookies. She spends about twelve hours a day working in her business. The loan will be used to invest in working capital and restock her grocery store so she can obtain better income in the not-too-distant future.

The “Venceremos” communal bank is grateful for the help that Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have decent work.

loans.use: to restock their grocery store with products, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juices, and cookies

loans.name: Irma Victoria

texts.es:
Irma Victoria con 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge e hijo, en el distrito de Cayalti, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Irma Victoria se dedica a la venta de ropa y de productos lácteos, con experiencia en el negocio desde hace 05 años. Así mismo ofrece sus servicios de enfermería, ya que es enfermera técnica.Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa para temporada de otoño, así como en gastos personales.De esta manera atenderá la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar,y obtendrá ingresos adicionales para él y su familia.

Irma victoria con experiencia crediticia en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, con pagos puntuales. Busca notables mejoras de sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
25-year-old Irma Victoria has a partner. She lives with her spouse and child in the district of Cayaltí, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the department of Lambayeque, Peru. The inhabitants of this area mostly make a living from trade, agriculture and ranching.

Irma Victoria makes a living by selling clothing and dairy products. She has five years of experience in this business. She also works as a nurse since she is a vocational nurse. She is requesting a loan so she can buy clothing for the fall season. She will also use some of it for personal expenses. In this way, she will be able to meet demand in the area and she will obtain additional income for her family.

Irma Victoria has had previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa and her repayments have been made on time. She is seeking to make considerable improvements to her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the fall season, and to have money for personal expenses

loans.name: Jose Hugo

texts.es:
José Hugo con 40 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en casa propia en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Jose Hugo cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por los habitantes de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

José Hugo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como carneros y cerdos, se dedica a este rubro desde hace 08 años aproximadamente. adicionalmente se dedica al servicio de labores agrícolas desempeñándose como peón agrícola.Solicita préstamo para invertir en compra de animales, alimentación y otros gastos diversos.

José Hugo cuenta con experiencia crediticia en nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa, es su tercer crédito.
texts.en:
Jose Hugo, 40, lives with his wife and minor son in his own house in the district of Zaña, province of Chiclayo in the department of Lambayeque, Peru. He has good personal and work references from the local people in the area. Most of the population works in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.

Jose Hugo raises and sells animals such as sheep and pigs, having been in the trade for eight years. He also works as a day laborer in agricultural services. The loan he is requesting is to buy animals and feed, and to pay other expenses.

Jose Hugo has loan experience through our institution, Edpyme Alternativa, and this is his third loan.

loans.use: to buy animals, feed and pay other expenses.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she tailors clothes. She has been involved in this business for nine years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will open a boutique. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: A $1,000 loan is offered to Adelina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day, because she lives near many people. She will buy some additional supplies with this loan including biscuits, glue, candles, soap, hand and body lotion, pens, candies, aqua, detergent, milk, noodles, rice, shampoo, sugar, coffee, soft drinks and other things to sell. She has been involving herself in business activities for a few years, with her own working capital. During her business run she was very happy because she can be helping her husband to be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future, with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, glue, candles, soap, hand and body lotion, pens, candies, aqua, detergent, milk, noodles, rice, shampoo, sugar, coffee, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy livestock and feed for the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cows to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a hardworking married man with four children and all attend school in Kamwenge, Uganda. He also takes care of six other children because they are orphans from his relatives. He used his previous loan to buy materials for making bushera (porridge).

He still sells locally made porridge (bushera) as his main business alongside farming, which helps him earn an extra income. He has been operating these two businesses for over eight years and he works throughout the week given the nature of his business.

Though he has responsibilities to educate his children and provide for his family, he also wants to at least grow his businesses so as to serve his multipurpose intentions but he faces problems of inadequate capital and seasonal customers.

Francis is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials like millet and sorghum flour, sugar and others to make bushera to sell.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like millet and sorghum flour, sugar and others to make bushera to sell.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is a 48-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and manages the entire household. One of her sons has been running his own business as a Robin Neel wholesaler for the past 20 years.

Nasira's son needs to buy Robin Neel bags in bulk and other commodities for reselling purposes, but due to financial constraints her son is unable to purchase these commodities. Therefore Nasira has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her son in buying these commodities for reselling purposes to earn a maximum profitable income. This profitable income will also help him to make savings to meet the needs of his family and business.

Nasira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy Robin Neel items for her son's wholesale business.

loans.name: Jacinta Njoki

texts.en: Jacinta says, "I am very eager to get a biogas system. My monthly spending on conventional fuel takes a significant portion of my income. Now with this biogas loan from Takamoto Biogas, I can channel the money spent on fuel to acquire even more cows." She currently has seven cows, but looks forward to the day she will have a larger dairy farm to support her family and grow her business. Please help Jane to get a biodigester.

loans.use: To buy a biodigester for clean, renewable fuel for cooking.

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan lives in Gavar town with his parents and young brother. Last year, Vahan decided to earn a living for his family by providing taxi service. He also purchased a coffee machine which is currently located in the gas station.

Vahan requested this loan to purchase a new coffee machine and register the car which he uses in providing taxi service, so his business will be improved. Due to his hard work, Vahan manages to successfully run his two businesses and hopes to develop them in the future.

loans.use: to pay for a new coffee machine and register the car which he uses in providing taxi service, so his business will be improved.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is a simple housewife, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and manages the entire household. Her husband has been running his own business as a host sweet wholesaler for the past 17 years.

Nighat's husband needs to buy host sweets in bulk and other commodities for reselling purposes, but due to financial constraints her husband is unable to purchase these commodities. Therefore Nighat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her husband in buying these commodities for reselling purposes to earn maximum profitable income. This profitable income will also help him to make savings to meet the needs of his family and business.

Nighat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy host sweets for her husband's wholesale business

loans.name: Emerencia

texts.en: Emerencia, 73 years old, is residing at Calamba, Mis.Occ. She is married and blessed with four adult-age children. She joined PMPC on April 17, 2002 in order to access the programs and services of the said co-op. Recently, she accessed her 12th loan in the amount of PHP 14,900 for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of food products to sell in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Flor

texts.es:
Rosa Flor con 30 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive en casa propia, en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Rosa Flor se dedica a la crianza y venta de carneros y animales menores como patos, cuyes, etc, dedicándose a este rubro desde hace más de 10 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales menores.De esta manera le facilitará mejorar sus ingresos y trabajar solo con nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa.

Rosa Flor si cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio nuevo en nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rosa Flor is 30 years old and single. She lives in her own house in the district of Zaña, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the department of Lambayeque, Peru. The inhabitants of this area mostly make a living from agriculture and ranching.

Rosa Flor makes a living by raising and selling rams and small animals, such as ducks and guinea pigs. She has been doing this work for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy small animals; in this way, she will be able to increase her income and work independently with the help of Edpyme Alternativa.

Rosa Flor has had loans in the past, but she is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to improve her earnings and work independently with the help of Edpyme Alternativa

loans.name: Grupo La Fe Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL AL FE ESTA CONFORMADA POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES MADRES SOLTERAS CON VEINTE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD , SON ORIGINARIAS DE MALPAISILLO, Y SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LES GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPAÑIA DE SUS HIJOS, LAMENTABLEMETE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DIA A DIA PARA SALIR ADELANTE Y BRINDARLES MEJORES  OPORTUNIDADES DE VIDA A SUS HIJOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES JULIA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE ROPA DE SEGUNDA MANO  COMO: PANTALONES, FALDAS, VESTIDOS, CAMISAS, ROPA DE CAMA, ROPA DE NIÑO ETC. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS SERVICIOS, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y COMPRA PACAS DE  ROPA DE SEGUNDA MANO PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DEL CLIENTE Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. LAS ASOCIACION COMUNAL LA FE AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS  Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The community bank LA FE comprises nine members who are single mothers with 20 children in their care. They are from Malpaisillo and are known as hard-working, responsible people who are determined to improve their personal situation. In their free time they enjoy the company of their children. Unfortunately, because of their economic situations, they were unable to get an education and had to start working at a young age to help cover household expenses. Now they work day after day to get ahead and give their children better opportunities in life.

The group coordinator is Julia who sells used clothing, such as pants, skirts, dresses, shirts, bedding, children's clothing, etc. She works from home and spends 12 hours a day on the job. The loan will be used as work capital to buy a pack of used clothing to meet customer demand and earn more income in the near future.

The community bank LA FE, is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help given to people with low incomes in countries like Nicaragua so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy a pack of clothing to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Victoria Isabel

texts.es: Victoria es una mujer de 25 años de edad que vive en casa de su propiedad la cual compro con mucho esfuerzo, y en ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos una niña de 3 años y dos varones de 7 y 5 años de edad. Victoria se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y adultos de diferentes estilos y colores, actividad que lleva realizando 2 años, por lo que ya cuenta con su propia clientela que solicita sus productos. Victoria desea invertir en su negocio, ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y ella desea tener surtida su mercadería para atraer a mayor cantidad de clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, blusas, faldas, camisetas, vestidos, entre otros productos para mejorar sus ventas y prepararse para la temporada.
texts.en:
Victoria, 25, lives in her own house which she bought through much effort. She lives with her life partner and three children, a daughter, age 3, and two boys, ages 7 and 5. Victoria sells children's and adult's clothing in different styles and colors, and has been in business for two years selling to a steady customer base.

Victoria wants to invest in her business for the upcoming Christmas season. She wants to stock merchandise to attract more customers, so she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy pants, blouses, skirts, t-shirts, dresses and other products to improve sales and prepare for the season.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, skirts, t-shirts, dresses and other products to improve sales and prepare for the season.

loans.name: Zenie

texts.en:
Zenie has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities, and earns money for her family as well. 

As a microfinance member of PMPC, she seeks financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. 

In the future, Zenie wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighbouring towns.

loans.use: to purchase variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell

loans.name: Romlah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Romlah,who is a 42-year-old widow and lives with her two sons. Romlah has been selling clothes for 12 years, She has asked for a loan of IDR 3,400,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and cleam water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Romh repwlaill be able to ay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family.

loans.name: Perla Joy

texts.en:
Perla Joy is 41 years old and married with three children. With two of her children currently in school, Perla Joy works very hard to provide for them.

Perla Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like candies, biscuits, canned goods, snack foods, beer, juice, coffee, etc. to sell.

Perla Joy has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, canned goods, snack foods, beer, juice, coffee, etc.

In the future, Perla Joy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like candies, biscuits, canned goods, snack foods, beers, juice, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL EL ESFUERZO ESTA CONFORMADA POR QUINCE MUJERES Y TRES HOMBRES MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, SON ORIGINARIOS DE MALPAISILLO, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN  SE CARACTERIZA POR SER PRODUCTORES DE PRODUCTOS LACTEOS, ESTAS PERSONAS HAN DEMOSTRADO SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS Y BRINDARLES LA ESTABILIDAD QUE NECESITAN.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES MARTHA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA DE ROPA NUEVA COMO: PANTALONES, FALDAS, VESTIDOS, CAMISAS, CAMISETAS, CAMISOLAS, ROPA DE CAMA, ROPA INTERIOR, ETC.  ELLA TIENE UBICADO EN NEGOCIO EN UN LUGAR ESPECIFICO DE LA LOCALIDAD, INVIERTE EN EL NEGOCIO UNAS DIES HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS A CLIENTES Y FIJOS Y POR ENCARGOS, LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL EL ESFUERZO AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The community bank EL ESFUERZO is comprised of 15 women and three men who are responsible mothers and fathers with a determination to improve their situations. They are from Malpaisillo which is located in the northern part of the region known for its dairy products. They have proven themselves to be hard-working, responsible people who want to get ahead. Their current struggle is to provide for their children and give them the stability they need.

The coordinator, Martha, sells new clothing such as pants, skirts, dresses, shirts, t-shirts, camisoles, bedding, lingerie, etc. She runs her business out of a local building and spends ten hours a day on the job selling to steady customers and on an order basis.

The group EL ESFUERZO is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support of people with low incomes in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy new clothing such as pants, skirts, dresses, shirts, t-shirts and camisoles.

loans.name: Anna Lorraine

texts.en:
Anna Lorraine is from the village of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old and is married. Anna Lorraine owns and operates a specialized retail store selling consumable products, household garments, gasoline and other items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2012, Anna Lorraine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Anna Lorraine is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, with which she will purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa has considerable preparations for the post harvest operations of her corn in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the harvesting, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and made a loan.  Felisa hopes to see all her children finish their degree and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 26-years-old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Ruth works in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Ruth requests a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Ruth has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Ruth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mabella

texts.en:
Mabella landed in the right place for the capital she needed when she joined PMPC. She knew that this would be her last chance to get back on her feet, after she became broke when her first business went bad. 

PMPC came to the rescue for Mabellar, lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she has borrowed another loan for the next cropping season. She has borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. 

Mabella perseveres and always believes in reaching her goal to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is driven by his passion for selling. At the age of 51, married and living in Calamba, Mis. Occ., he runs a store that primarily supports his family. Everyday, he never get tired of tending his store. Ricardo is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. He religiously paid his obligations without record of default. Now, he borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventories will mean income opportunities. In the future, he dreams of sustaining his store to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia has wide ranging experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities, from growing, caring and harvesting, to earning income as well. Clemencia supports her husband doing this type of work.  

Like a farmer, Clemencia has nurtured her membership with PMPC, and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows that she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. 

Recently, Clemencia applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds. These will have good results, as they are healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Clemencia hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate, which will potentially create extra income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds for farming

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina owns a corn oil retailing station in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from the earnings of her shop. 

Recently, Celerina applied for a loan to purchase corn oil for retail. She is adding an extension shop in a nearby barangay (village), and she wishes to earn more income by doing this type of business.

loans.use: to purchase corn oil for retail

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on business-woman and mother, who never gets too tired to support her family.

Recently, she borrowed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. 

Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, Mila thinks of adding more heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is getting ready for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. 

She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, of which she has applied for a loan from the Cooperative. 

She hopes to save enough money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
From Calamba, Emerita earns a living through her clothing sales. She seems to have enough inventories to continuously provide for her family.

For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by Emerita since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business success, with determination and her family as her inspiration. 

To earn more income, Emerita has applied for a loan to purchase more clothing inventories to sell. Emerita hopes to live comfortably with her children finishing their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventories to sell

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Magdalena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens. Ma. Magdalena is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothes (like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc.) to sell at her ready-to-wear business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Magdalena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream - to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Замечательная молодая женщина Фарзона. Она замужем и один прекрасный маленький сыночек. Фарзона из района Хуросон. Ее муж дехкан. Он занимается животноводством. Фарзона тоже мечта заниматься животноводством. 7 лет назад она освоила деятельность мужа, и решила вместе  с мужем заниматься животноводством. Фарзона хорошо ухаживает о своих животных. Она с мужем начала отремонтировать дом и улучшить жилищные условия семьи. Ей не хватает денег для купли стройматериалы, и Фарзона решила взять кредит и приобрести все необходимых средств. Она будет очень раза за Вашу поддержку. Фарзона заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
This wonderful young woman is Farzona. She is married and has one small son. Farzona is from the Khuroson region. Her husband is a farmer. He rears animals. Farzona's dream is also to rear animals. She mastered her husband's trade seven years ago, and decided to rear animals together with her husband. Farzona looks after her animals well.

She and her husband have begun renovating their house and improving their family's living conditions. She does not have enough money to buy construction materials, and Farzona has decided to take a loan and buy all the necessary materials. She will be very glad of your support. Farzona expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Maksudahan

texts.ru: Максудахан, 57 лет, замужем, 5 детей. У Максудахан среднее образование, уже 10 лет в качестве дохода для своей семьи, она занимается сельским хозяйством. Максудахан жизнерадостный и ответственный человек. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, также занимается садоводством, выращивая фрукты для собственного потребления. На сегодняшний день деятельность Максудахан приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 17,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку коров для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Maksudahan is 57 years old, married, and has five children. Maksudahan has a secondary education. She has been farming for the past 10 years for income for her family. Maksudahan is a cheerful and responsible person. She has two cows, and also grows crops, growing fruits for personal consumption.Today Maksudahan's activity brings her a monthly profit of 17,000 som (KGS). She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) for the further development of her business, which she will direct towards buying some cows for fattening and resale. She plans to use the proceeds of the loan for the development of her farm and intends to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase some cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Hermogina

texts.en: Hermogina is a businesswoman from Calamba. She is 62 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Hermogina is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Hermogina continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 49 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three adult-age children. Rebecca owns and operates a business providing transport to local community members for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase a slightly used motorcycle. Rebecca is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Rebecca hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a slightly used motorcycle

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Anecita is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline has always dreamed of opening her own shoe shop to support her family. She used her loan to buy additional inventories of shoes and sandals for resale. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories of shoes and sandals for resale

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sylvia is 49 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Sylvia has a buy and sell of personal collection products business in the Philippines. Sylvia requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products like body lotion, perfume, underwear and other personal care products.

Sylvia has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products like body lotion, perfume, underwear and other personal care products.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda has been a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC for almost 8 years. She has been tilling her own land for her farming activites which primarily provide for the needs of her family. However, Erlinda has found out that her income from farming is now insufficient for her family's needs, especially at this time when her eldest child is entering college.

As a hardworking farmer, she has also had to nurture and work hard to repay her loans from the Cooperative. One time, she decided to expand her farm and asked for financial support from Paglaum MPC. Erlinda is grateful for the trust the Coop extended her, and she was able to buy the neighboring parcel of land and she successfully repaid the loan.

This cropping season, she is asking for another loan to augment her production. The amount of PHP 50,000 will be used to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticide. Erlinda is hopeful that she can have a good harvest this season so that she can repay her loan from the Cooperative ahead of schedule.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticide.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta landed at the right place for the capital she needed when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC came to Jacinta's rescue by lending her money when she needed it most.

Now she has taken out another loan for the next cropping season, and she has borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Jacinta perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals so that she can continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Jessa Marie

texts.en: Jessa Marie wants to fulfill her dreams by completing a degree. She religiously pays attention to making good marks in every semester she has entered. For another school year, she is in need of an amount to pay for her school fees. Jessa Marie has big dreams to help her family and for her siblings as well. This is the reason why she works hard for her education.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano is married and a father of three children. He has owned and managed a vegetable farm for many years just to work for a profit and this business became his main source of living. With the help of his wife who sells fruits and vegetables, they were able to sustain the business and send their children to school. He is planning to engage in some other activities for the expansion of his business. Now he has gained access to GDMPC and has decided to borrow a loan to be used in buying a variety of seedlings to be able to produce good quality products for the local customers.

Feliciano’s plan for the future is to save more money for the educational plan of his children when they get to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seedlings.

loans.name: Danny
