texts.en: Danny is an active member of Paglaum MPC who enjoys all the perks of a member. He is 44 years old and married with four school-age children. Danny is busy running his tuba (native wine from coconut sap) production business and tilling his own land. Both business ventures were supported by the co-op. He said he's secure financially knowing he can always turn to the cooperative, but he wants to be prepared also for unprecedented life events so he also avails life insurance from the co-op. Now that his one year life insurance is expiring, he is borrowing an amount to pay for life insurance renewal for the family. Danny believes that it is better to be prepared than to be held on neck for unexpected circumstances.

loans.use: to pay for life insurance renewal for the family.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 61 years old, and she is known in the Calamba area for her sari-sari store.

She actively participates in the various programs and services that the Coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably in a decent house, for which she has applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record.

It is of note that she has been given priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is very thankful for this, and for when all her financing needs of her retail business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Jaimelita

texts.en: Jaimelita is 61 years old. She is known in the Dipolog City area for her farming activities. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house. For this reason, she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.en:
Zosimo is from Dipolog city. He and his wife have rice land and earn a living doing farming activities.

Recently, Zosimo availed a loan to purchase a carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their wetland. He hopes to yield more harvest.

Zosimo deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a carabao to plow and harrow their wetland

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time borrower like her.

Elena is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune.

Recently she availed a loan to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

In the future, she hopes to provide a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a businesswoman from Dipolog city. She is 42 years old, a widow, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Grace is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing, without records of default.

Now she applied a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

Grace continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the ardent passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mae is 32 years old and has six children who are presently in school.

Mae has a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons to sell.

Mae has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of gas to sell.

loans.name: Maria Josel

texts.en:
Maria Josel is 36 years old and married.

Maria Josel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, etc.

Maria Josel has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maria Josel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, and snack foods

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
Janita is 41 years old and has six children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Janita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Janita has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian has been running her convenience store for almost 20 years. She started from a small store with an initial capital of PHP 650 that she had in her pocket after her wedding. She invested that little amount into buying consumable goods that are commonly used in a simple household and rolled up her proceeds. From that time on, she has expanded her little business and added on more products such as rice and corn grains for human consumption and now she also sells animal feed. Vivian recalls that her dreams of being a boss of her own business had come true. However, she said that this has been made possible because of the assistance of Paglaum MPC that she nurtured for a longer time. She continuously provides her immediate market with their needs, so she asked for a loan of PHP 5,000 to restock her store with grocery items, confections, condiments and other items.

loans.use: to restock her store with grocery items, confections, condiments and others.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is making a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is 26 years old and single. She never gets tired of tending her store. Trinidad's passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it that is sufficient to support her needs. Trinidad is a full-fledged member of PMPC and applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories and sales. Trinidad continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she is determined to pursue her goals.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en: Antonina is a businesswoman who earns through her furniture production business in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Jose Vladimir

texts.es: José de 21 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 2 años de edad. José es un joven responsable y muy trabajador que se gana la vida con un pequeño negocio de venta de pan que administra en un puesto que ha instalado y así también vende de forma ambulante. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 3 años, para lo que le permite contar con un número bastante grande de clientes, gracias a ello ha crecido la demanda para sus productos. Debido a esto José solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una bicicleta para sus ventas ambulantes y una vitrina para mostrar y almacenar más pan. De esta manera mejorar considerablemente su negocio y mejorar sus ventas, ya que este es el medio por el cual José mantiene la economía del hogar y ofrece todo lo necesario a su querida hija.
texts.en: José, 21 years old, lives in his own house with his life partner and his 2-year-old daughter. José is a responsible and very hard-working young man who earns his living with a small business selling bread that he runs at a stall that he has set up and also as a street vendor. He has had this business for 3 years, which allows him to have a rather large number of customers. Thanks to this, the demand for his products has increased.  Due to this, José asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in a bicycle for his sales and a display case to show and store more bread. In this way, he will improve his business considerably and improve his sales, since this is the means with which José maintains the household economy and offers everything needed to his beloved daughter.

loans.use: to invest in a bicycle for his sales and a display case to show and store more bread.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 55 years old and married with four children, one child is still in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13, 000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, etc.

Lorena has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, etc

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es: Maritza de 26 años de edad, vive al lado de sus hijos de 1 y 10 años,  su hija de 6 años de edad y su compañero de vida quien le ayuda con los gastos de la vivienda. Maritza es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora que en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia, se dedica a la venta de ropa de cama, mantas, toallas de mano y también ayuda a vender tortillas dentro de su comunidad. Esto le permite obtener ingresos económicos para los gastos de su vivienda. Maritza en busca de mejorar su negocio para aumentar las ganancias solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tela, hilo y máquina para confeccionar sus propios productos para las ventas de ropa de cama.
texts.en: Maritza, 26 years old, lives with her two sons, ages 1 and 10, her daughter, age 6, and her life partner who helps her with the household expenses. Maritza is a very responsible and hard-working woman who seeks to improve her quality of life and satisfy the basic needs of her family. She works selling bedding, blankets, hand towels and also helps to sell tortillas in her community. This allows her to get income for the household expenses. Maritza, seeking to improve her business to increase her income, asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in fabric, thread and a machine to sew her own products to sell bedding.

loans.use: to invest in fabric, thread, and a machine to make her own products to sell bedding.

loans.name: Diego Eduardo

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre de 28 años de edad, casado, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de abarrotes.
Él es emprendedor, independiente y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘mutualista’ área central donde se asientan la mayor parte de las empresas públicas y privadas. 
Diego es de tez trigueña, cabello negro corto y físico mediano. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposa que trabaja lavando ropa, viven en una casa alquilada, construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, fideo, aceite, arroz, refrescos, té, café, y otros, en su tienda de barrio, “abrimos la tienda porque por el barrio no hay competencia…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no tiene competencia cercana, la desventaja aes la falta de dinero para abastecer su negocio. Su sueño es tener su negocio bien equipado para que los clientes puedan acceder a todo tipo de productos, el desea abastecer su tienda con abarrotes de primera necesidad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Diego solicita un préstamo para comprar abarrotes de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Diego is a 28-year-old man, married, with no children, and his business is grocery sales.

He is enterprising, independent and very responsible. His business is located in the Mutualista zone, a central area where the majority of the public and private businesses are located.

Diego has dark skin, short black hair and has a medium build. His native language is Guaraní and he speaks Spanish. He shares his life with his wife who works washing clothing, and they live in a rented house built of bricks, which has all the basic services. His business is selling food and basic items such as bread, sugar, noodles, oil, rice, soft drinks, tea, coffee, and more, in his neighborhood store. "We opened the store because in the neighborhood there isn't any competition..." he says. The advantage of his business is that there is no nearby competition, and the disadvantage is the lack of money to stock his business. His dream is to have a well-outfitted business so that his customers can get all sorts of products. He wants to stock his store with basic groceries. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years that he has worked at this business.

For these reasons, Diego asks for a loan to purchase basic groceries to stock his store.

loans.use: to purchase basic groceries to stock his store.

loans.name: Jonathan, Sr.

texts.en:
Retailing helped Jonathan, Sr. survive and support the family. He retails charcoal and brings in an income of PHP 15,000 per month. He found the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all he needed to do is to weigh and repack the charcoal for his buyers.

Jonathan, Sr. plans to expand his retailing business. He applied for a loan to PMPC for the needed capital. He wants to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail.

Jonathan, Sr. smiles at the idea of seeing all his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a businesswoman in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 58 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC.

Julieta runs a retail store selling consumable goods and household items. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially the education of her children.

Recently, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Julieta believes having enough inventory would allow her to cater to her customers' needs.

She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 42 years old and lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children of school age.

Kristine has been engaged in managing a motor parts and accessories business together with her husband as the repairman for 3 years already and earns approximately PHP 35,000 each month doing this type of business activity.

She has requested a loan to buy additional inventories of motor oils, sprockets, tires, bolts and other motor parts and accessories. Kristine has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Kristine hopes to expand their motor parts and accessories & repair shop business in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories of motor oils, sprockets, tires, bolts and other motor parts and accessories.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 44 years old and married with nine children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Maria Elena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maria Elena has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Emilyn

texts.en:
Maria Emilyn is 29 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods and etc.

She has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Maria Emilyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en:
Elvisa signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the capital she needed to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like herself. Elvisa was able to turn the tide in her favor and is now making good sales these days.

She wants to take advantage of the good fortune, so recently she has taken out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria signed up for her membership with PMPC and availed herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital PMPC extends to a small time borrower like her.

Victoria is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to restock her store with bags of animal feeds for retail. In the future, she hopes to build a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with bags of animal feeds for retail.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 32 years old, single and lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. As a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, she is given priority in financial services to alleviate her present financial conditions with the necessary financial literacy and other training in which she actively participated.

Virgie has seen the changes in her general living condition from the moment she signed up for membership with the cooperative. This time, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Mamerto

texts.en:
Mamerto is 75 years old and married with 7 adult children living in Dipolog City, Misamis Occidental. He is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC and he has availed himeslf of various loan products already. He successfullly repaid his previous loan with the Coop.

Now he needs an amount for his medication so he is asking for a loan. The amount of PHP 10,000 will be used to purchase maintenance medication.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medication.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en: Nilo is a government employee and at the same time operates a motor transport business. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For him to continue his business, he availed a loan to pay for spare motor parts and repair. He dreams to own motor units and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for spare motor parts/repair

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en: Rodella is 44 years old and lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is single with 3 school-aged children. She joined PMPC on April 17, 2009 in order to access the programs and services of the said co-op. Recently, she's accessing her 6th loan in the amount of PHP 14,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to purchase corn seeds which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo, a responsible father, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which he will use to increase his inventory.

He wants to buy more fish for resale. This way, he will be able to sell more products which will allow him to earn more money and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: John Lenard

texts.en:
John Lenard is 25 years old, single, from the province of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. His is a close-knit family they help and support each other. John Lenard, being a foodie and very responsible, thought of a food business a year ago to help send his younger siblings to school.

To finance his short order food business he is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to buy ingredients such as fresh chicken, pork, veggies and seasonings, gas to make and serve food that can be cooked quickly when a customer orders it. He is encouraged that he has earned the respect of his community for good food and excellent service. He trusts that you will consider his request. His earnings will really help fund his sibling's schooling.

John Lenard dreams of having a small restaurant someday and see his siblings finish their schooling. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which he studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients for short order dishes to deliver to customers.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 32 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband is a carpenter while Analyn manages her banana farm.

For over 3 years, she has been earning well selling her bananas in the market. It covers the cost of their household expenses considering also the income of her husband which she considered as their main source of income. She gained access to GDMPC and recently, she took a loan for the purpose of buying organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest.

She wants to improve her banana farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 54 years old and has six children. Mercedita is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Mercedita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Mercedita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mercedita has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana has been involved in business activities since 2013; she started with her own working capital of $200.

She is applying for a loan of $ 1,000. She has come to the age of 22, and her husband is a businessman also. She has a kiosk in front of her house and she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She will buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including sugar, noodles, cigarettes, biscuits, candles, milk, coffee, aqua, cooking oils, rice, hard drinks and other things to sell.

She is happy with the loan that are offered by Tuba Rai Metin, because with this loan she can improve her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, cigarettes, biscuits, candles, milk, coffee, aqua, cooking oils, rice, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is an enthusiastic farmer. She has cultivated their rice land in Pagadian City and has had good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Elsie knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

In the future, Elsie hopes to buy hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Flora

texts.pt: A Sra. Flora é casada, vive com o esposo e três filhos. É comerciante. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar mercadorias tais como, omo, ovos, mayonnaise, etc.  Tem sonho de abrir um estabelecimento do tipo mercearia. Tem como maior desafio conseguir mais financiamentos
texts.en: Flora is married and lives with her husband and three children. She runs her own business and plans to use this loan to buy goods such as eggs, mayonnaise, etc. Her dream is to open grocery store. Her biggest challenge is to get more financing.

loans.use: to buy eggs, mayonnaise, etc

loans.name: Assa

texts.pt: A Sra. Assa é casada, vive com o esposo e seis filhos, o esposo é taxista. É comerciante, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar mercadorias tais como computadores celulares e seus acessórios. Tem sonho de ter um estabelecimento comercial e empregar mais pessoas. Tem como maior desafio o investimento
texts.en: Assa is married and lives with her husband and six children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She runs her own business and will use this loan to buy merchandise such as computers, cell phones, and electronics accessories. Her dream is to open up a shop and have employees. Her biggest challenge is getting working capital.

loans.use: to buy computers, cell phones, and electronics accessories.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is an active pensioner member of Paglaum MPC where she has availed various loan products. She nurtures her membership without records of default payments.

Recently, she availed a loan of PHP 30,000 to pay for a medical check up and to purchase maintenance medicine.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check up and purchase of maintenance medicine.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sandra Guadalupe

texts.es: Sandra de 25 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia al lado de su compañero de vida, sus hijas de 4 y 7 años de edad, su madre y su abuela de avanzada edad. Sandra es una joven trabajadora y muy responsable que en busca de mantener la economía del hogar labora en una empresa que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad. Esta labor la desempeña para ofrecerles todo lo necesario a sus hijas y de esta forma también apoyar a su madre y abuela en sus necesidades. Además en busca de obtener mayores ingresos para los gastos de su familia se dedica a la venta de productos de bellezas por catálogo. Este negocio lo administra desde hace 2 años y así puede aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera sacar a adelante a sus hijas. Debido al tiempo que tiene de manejar este negocio ha adquirido bastantes clientes, para lo que necesita invertir en sus productos pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria. Es por ello que solicita un crédito a  FUSAI para invertir en: lociones, mascarillas, maquillaje, desodorantes, cremas y demás productos de belleza para surtir su negocio y de esta forma aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Sandra is 25 years old. She lives in her n home with her life's companion, her 4 and 7 year old daughters, her mother and her elderly grandmother. Sandra is a hard working and very responsible young woman who in order to support her home works in a business close to her community. She does this work to give her daughters everything they need and support her mother and grandmother with what they need. She also sells beauty products by catalog to pay for the family's expenses. She has had this business for 2 years and this way she can increase her income and get her daughters ahead. Because of how long she has had this business, she has acquired many customers, and so she needs to invest in her products but she doesn't have the necessary liquidity. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: and increase her profits.

loans.use: to invest in lotions, masks, makeup, deodorants, creams, and mother beauty products to stock her business.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a 41-year-old married woman.

She has been selling school supplies such as papers, notebooks, pens and other materials used in school. She is earning really well and was able to repay her previous loan.

She wants to expand her business. Recently, she took a new loan to buy more school supplies to sell it in their local community in order to increase her sales as well as her inventory.

Janeth's plan for the future is to save more money for the educational needs of her only child.

loans.use: to buy more school supplies to sell it in their local community.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 71 years old, widowed and has 12 children.

Monica is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Monica requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.


In the future, Monica would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Nieva works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell personal products business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Nieva is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional products like body lotion, perfume, underwear and other personal care products.

Nieva has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional products like body lotion, perfume, underwear and other personal care products.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt: A Sra. Isabel é casada, vive com o esposo e uma sobrinha. É auxiliar administrativa. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente cimento chapas e areia. Tem sonho de abrir aviários para a criação de frangos de abate. Tem como maior desafio conseguir mais financiamentos.
texts.en: Isabel is married and lives with her husband and a niece. She is an administrative assistant. She plans to use this loan to buy construction materials--namely, cement, sheet metal, and sand. Her dream is to build chicken coops and raise chickens for meat. Her biggest challenge is to get more financing.

loans.use: to buy cement, sheet metal, and sand.

loans.name: Maria Etelvina

texts.es: María de 63 años de edad, tiene 20 años de residir en su vivienda. Vive al lado de su compañero de vida quien le poya con los gastos de la vivienda. María es una mujer trabajadora, que en busca de mantener la economía del hogar se dedica a vender típicos como lo son el atol de elote, atol chuco, tamales de elote, etc. estos productos los vende en diferentes lugares que se encuentran cerca de su comunidad. Esta labor la desempeña desde hace 30 años, y es lo que le ha permitido obtener sus ingresos económicos. Gracias a que el negocio de María tiene muchos años, ha logrado obtener una cantidad enorme de clientes que la prefieren. Es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ollas, vasos desechables, plato y reparar el área en donde cocina. De esta forma contar con materiales en buen estado para preparar sus productos y así también para aumentar sus ventas. Ya que gracias a este negocio logra satisfacer sus necesidades básicas y las de su compañero de vida.
texts.en:
María is 63 years old and has been living in her home for 20 years. She lives with her life companion who helps her with the household expenses. María is a hard-working woman whose desire to maintain the household budget led her to sell traditional items, such as atol de elote (a fresh corn drink), atol chuco (a fermented corn drink), tamales de elote (fresh corn tamales), etc. She sells thse products in different places near her community.

She has been doing this work for 30 years, and this is how she has been able to obtain her financial income. Thanks to the fact that María's business has been established for many years, she has managed to obtain an enormous clientele that prefer her wares.

That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in pots and pans, disposable cups, plates and to repair the area where she cooks. That way she will have materials in good condition with which to prepare her products and will be able to increase her sales. Thanks to this business, she is able to satisfy her basic needs and those of her life companion.

loans.use: to invest in pots and pans, disposable cups, plates and to repair the area where she cooks.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn availed herself of another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Arlyn perseveres and always works to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she nurtures her membership and pays her obligations on time so that she she can always turn to the cooperative.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is always traveling in selling her various consumable products that gives her an approximate income of PHP 9,000 per month. She needs to help her husband in providing the needs of their family knowingly their eldest child is already in college. Carmelita is 66 years old and an active member of Paglaum MPC, her partner in all her financial needs for her business ventures. Recently, she availed a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional stocks of beauty products, household items and fragrances. The amount will be used to purchase additional stocks for her buy & sell business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of beauty products, household items and fragrances

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en: Rosel is 40 years old, married with 2 school age children. She lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. For the past two years, Rosel has been a farmer. She earns 20,000 PHP every cropping season and is a new member of PMPC. Rosel is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase bags of fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is living separated from her husband, she is 54 years old and has 2 children. She has been planting and harvesting bananas for many years. She is working hard to earn more profit. Her goal is to forge ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her two children and her family. Julieta needs to pay for school fees and also cover her household expenses.

Julieta is requesting a loan to buy planting materials and organic fertilizer to improve her banana production. She is striving for a better life through farming and is grateful for this opportunity. Julieta hopes to have a better life with her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy planting materials and organic fertilizer to improve her banana production.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita is 40 years old and has two children. She is married and both children are still in school. Normelita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,500 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Normelita has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Normelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda owns a sari-sari (general) store in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. As a PMPC microfinance member, she diligently pays all her obligations from the earnings of her store. 

Recently, Erlinda applied for a loan to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. She is adding an extension store in a nearby barangay (village), and she wishes to earn more doing this type of business.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is an active member of Paglaum MPC who enjoys all the perks of being a member. She is 65 years old and married, with adult children. Victoria is always busy tilling their own land - business ventures that were supported by the co-op. She says that she is financially secure in knowing she can always turn to the cooperative, but she wants to be prepared for unprecedented life events. To this end, she also avails life insurance from the coop. 

Now that her one year life insurance is expiring, she is requesting a loan to pay for the insurance renewal fees for her family. Victoria believes that it is better to be prepared than to be held on neck for unexpected circumstances.

loans.use: to pay the life insurance renewal costs for her family.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Jevie

texts.en:
Jevie runs and operates a mini-grocery store that offers bags, shoes, and garments to local consumers. He is 24 years old, married with infant age child, and lives in Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. Jevie is making good sales and has successfully expanded his business to sell items like umbrellas and school supplies. 

This time, he is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy additional stocks of bags, shoes, and other garments for sale. He hopes he can maintain his sales so that he can conscientiously serve his local market.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of bags, shoes, and other garments to sell in his store.

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives with her retired mother in Dalarik village of Armavir region. She is a farmer following her family tradition. Currently Marine's farm includes livestock of cows, sows and hens and also 15 years old apricot orchard. 
Marine sells the gathered harvest at local market, and this is how her family's only income is formed. 
The requested loan is very important for her farm. She plans to purchase five oxen, forage for feeding the livestock, seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation to sustain the farm and gather income for family. The loan will help her to sustain the farm during the coming winter season and enable Marine to cover her small family's daily expenses and needs.

loans.use: to pay for five oxen, forage for feeding the livestock, seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation to sustain the farm and gather income for family

loans.name: Mubaraka

texts.en:
Mubaraka is a hardworking married father of six children. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda where he practices livestock alongside agriculture which businesses he started 10 years ago with the intention of increasing his earnings and taking good care of his family. In the future, Mubaraka wants to expand his cattle farm so as to realize more profits and educate his children but he faces challenges of inadequate capital and cattle diseases that affect his animals. This limits his stock turnover and the productivity of his business.
Mubarak seeks financial support in form of a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Nurhaeni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Nurhaeni, one of Ruma's agents. Nurhaeni lives in South Bandung, located in West Java, about three hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her children. Nurhaeni owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their children’s education, that’s why she decided to join Ruma. Her community sees Nurhaeni as friendly and informative mobile service provider. 

As the business grows, Nurhaeni needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Nurhaeni’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

Nurhaeni is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob lives in Ashotsq village in Shirak region with his wife and their two kids. 
He has been doing auto repair service for already 10 years. In the rented garage, Hakob works hard to satisfy customers' needs and gather income for his family.
To prepare his business for the cold and severe winter in Shirak region, Hakob has requested this loan. 
He needs to purchase  tools and materials for auto repair service and also renovation of the garage so his business will be developed. Hakob hopes to obtain a constant source of income which will permit him to provide his family with a better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for his auto repair service and also renovation of the garage so his business will be developed .

loans.name: Elija

texts.en:
Elija is a business women and she has a small shop, so she is requesting a loan of $ 800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as detergents, cooking oils, candle, tea, eggs, noodles, soaps, sugar, salt and other things to sell.

Elija started to open her shop a few years ago with her own working capital. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She has plan to open her shop big store, so she will use this loan improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, cooking oils, candles, tea, eggs, noodles, soaps, sugar, salts and other things to sell.

loans.name: Frieda

texts.en:
Frieda wants to thank Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for the approval of her previous loan, as she was able to buy sacks of charcoal to add to her business. She noticed an increase in her daily sales since she is now able to provide bulk quantity of orders. She believes that God will return the favor for those people with considerate hearts. 

Freida wants to succeed with her business in order to support her children’s education and daily needs, for she wants them to finish in tertiary level and find better jobs someday. Since there’s an increase in her daily sales, she also wants to have supporting capital so that every week she’ll be able to buy sacks of charcoal. With this in mind, she is applying for a loan of Php 15,000 and hopes that lenders will once again consider her story.    

Frieda believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members, where she gains spiritual strength from others members' life changing testimonies, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans, and hears God’s word conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nima

texts.en:
Nima is 48 years old and married with four children. With all of her children in school, Nima works very hard to provide for them.

Nima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items for her store, such as bread, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Nima would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, such as bread, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA MUJER SOLTERA DE 30 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE SUS PIEZAS DENTALES SEVERAMENTE EMPALMADAS DESDE NIÑA Y NUNCA RECIBIÓ ATENCIÓN, POR LO QUE REQUIERE DE UN TRATAMIENTO DE ORTODONCIA YA QUE TIENE FUERTES DOLORES EN SU MANDÍBULA, APARTE DE EVIDENTE PROBLEMA ESTÉTICO. DESAFORTUNADAMENTE NO CUENTA CON LOS RECURSOS SUFICIENTES PARA SU TRATAMIENTO.
texts.en:
She is a single, 30 year old woman. Her teeth have been severely overlapped ever since she was a girl. She never received treatment.

That is why she needs orthodontic treatment. She has severe jaw pain in addition to the obvious esthetic problem.

Unfortunately, she does not have enough resources to cover the treatment.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana Rosa con 52 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive junto a su esposo, en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Juana Rosa cuenta con muy referencias tanto personales como laborales. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Juana Rosa se dedica a la venta de refrescos y chupetes así como comidas preparadas para vender en el exterior del colegio.Solicita préstamo para invertir en compra de insumos, para compra de materiales de construcción y gastos personales. De este modo obtendrá una mayor venta y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en su calidad de vida.

Juana Rosa con experiencia crediticia en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, con pagos puntuales
texts.en:
Juana Rosa is 52 years old, married. She lives with her husband in the district of Zana, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, Peru. Juana Rosa has many, very good personal and work references. The population in this location work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.
Juana Rosa works selling beverages and popsicles as well as prepared meals to sell outside a school. She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials and pay for personal expenses. This way, she will increase her sales and will be able to generate income to improve her quality of life. Juana Rosa has credit experience with our institution Edpyme Alternativa, with timely payments.

loans.use: to  purchase construction materials and pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Hermelen

texts.en:
Hermelen is 36 years old and married with three school-age children from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She runs and operates a sari-sari store (convenience store) in their place, while her husband is a farmer.

She decided to sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC upon knowing that the said co-op is offering financial and non-financial services to all of its members, especially jobless women. Hermelen decided to ask for a loan as initial capitalization to start up her sari-sari store and successfully repaid her previous loans.

At this time, she needs additional capital. She asks for a loan to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, confectioneries and condiments.

Hermelen is looking forward for a successful year of partnership with the cooperative she is in.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, confectioneries and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is 34 years old and married with five children. With five children in school, Emelinda works very hard to provide for them.

Emelinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, noodles, home care products, and other groceries.

Emelinda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Emelinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, noodles, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 52 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia en la cual ha vivido durante toda la vida. Vive al lado de sus hermanas quienes le apoyan con la economía del hogar. Daniel es una persona muy trabajadora que presta sus servicios de mantenimiento en un rancho y gracias a esta labor logra obtener los ingresos necesarios para sostener la economía de su familia. Debido al pasar del tiempo su vivienda se ha ido deteriorando, para ello necesita reparaciones pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos, tejas y pago de mano de obra para reparar del techo de su hogar. Ya que en los días de lluvias se filtra el agua y esto evita tener tranquilidad por las noches.
texts.en:
Daniel, 52, lives in his own home, where he's lived all his life. He lives with his sisters who help him with the household expenses. Daniel is a very hardworking person who does maintenance work on a farm, and thanks to this he gets the income needed to support his family.

His house has been deteriorating with the passage of time and is in need of repairs. Daniel does not have the necessary cash, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheeting, nails, tiles, and the payment of labor to repair the roof. Currently, when it rains, the water is leaking inside the home disturbing the peace at night.

loans.use: to invest in sheeting, nails, tiles, and the payment of labor to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking farmer in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, known for her high quality vegetables. She is 61 years old and married with three adult age children.

She has been an active member of Paglaum MPC since 2004. She has been doing well with her business and successfully sent all her children to school until they finished college through her farming activities.

She wants to prepare for this planting season, so she asks for a loan to buy high quality seedlings and fertilizers, and pay for seed bed preparations and mounting of the trellis.

loans.use: to buy high quality seedlings and fertilizers, and pay for seed bed preparations and mounting of the trellis.

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Jacquiline wants to send her deepest gratitude to lenders who extended their financial help to her. Without the amount, it might take some time before she can refill bulk quantity of grocery products for her variety store business. The amount became a way for her to attract patrons and increase her sales.

The earning from her variety store business is what she uses to pay for bills and other expenses. That’s why she’s determined to make her business grow for her family. She wants to save money for her them and offer complete products to customers as well. That’s why she applied for a loan of Php 40,000 to add grocery items to her variety store and be also incorporated to her revolving fund.

Jacquiline is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is grateful for the PHP 50,000 loan assistance previously granted to her. This amount helped her buy materials needed for the business. Her customers can now choose from a wide range of designs with good quality materials. She also want to thank lenders for the financial provision they’ve provided.

Merlyn aims to expand the business and attract new customers since that’s where she gets support for their daily expenses. She decided to apply for another loan worth PHP 50,000 because she is planning to join a trade fair where she can have the opportunity to showcase her products. The amount will be used as added capital for her to buy raw materials in making doormats, mattresses and cushions.

Merlyn is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members. This is where she gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for raw supplies needed in her rug-making business.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik, her husband and their son live in Gugarq village. 5 years ago, Hasmik and her husband had an opportunity to start a of their own selling food products in their village community since there are no stores selling basic foodstuffs in the village.

The requested loan is very important for Hasmik and her husband to purchase the car needed for transportation of food products to their market. For them, what's most important is to satisfy their customers' demand and keep the stock in the market fresh and updated.

loans.use: to pay for a car needed for transportation of food products to the store

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Antonieta is 46 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Antonieta has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business such as vegetables, meat, etc.

Antonieta has been in this business for two years. In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business such as vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 56 years old and she lives with her single daughter (she is employed) in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Mariam graduated Yerevan State University the Philological faculty. Started from 1988 till today she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. Mariam is very patient and clever pedagogue who always finds different ways and enough time to explain and help her pupils to understand the grammar of Armenian Language and find out the beauty of Armenian Literature.

Now this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Mariam wants to use for the purchase of computer, accessories for it and also several methodological books of pedagogy, which will help her in self-development activities, which as she mentions must be inseparable part of any pedagogue.

loans.use: for the purchase of computer, accessories for it and also several methodological books of pedagogy, which will help her in self-development activities

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna, 37 years old divorced woman lives in Kutaisi city, west Georgia. She has 2 children and earns a living working as a governess at the local kindergarten. She gets 250 GEL fixed salary, that is really hardly enough for 2 children even covering the basic needs.

Khatuna decided to start clothing trading business with the loan, that she requested among local financial institutions but her credit requests were rejected several times, as she was not solvent. Khatuna received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.

Khatuna plans to start trading business with clothing, which she will purchase in the capital at wholesale prices and will sell in her community in increased prices.
This credit will be a great support for the family. Khatuna is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to generate income and make better living condition for her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothing, start selling and be able to support her children

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 52 years old, married with four adult-age children and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is a farmer who, together with her husband, is engaged in corn production.

She decided to sign up for PMPC's membership program and used the Pang-Uma Livelihood Program (PULP) — a program intended to extend financial and non-financial support to farmers like her.

Editha is glad with the support she's receiving and tried her best to pay all her monetary obligations with the cooperative.

Editha's success opened a new door for her to venture into a motorcycle transport business that provides local transportation facilities. She successfully managed to acquire three motorcycles, and this time, she wanted to buy a slightly used motorcycle and buy spare parts for its repair, so she asks for a loan from the co-op.

Editha is thankful to the co-op for all the help she receives.

loans.use: to buy a slightly used motorcycle and buy spare parts for its repair.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.en: Zulaykho was born in 1973 year. She is married and has 3 children. Zulaykho lives with her family in a village which is located in the South part of Tajikistan. Zulaykho works hard from early morning till late evening. She has been busy with farming more than 20 years. Zulaykho grows crops and vegetables. She has a great experience in this field. Zulaykho’s husband and children help her with growing crops. Now, she is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Democrito

texts.en:
Democrito is a retired government employee and has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2001. He had taken various loan products and insurance services.

His first loan with the cooperative was used in venturing into a motorcycle transport business, and he had successfully repaid the loan without records of default. He had successfully expanded his business, and even until his retirement from government service, he vigorously managed it well.

At this time, he has failing health conditions, and he wants to keep his physique in good condition. He asks for a loan to pay for a medical check-up and purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up and purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma has a wide experience in fishing. She has mastered the craft of managing a fishing business, from refueling to costing and selling the catch to buyers. Emma has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Like a fisherman who patiently waits for a catch, Emma has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows that she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, wood, sealant and bronze nails for her fishing boat repair, and to buy fishing net.

Someday, Emma hopes to buy another fishing vessel that can potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, wood, sealant and bronze nails for her fishing boat repair, and to buy fishing net.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria con 62 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera, vive en casa propia ,junto a su hijo,en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Victoria se dedica a la venta de calzado y ropa para damas, niños, su tienda está ubicada en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para invertir en compra de productos para venta y otros gastos personales. Con ello obtendrá mayor venta y así poder generar mayores ingresos para una mejora en su calidad de vida.

Victoria cuenta con experiencia crediticia en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, realizando sus pagos de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 62-year-old single mother who lives in her own house together with her son in the Cayalti district of Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Department, Peru. Most of the people who live here engage in farming, commerce and livestock.

Victoria sells shoes and clothing for women and children. Her store is located in her house. She is asking for a loan to invest in buying items for sale and to cover other personal expenses. This will increase her sales and generate more income, leading to a better quality of life.

Victoria has borrowed from Edpyme Alternativa before and has made her payments on time.

loans.use: to invest in products for sale and other personal expenses.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 47 years old. She is married and blessed with 5 children. 

Her business is operating a restaurant. She has been in the business for 3 years. She earns a monthly income of thirty thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to purchase rice, cooking oil, charcoal, wheat and maize flour etc. for the restaurant.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children and improve her family’s living standard. 

Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and have all her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, charcoal, wheat and maize flour etc. for the restaurant.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 59 years old, married and has five children. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 32 years old and married with two children.

Janice works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Janice has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Janice aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad's Group

texts.en:
Financial difficulties and a seeming lack of qualifications did not prevent Mohammad and ‎Iman from achieving their dreams. They have determinedly confronted and overcome their ‎challenges, emerging triumphantly.‎

Mohammad is 59 years old. He retired from the military after he suffered a car accident, ‎which prevented him from completing his career path, due to the injury that ‎occurred to his foot. He is married to Iman who is 43 years old and they have five kids, ‎Iman is an amazing wife and ambitious woman who decided to stand with her husband. ‎

Mohammad, worked with his sibling in selling used clothes and after he got good experience ‎in this field he decided to open his own business, shared with Iman.‎

Mohammad and Iman have their own business now and they want to increase their profit to ‎be able to provide good and comfortable lives for their children. Because of that, they applied ‎for a loan to buy more clothes to sell and improve the standards of living for their life.‎

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell and improve the standards of living for their life.‎.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen, following his family tradition, decided to earn his family's living in the farming business. He currently keeps livestock of 6 cows, 3 pigs and cultivates wheat as a main crop for reselling at the local market.

Gurgen lives with his wife and two little kids. His primary income comes from the sale of milk, wheat, meat and the main challenge he faces is the lack of sufficient capital to take advantage of business opportunity.

The requested loan will greatly help Gurgen to purchase two oxen, forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for autumn cultivation. He hopes that extra income from this loan will help him to pay for providing appropriate living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for autumn cultivation

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is from Sindangan. She has a wide experience in retailing and has mastered retailing activities, from buying products to sell, to costing and financial management and rolling up part of her profit for business expansion.

Lucena has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Lucena has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, she applied for a loan to restock her store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, coffee, confectioneries and condiments.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, coffee, confectioneries and condiments.

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad was able to buy school supplies and other grocery items when she received the loan assistance worth Php 30,000. She want to thank CCT and all the lenders for their generosity in helping people to keep running their business. Without your help, she’ll not be able to buy bulk quantity of products to add to the business. Most of all, she want to thank God for providing CCT and lenders as a medium of blessings to her. 

She’s determined to succeed in the business for her three children who are still studying. She spends her day managing the variety store and her internet café business as well. She’s praying that God will send more patrons for her to earn more. Trinidad is applying for another loan of Php 50,000 to buy more stocks of school supplies and grocery items and also purchase another computer set for her internet café business. 

Trinidad is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and grocery items for her variety store and a computer set for her internet cafe business.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a butchery where he sells meat, which he has been involved in for 7 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Manolita

texts.en:
Manolita is a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for year now. She is a 50-years-old microentrepreneur and focuses on managing a buy and sell business of ready-to-wear clothes. An approximate amount of Php 20,000 is what earns every month and praying that God will continually provide more customers to earn more revenue for her family. 

Like other entrepreneurs, Manolita wants to make the business grow. She aims to attract more customers and save money for future needs. She wants to have more stocks of ready-to-wear-clothes for her buy and sell business, that’s why she applied for a loan of Php 15,000. This amount will really be a great help for her business’ growth.

Manolita believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to have more stocks of ready-to-wear-clothes for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Coreta

texts.en:
Coreta is 60 years old and married with two children. Coreta works very hard to provide for them.

Coreta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Coreta has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Coreta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Dedeh

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Dedeh, one of Ruma's agents. Dedeh lives in South Bandung, located in West Java, about three hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her children. She owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their children’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. Her community sees Dedeh as friendly and informative mobile service provider. 

As the business grows, Dedeh needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. 

Dedeh is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra lives in Liquisa and her business is drugstore. She lives near as many people, so she has one idea to open drugstore for everybody so who is want to need should not be far away. She had opened her business a few year ago, but she earning a good income every day because many people come to buy drugs in her drugstore, so she is very happy with her business.

Now she is applying for a loan of $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger her drugstore in the future. She started to open her business with her awn working capital. She is taking this loan because she wants used to buy more drugs like , ampicillin, paracetamol, antalgin, cough, headache medicine, syrup children and others. She hopes with this loan, her business can be improving in the future.

loans.use: to buy ampicillin, paracetamol, antalgin, cough, headache medicine, syrup children and others.

loans.name: Regalo De Dios Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL REGALO DE DIOS ESTA CONFORMADA POR DIES INTEGRANTES NUEVE MUJERES  Y UN HOMBRES, ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE SU FAMILIA. LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR  Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJRA A TEMPRANA EDAD,EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SEGUIR ADELANTE Y BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES CINTHIA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS DE FORMA AMBULANTE POR ENCARGO Y EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS OCHO HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS COMO: VANIDADES, RUBOR, SOMBRAS, LAPIZ DE OJOS, LABIALES, CREMAS DESMAQUILLADORAS, ANTIOJERAS, CORRECTOR, BODY,PERFUMES ETC. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO, PARA SASTIFACER LA NECESIDADES DEL CLIENTE Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS.
texts.en:
The communal bank Regalo de Dios [Gift of God] is made up of ten members, nine women and one man, all from Sauce.

They are hard-working, responsible people with a strong desire for personal growth. They enjoy being with their families in their free time. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources they were unable to attend school and had to go to work at a young age. Today they struggle to get ahead and to offer better living conditions to their children.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, Cinthia is the coordinator of the group. She sells cosmetics door-to-door, by order, and from her house. She works eight hours every day selling such items as makeup, blush, eye shadow, eye pencils, lipstick, makeup removers, concealers, body lotions, perfumes, etc. The loan will be used to invest in working capital to stock her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to increase her income in the not-too-distant future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as makeup, eye shadow, blush, eye liner, moisturizers, concealer, eye pencil, lipstick, body lotion, perfumes, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
For the past 13 years, Luisa operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sold basic merchandise ranging from edible oil, seasonings, noodles, energy drink, bread, soap, toothpaste, soft drinks and dry goods.
She is 52 year old, a widow and has a nineteen-year old child.

Luisa caters mostly neighbors and locals in the community where she lives.
She hails from the rural town of Talibon, Bohol.

She decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost her livelihood. She wants to buy sack of rice, sack of pollard(pig feed) and drinks like beer and pepsi. In these way, her income will slowly improve and enables her to pay her obligation.

In the future,Luisa is hopeful that she will become successful.

loans.use: to buy sack of rice, sack of pollard(pig feed) and drinks like beer and pepsi

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in  a favourable area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Dionella

texts.en:
Dionella is 53 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Dionella is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dionella has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from general store and raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a married woman with five children. Elenita is 46 years old and one of her children is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elenita has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Elenita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Elenita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Elenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 50 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Gina has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Gina has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot with his big family lives in Varser village of Gegharkunik region. He lives now with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and also two grandchildren. He hurries to be thankful for his first Kiva loan that he had several years ago and hopes for one more partnership.

Ashot is a bookkeeper, and he has worked in his profession for many years for different organizations. At present, Ashot works in rural administration, runs farming and also sells his farm products. His son now greatly helps Ashot in these works which he used to do with his mother when she had no health problems.

Now Ashot and all his family members are worried and greatly upset by this question, since Ashot’s wife must take a course of treatment to control her illness, but the family has great financial hardships to solve this problem now. The loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Ashot asks with great hope, that this will greatly help his wife and lighten the hard situation and discomfort that the illness causes her.

loans.use: Ashot’s wife must take a course of treatment to control her illness and a loan  will greatly help his wife and lighten the hard situation and discomfort that the illness causes her.

loans.name: Suwarni

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients,Suwarni, who is a 44-year-old married woman with two sons and two daughters. Suwarni is a housewife and her husband is an employee. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah.
