This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to clear water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Suwarni will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to clear water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Jean Edouard

texts.fr:
Jean Edouard  est fournisseur de cornets à glace. Avant, il  faisait, comme activité, la réparation et la recharge des batteries. Il  a abandonné cette première activité en raison des problèmes de santé dus à l’odeur de l’acide. Un fournisseur de cornets à glace vendait les produits en face de son local, d’où l’idée de créer sa propre unité depuis une dizaine d’année.
Jean Edouard est marié. Sa femme l’appuie dans cette activité. Leurs trois enfants (32-28-26 ans) sont tous déjà mariés. Le couple vit dans la maison de ses parents. Pour développer l’activité, il prévoit d’investir dans l’acquisition de matériels  pour la fabrication de cornets à glace pour  augmenter son marge bénéficiaire. Le prêt sert à acheter des cornets à glace en biscuit  pour les revendre aux fabricants de glace du quartier.
texts.en:
Jean Edouard is an ice cream cone supplier. In the past, he was in the business of repairing and recharging batteries. He gave up that business because the smell of the battery acid was causing him health problems. An ice cream cone supplier was selling his products opposite Jean Edouard's place of business, and that gave Jean Edouard the idea to create his own outlet some 10 years ago.

Jean Edouard is married. His wife helps him with his business. Their three children (32, 28, and 26 years old) are all already married. The couple live in the house belonging to his parents. In order to develop his business, Jean Edouard intends to invest in the acquisition of materials to manufacture ice cream cones so as to grow his profit margin. This loan will allow him to buy ice cream cones to resell to makers of ice cream in his area.

loans.use: to buy ice cream cones to resell to makers of ice cream in his area.

loans.name: Geghecik

texts.en:
Geghecik is from Dalarik village of Armavir region. She currently lives alone as her two sons live and work abroad as migrant laborers. 
Geghecik runs her family farm and is experienced in pig breeding mostly. 
She has one worker in the household helping with cattle breeding. The requested loan is very important for Geghecik to enable her to purchase forage for feeding the livestock during the winter. She currently owns 20 pigs, 60 piglets and 50 hens and it is very difficult for her financially to prepare winter forage for it. Geghecik's dream is to have successful and profitable farming business, so her sons will be able to come back and stay in their motherland.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock during the winter

loans.name: Annmarie

texts.en:
Annmarie is a 24-year-old, married woman with three children. She makes and sells pancakes and pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business.

Annmarie needs a loan to buy bags of flour, baking soda, vegetable oil, a bag of sugar and a fryer. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to pay for her children's school fees.

Annmarie has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, baking soda, vegetable oil, a bag of sugar and a fryer.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita operates a cycle rickshaw or pedicab in Tagalog. (It is one of the common means of public transportation in the Philippines). She wants to thank the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and all Kiva lenders for their consideration and support with her previous loan. Without that loan, she would not know where to get enough money to maintain her pedicab. She’s now earning approximately PHP 18,000 every month.

Now, Juanita wants to continue what she has started. She is applying again for a new loan worth PHP 15,000. She’ll use the amount to buy spare parts as well as pay the maintenance cost of the vehicle.

She wants to have their house renovated and become successful someday. Juanita is praying that God will touch the hearts of people who have the capability to help those who are in need.

Juanita has been consistent in attending her CCT fellowship group that consists of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners; this has made her become strong spiritually and dependent on God for every occasion.

loans.use: buy spare parts and pay the maintenance cost of her pedicab.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia was able to buy packs of biscuits for her business with her previous loan. She wants to send her gratitude to all the people who are part of the Kiva program.

Aside from selling repacked biscuits, Eugenia also sells viands (local delicacies) for lunch and dinner. She operates her businesses rain or shine. Through these, she’s able to pay for her children’s education and other household expenses.

Eugenia is already starting to save money for their future and planning to make an investment some day. She decided to apply for another loan of PHP 17,000. She will use the money to keep her food vending business operational. The loan will buy packs of biscuits, as well as raw ingredients for making and selling viands that she regularly offers to her customers.

Despite being busy managing the business, Eugenia spares time to attend CCT group fellowship. The groups consist of 10-15 individuals. Eugenia gains strength spiritually and hears testimonies from other CCT partners. She also hears God’s word, studies the Word of God, builds social relationship with other partners, and pays microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits for repackaging and selling, as well as to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 29 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as biscuits, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Violeta has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as biscuits, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Xin

texts.en:
Xin, 27, is a single young man living with his parents. He has been working as a school doctor in a vocational school more than three years. Xin was born in a poor family and with the help of his poor family, he finished his study in university while which placed a heavy financial burden on his family.

He requested 20,000 from Microcred to stock medicines and health products because he wants to enlarge the size of his health store business. Currently, Xin and his family live in the school that was rented three years ago. Xin and his mother have needed to do some home improvements for a long time, but have invested their earnings in Xin’s business.
In the future, Xin wishes he could earn enough money and to buy a house for his parents.

loans.use: to stock medicines and health products

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena has been involving in business activity a few years ago, with her own working capital. She is married and she has 1 child. She was also one of the entrepreneurs and her business is selling cows. Her husband is a farmer, so he was very supportive for her to sell cows.

Now she is requesting a loan of $ 1,000.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to add with their capital to buy more cows, because she wants to enlarge her business. She was very happy with the loan that is offered by Tuba Rai Metin, because she can be increasing her incomes in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cows for sale.

loans.name: Koki

texts.en:
Koki is a 42-year-old, married woman with four children. She makes and sells pancakes, donuts, and pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business.

Koki needs a loan to buy an oven, a bag of flour, bags of sugar and vegetable oil for her business, and to buy timber, cement and iron roofing for home improvement. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies.

Koki has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy an oven, a bag of flour, bags of sugar and vegetable oil for her business, and to buy timber, cement and iron roofing for home improvement.

loans.name: Bebeliz

texts.en:
Bebeliz is thankful to God for everything He has blessed them with. She’s grateful for the people He used to provide the PHP 10,000 loan assistance that helped her buy more fresh eggs.

She’s a mother and business woman who dreams of expanding her tailoring business and small egg store for her children's future. She also wants to invest in other types of business, such as manufacturing bags and different kinds of clothing items. But for now, Bebeliz applied for a PHP 10,000 loan to buy more fresh eggs for her store.

On a weekly basis, Bebeliz regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience in business. She draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listens to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more supplies of eggs to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 35 years old. She is married and blessed with 3 children. 

Her business is retail shop and popcorn. She has been in the business for 4 years. 

She earns a monthly income of sixty thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to purchase another popcorn machine.  

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase another popcorn machine.

loans.name: Aidai

texts.en:
Kyrgyzstan’s economy is still weak. Aidai believes that her generation and future generations can make a great impact on it through education and hard work. Her dream is to see Kyrgyzstan well-developed in the future and to be proud of her country, telling its history to her grandchildren.

Aidai’s family consists of five people: her parents, herself and her two younger sisters, who are schoolgirls. Her father works two jobs to make ends meet. Her mother has a low-paying job, which earns her less than 100 USD per month. While studying at school Aidai wanted to enter a good university with an international atmosphere, where she could achieve her future goals. She believes that AUCA not only has an excellent reputation and prestige, but also is the best university in Central Asia. She believes that attending AUCA will help her to obtain important skills and knowledge in her field. She considers the chance to study in English and the opportunity to participate in an exchange program as the most important advantages of AUCA.

Aidai needs financial support because her parents are not able to cover her university tuition fee by themselves. They used to have some savings from living in a relative’s house and using public transportation instead of having their own vehicles. However, unfortunately, her father twice suffered from health problems and they spent their savings for the surgeries. Aidai hopes that a Kiva loan will give her the confidence to finish her studies without creating problems or inconveniences to her parents.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee in the Journalism and Mass Communications Program.

loans.name: Kloupui Kokoli

texts.fr: Mariée, Kloupui est une veuve femme avec deux enfants à charge. Kloupui est âgée de 49 ans et habite à Tokoin où elle prépare et vend de la pâte bandée faite à base du maïs appelée « Akpan ». Kloupui achète le nécessaire servant à la préparation cinq fois par mois au marché et vend sa marchandise à la devanture de son domicile. Kloupui demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs et le tas de condiments en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices afin de subvenir à ses besoins et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Married, Kloupui is a widow with two children whom she supports. Kloupui is 49-years-old and lives in Tokoin where she makes and sells stretched dough made from a corn base called "Akpan."

Kloupui buys the required ingredients five times a month at the market and sells her dough from the front of her home. Kloupui is asking for this loan to order bags of corn and stocks of condiments.

Her goal is to make more profits in order to meet her needs and improve her children's daily living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 11 bags of corn and 2 stocks of condiments.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
In a rented store located in the center of Vanadzor town, Naira sells home supplies. She works with different distributors and also have couple of agreements signed with local schools, to supply them with some products.
Naira lives with her husband, mother, grandmother and little son, Suren.

She works day and night to sustain her store and gather income from her family's living. The requested loan is very important for Naira to purchase new stock of home supplies for reselling in the store and covering current market demand. It is very important for her to keep the stock updated and satisfy her customers' demand.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of home supplies for reselling in the store and covering current market demand

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
In Tsovaygugh village of Gegharkunik region lives Anahit with her husband (he is a framer and he also works at the local weather forecast station), son and daughter. She has vocational pedagogical education and started from 1999 till today, she is doing one of the most interesting jobs in the world. She is a librarian at the local school. She finds her work the one that makes a person wiser and despite having many problems and hardships of everyday life, there is a great chance to forget all of it and read, read as much as you want, which nowadays is a very rare activity.

Anahit is very accurate person and takes care of the library books very properly since the majority of them are very old and also very precious and at the same time, she demands from the pupils to return the books after reading clean and unscathed.

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Anahit asks as she wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and she also wants take part in paid courses of computer training, so that she will be able to work on it and be aware of any innovations in the world of literature.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it and she also wants take part in paid courses of computer training, so that she will get aware of any innovations in the world of literature.

loans.name: Samrong

texts.en:
Samrong runs a small grocery shop with her husband in Yeav Village. As a vendor, she needs to get up early in the morning to prepare her shop and stand by in the shop the whole day.

She needs to consume a lot of energy to run her business till nighttime; however, the car battery is not reliable. Sometimes the battery runs out during a peak hour that has a lot of customers. Her current energy is not convenient for her to run her business smoothly. It has a short life span and needs to charge every two or three days.

Therefore, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system to sustain her business energy usage and also her family usage. With the solar home system, she doesn’t have to be concerned about sudden power outages anymore. She can run her business smoothly and reduce her utilities fee.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Soa is a single 27 years old unmarried with 2 children. She runs a small business selling donuts, chicken roll, sausage roll, pie, drinks and more in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Soa has requested a loan to  buy a  bags of flour, a baking soda, bags of chicken legs, vegetable oil, a fryer and a bag of onions. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Soa will expand her business and to support her family financially .

loans.use: to buy a  bags of flour, a baking soda, bags of chicken legs, vegetable oil, a fryer and a bag of onions

loans.name: Sitraka Harivololona

texts.fr:
Sitraka a 33 ans. Son mari âgé de 44 ans est un chauffeur dans une société. Le couple a un enfant de deux de ans. Elle a deux garçons nés de son premier mari, l’ainé de 14 ans ne va plus à l’école. La famille vit dans une maison héritée de ses parents. 
Avant, Sitraka était vendeuse ambulante de tissus. En raison de l’insuffisance du salaire de son conjoint, elle a ouvert une unité de magasin général avec l’appui financier d’un membre de la famille en 2014. L’activité s’est développée : augmentation et diversification des produits d’un emprunt. L’un de ses atouts est la connaissance des clients. Elle habitait le quartier depuis son enfance.
Le couple prévoit de se lancer dans l’activité de transport et de restauration.  Le rêve de la famille  est de pouvoir construire et vivre dans un local beaucoup plus grand.
texts.en:
Sitraka is 33 years old. Her husband, aged 44, is a driver for a company. The couple have one child, two years of age. Sitraka has two sons from her first marriage. The older is 14 and no longer attends school. The family live in a house she inherited from her parents.

Formerly, Sitraka sold lengths of cloth as an itinerant sales person. Because her husband's salary is not sufficient, she opened a general store with the financial help of a family member in 2014. The business developed: expanded and diversified inventory thanks to a loan.

One of Sitraka's trump cards is her familiarity with her clientele. She has lived in this neighborhood since she was a child. The couple plan to get into the transport business and selling cooked food. The family dream is to be able to build and live in a much bigger space.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and dried legumes.

loans.name: Tua

texts.en:
Tua is 27 years old, single, and has one child. She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living.

Tua has requested a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy a bag of fertilizer, spade, bush knives, seeds, rake, and a weed sprayer. She has been a member of SPBD since September and joined to gain access to financial services. Tua will use her profits to support her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of fertilizer, spade, bush knives, seeds, rake, and a weed sprayer.

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Rithy and his wife run a small restaurant in Yeav Village. He and his wife need to get up early to prepare ingredients and set up the restaurant.

Running a restaurant, Rithy needs to display a TV to entertain customers. Therefore, he needs to spend a lot of energy to run this business. However, a car battery is not reliable. It has a short life span and is easily damaged. Sometimes the car battery runs out during business time.

After getting a good recommendation from a neighbor that uses solar home systems, Rithy decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar energy system. He believes this decision will improve his energy to run his business and also save on his utility fee.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy system.

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An, a farmer for over 10 years, lives in Vattanak Village with his wife and three children. He always gets up early to prepare his equipment to do farming. Beside farming, An goes to do fishing during fish season.

He puts in all his effort in order to expand his business and make his family live in better conditions. His family now is improving their conditions. However, his current power won’t make his family comfortable. It is money and time consuming. An and his wife have to take turns to go to charge the battery every two or three days.

After he found out that solar energy is the source he needs, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan to pay for a good quality solar home system. He believes the solar home system can reduce his burden and make him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Vattanak Village, Vattanak Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Soktheng

texts.en: Soktheng, an employee of a company, lives in Kratie City with wife and 2 children. Soktheng's wife runs a grocery shop to earn extra money for family. She needs energy to run her shop from early morning till night time. Even though Soktheng's family lives in Kratie City, they still has power problems because the power grip often suddenly off a lot especially during hot season. As a result, Soktheng decided to apply KIVA loan to buy high quality solar home systems. With reliable solar, Soktheng's wife can run her shop smoothly.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Kratie Village, Kratie Commune, Kratie City

loans.name: Aofia

texts.en: Aofia is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily consumption goods such as drinks, snacks, freezers and more. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. Aofia needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, bags of flour, bags of rice, drinks, bags of chicken, sausage, snacks and more. She hopes to use her profits to support her family financially and to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, bags of flour, bags of rice, drinks, bags of chicken, sausage, snacks and more.

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Sala is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community, which she has been doing for three years.

Sala requested a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy bags of flour, sacks of chickens, onions, oven, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since September. She plans to use her profits for her children's education and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sacks of chickens, onions, oven, etc.

loans.name: Mauricio Salvador

texts.es: Con 44 años de edad, Mauricio vive al lado de su madre de avanzada edad. Él en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y ofrecerle todo lo necesario a su madre, presta sus servicios en una panadería bastante fuerte en la que ha laborado durante 19 años. Gracias a esto logra satisfacer sus necesidades básicas y las de su madre, su vivienda es humilde y está construida con láminas, las cuales están deterioradas y él en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, ladrillo y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de su vivienda en el lugar que se observa en la foto y la lámina que se utilizará para el techo será la que se compró con el crédito anterior y de esta forma busca tener una condición de vida mejor al lado de su madre. Así también se encuentra muy agradecido con el crédito anterior, ya que gracias a eso pudo invertir en mejorar el techo de la vivienda en la cual reside actualmente, logrando una mejor condición de vida al lado de su madre.
texts.en:
At 44 years old, Mauricio lives with his elderly mother. In search of improving his quality of life and providing everything his mother needs, he has worked very hard for the last 19 years in a bakery. Thanks to that he is able to meet his basic needs and those of his mother. Hs house is humble, constructed with laminate sheeting that is deteriorating.

In search of bettering his quality of life he seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in sand, cement, bricks and labor for the construction of his home in the location seen in the photo. The laminate sheeting he will use for the roof will be what he bought with his earlier loan. In this manner he seeks to have better living conditions with his mother. He is also very grateful for the prior loan, since thanks to it he was able to invest in improving the roof of the house he currently resides in, achieving better living conditions with his mother at his side.

loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, bricks and labor for the construction of his house.

loans.name: Kathlyn

texts.en:
Kathlyn is 36 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For two years, Kathlyn was able to manage her farm, which met the needs of her family. Until now, the farm was doing well and providing enough cash flow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With her generated revenue, she was able to save for their future needs.

Kathlyn requested a loan, which she will use to to buy fertilizer for her crops to improve her farm. With the acquisition of basic commodities, shen expects an increase in sales to expand her farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda was born in 1986 year. She is very hardworking and kind woman. Mavluda is the married parent of 3 children. She lives in a village which is located in the North part of Tajikistan. Her husband’s income is low and that’s why she decided to start own business deal with the aim to make better living standard.

She is going to start business with rearing sheep. As she lives in a village she has a good opportunity for feeding sheep. She studied at the course “To Get Ahead” of woman organization and got a certificate. She will buy sheep feed for some months and sell them later in a local market. Her husband will help her with managing business. She is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy sheep for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and feed for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара, 30 лет, замужем, воспитывает дочь. У Чынары - среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Чынара, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Чынары, в хозяйстве у нее есть корова и 10 овец. На 1,0 Га земли выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Деятельность приносит около 14,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Chynara is 30 and married with one daughter. She has a high school education and a very good reputation among her neighbours, who call her a kind and hardworking woman. She has been farming for 10 years as a source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has one cow and 10 sheep on her farm as well as 1 hectare of land where she grows clover for her own use and for sale. Her business brings in about 14,000 KGS per month, which is the main way she covers the cost of food and her family's everyday needs.

With the goal of further developing her business, Chynara has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase two cows to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase her livestock head count

loans.name: Akossiwa  Odette

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Akossiwa est une femme célibataire avec quatre enfants à charge. Pour exercer son activité, Akossiwa vit à Tokoin et vend des bijoux en circulant les quartiers environnant pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Akossiwa s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des douzaines de de boucle d’oreilles et de chaines, Akossiwa demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat en vue de bien revendre et avoir un gain pour aider ses enfants à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Aged 48, Akossiwa is a single woman raising four children. In order to run her business, Akossiwa lives in Tokoin and sells jewelry by walking around the neighboring areas to earn her living.

Akossiwa stocks up at the market six times a month. So as to order dozens of earrings and chains, she is asking for a loan to complete her purchase and resell at a profit. She wants to help her children flourish and get a good education.

loans.use: to buy four dozen earrings and one dozen chains.

loans.name: Fiaputa

texts.en: Fiaputa is a 37 years old woman who is married with 8 children. She runs a business sewing and painting clothes in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Fiaputa has requested a loan to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, elei boards and design. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and support her family. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, elei boards and designs

loans.name: Yeranuhi

texts.en:
Yeranuhi is professional in sewing different clothing and furniture. She works at local factory and also works from her house. She separated her working room for her sewing work in her home, and receive different kind of orders from her clients in the community.

Yeranuhi lives with her younger son only, as her husband and elder son went to neighbouring country as migrant laborers. By requested this loan Yeranuhi asks lenders to support her with purchasing a sewing machine (specified for leather sewing) and materials needed for covering customers' orders.
Yeranuhi dreams of opening her own workshop in the future.

loans.use: to pay for sewing machine (specified for leather sewing) and materials needed for covering customers' orders

location.town: Zaritap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 44 years old, married woman and a mother of 6 children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She is doing it for many years with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of 60000 PKR to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time

loans.name: Maysara

texts.en:
Maysara was born in 1977 year. She is a careful mother of 4 children. Maysara’s husband is a kind man and he works in am office. Maysara always wanted to have own business deal and with this aim she took part in a course “To Get Ahead’ of women organization and got a certificate. She got a lot of useful information for herself from this course.

Maysara plans to start business with feeding cows. She has experience in this field because she has helped her parents in childhood with feeding cows. She is asking for a loan to buy cows for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows for starting her new business.

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than, a farmer and also house builder, lives in Damnak Sasar village with wife and 7 children. Than and wife get up early morning to do farming and build customers' house in the afternoon.  As an farmer and house builder over 20 years, he wants each of his child to be highly educated ; however, his family is living in a remote area without power grid. As a result, he is applying KIVA loan to buy high quality solar home systems for his family safety and his future goal. His children will be able to study at night time better than before. His whole family also can live in safety environment.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system so his children may study when it gets dark

location.town: Damnak Sasar Village, Thma Andoeurk Commune, Chetr

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is a single mother of one child.

To earn a living, she engages in selling grocery goods to members of her local community. Sheryl wants to increase the inventory of her store, and increase her sales.

Sheryl is now a new member of GDMPC. She recently took a new loan in order to buy more grocery items to sell. This will allow her to generate more income, which she will use for the education of her child.

Sheryl's plan for the future is to save more money, and to improve the general living conditions of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

location.town: P3, SEPAC, SPANG DALAGA, MISAMIS OCCIDENTAL

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania manages a display store for flowers & ornamental plants as her primary source of income. This business has enabled her to send all her children to school.

She is supported by Paglaum MPC, who is her financial partner. Recently, Epifania has asked for a loan to buy more flowers and ornamental plants for resale.

loans.use: to buy more flowers and ornamental plants for resale.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
She is Julieta, aged 48, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Happily married to Rolando, her business partner and has one child who is already in College. It is a big challenge and a struggle living in a Third World country but the couple strives hard to make a living and to be able to give their child education since a good education is a path to improve their quality of life.

Julieta is into food business for ten years already. She bakes and sells "kakanin" or Native Delicacies which are uniquely Filipino, these are sweet cakes or desserts made from sweet rice or root vegetables such as cassave and taro that are slow cooked and usually made with coconut or coconut milk. Quite laborious to make, not all households make their own "kakanin", they would rather buy than stir sticky rice for an hour. Julieta is already known for baking delicious native delicacies in her hometown and have earned regular customers at her community.

She trusts out of your good heart you could lend her funds in the amount of Php 20000 to pay the ingredients to bake cassava cakes, "buko" pies and other delicacies. She is thanking God and you in advance for your valued help. Her earnings will help fund her her child's College Education. 

She aims to expand her native delicacies store and prays for abundant blessings on her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cassava, coconut, coconut milk, sugar and equipment to bake native cakes and "buko" ( coconut) pies for sale.

loans.name: Pascrina

texts.en:
Pascrina is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes and has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient tailoring materials. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable family. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Karen Yulissa

texts.es:
Karen Yulissa con 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar junto a su cónyuge e hijas, en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Karen yulissa cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Karen Yulissa se dedica a la venta de salchipollo y hamburguesas, desde hace más de 08 años. Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo y para darle mantenimiento a su carrito sanguchero.

Karen Yulissa es socia nueva para nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa, cuenta con experiencia crediticia en otras entidades.
texts.en:
Karen Yulissa is 31 years old and in a common law marriage. She lives in her family home with her partner and daughters in the Lagunas district, in the Chiclayo province, in the department of Lambayeque, Perú. Karen Yulissa has very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the area. The people in that area work for the most part in agriculture, business, and cattle raising.

For more than 8 years Karen Yulissa has worked selling chicken sausages and hamburgers. She seeks a loan for working capital and to provide maintenance to her food cart. Karen Yulissa is a new member of the Edpyme Alternative finance institution. She has financing experience with other entities.

loans.use: to obtain working capital and to provide maintenance to her food cart.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 43 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. She sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

Editha requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items such as beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Fe is 64 years old and has one child in school.

Fe has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fabric and other materials needed in her tailoring business.

Fe has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other materials needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is 44 years old and mother of three children and lives in underprivileged areas in ‎Jordan. She is a very hard working woman and we can say that she is an example of the woman ‎who has willpower and patience. As he is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to appears in the photo instead of her.‎

Sahar and her husband were living a happy and comfortable life, until the fire happened and ‎destroyed everything in their small bakery. The fire burned everything and their hopes to ‎provide good life for their children. ‎

They hope to be able rebuild their lives and rebuild their bakery to better achieve their ‎dreams, they do not have money to do this, so they need a loan and only you can help.
‎
Sahar is an amazing wife she wants to help her husband in any way, therefore she applied ‎for a loan to help ‎her husband to installation of fire alarm devices and purchase new ‎equipment to increase the amount of his products so increase his profit..‎

loans.use: to install fire alarm devices and purchase new ‎equipment, after the family bakery was destroyed by fire.

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en: Sabreen is 29 years old married woman and lives in a house that she owns. She has had a beauty salon in her home for a few months. Sabreen has many customers as she does a very good job. With profits, Sabreen is able to move forward with her family. She is applying for a loan in order to buy products for her beauty salon, such as creams, shampoo, scissors, hair pins and other things that she needs. With these items, Sabreen can earn higher profits, thus giving her greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy products for her beauty salon, such as creams, shampoo, scissors, hair pins and other things that she needs

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 32 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Analyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Leonor is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Leonor has a fish pond business in the Philippines. Leonor requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her fish.

Leonor has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Leonor would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her fish.

loans.name: Annie Kristine

texts.en:
Annie Kristine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Annie Kristine is 25 years old and has one child in school.

Annie Kristine has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Annie Kristine requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other supplies.

Annie Kristine has been in this business for two years. In the future, Annie Kristine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other supplies

loans.name: Julliet

texts.en:
Julliet is a 32-year-old woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines. Julliet has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell. She has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future, Julliet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 51 years old and has three children who are in school.

Teresita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, rice, etc..

Teresita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old and married with eight children. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, salt, sugar, etc..

Virginia has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as  rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sannive

texts.en:
Sannive is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Sannive has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Sannive has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Sannive would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 41 years old and has five children, three of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She operates a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year.

Ludy requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 25 years old and single.

Annabelle is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Annabelle has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Delia is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Delia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell .

Delia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Marilen

texts.en:
Marilen is a live-in woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilen is 24 years old now.

Marilen has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Marilen requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Marilen has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Marilen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 57 years old, married, and has three chlidren. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Zubaida requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan for her son. Her son is a shoe maker and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing baby shoes for many year and has a lot experience in his profession. He sews Rexine (imitation leather) shoes through a machine and attaches the sole through hand stitching. He recently got a huge contract but he does not have enough funds to buy the raw material to complete the contract.

Zubaida's son will use the loan to buy raw material such as Rexine, threads, glue, soles, etc.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as Rexine, threads, glue, soles, etc. for her son's shoe making business.

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en:
Amena is 58-years-old married woman with 5 sons, two of whom currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Amena has a handcrafted beads business in her village near Nablus. She has requested a $500 loan amount through Kiva’s partner, Alibdaa, to buy beads, thread and needless. Amena has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to save enough money so she can allow sending children to college.

loans.use: to buy beads, thread and needles for her handcrafted beads business, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina lives in Atsabe; she is a tailor and she is happy to do her activities. She says that living in a town, it is very difficult to earn money: it is necessary to do profitable activities in order to survive. In looking for ways to earn money, Paulina came up with an idea to open a business sewing for all people. She began her sewing business in 2006 with her own working capital of $ 400.00.

Paulina is applying for a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin, because she wants to buy more materials like cotton, cloth, linen, measuring tapes, and other materials to use.

loans.use: to buy cotton, cloth, linen, measuring tapes, and other materials to use in her sewing business.

loans.name: Roselieta

texts.en: Roselieta is a mother of two school age children and has a motor transport business for the past nine years. Her business involves motor for hire or public transport. She does this work to support her children. She asked a loan to purchase another motor unit. Owning another one will increase her income and would be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase another motor unit.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita makes good earning on her farming activities in Pagadian City. This is how she supports her family and able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield especially that she has high cost of living when her children entered college. Emelita approached Paglaum to loan an amount to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en:
Hezron is 29 year old and is a stationary supplier at Voi Kenya. He is single and has been in this business for the last one year and the business has been profitable.

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya and he successfully repaid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to purchase stationary such as files, envelopes, pens and books for sell and hopes this will enable him to get more income to expand his business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his bookstore by buying more stationary in bulk. In future he hopes to expand his business and become the biggest supplier of stationary in Voi town.

loans.use: to purchase stationary such as files, envelopes, pens and books for sell and hopes this will enable him to get more income to support his family.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edwina is 56 years old and has one child in school.

Edwina has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Edwina requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as fish, vegetables, spices, etc.

Edwina has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business such as fish, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is experienced and professional hairdresser with his loyal client base in Masis town. He lives with his wife and newborn son, Armen. Albert currently works at rented beauty salon, but has plans of opening his own and work there.
For the accomplishment of his plans,  Albert needs financial support. The requested loan will help him to pay for renovation and opening of the beauty salon, purchase materials and tools for hairdressing service. 
Albert hopes to receive lenders' support and start his own beauty salon and welcome his devoted clients there.

loans.use: to pay for renovation and opening of his beauty salon, purchase materials and tools for hairdressing service.

loans.name: Fawzia

texts.en:
Fawzia is married and her husband is retired with low income. She has two children and lives ‎in Baqaa. She is a conservative woman and asked her husband to take her place in the photo instead of her.‎

‎She has had a business raising poultry for five years, she started her business after she ‎decided to help her husband in any way to make their life more comfortable, and her ‎business is doing well.

‎Fawzia needs a loan to buy more chickens for her business and to improve her business ‎premises. With this investment, she hopes to increase her income and provide her family ‎with better living conditions.

‎She dreams of having a better corral to raise chickens in and to improve her business.‎

loans.use: to buy more chickens for her business.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is young farmer from Mrgastan village of Ejmiatsin region. She is married and has two little sons, 7 and 5 years old. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country, who went to provide his family with an appropriate living.

Tio tackles financial hardships, and covering daily expenses. She runs their family farm and keeps only one cow and cultivates potatoes, haricot, cucumbers and greens in their yard. The requested loan is important for her farming business.

Anahit plans to purchase potato seeds and some fertilizer for organizing autumn cultivation and gathering income for family. This will help her to sustain the farming business and ensure income in the winter season.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and some fertilizer for organizing autumn cultivation and gathering income for family

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro proviene de una familia muy sacrificada que lucha y se esfuerza por poder crecer y salir adelante. Él trabaja y estudia al mismo tiempo para poder solventar sus estudios de ingeniero electrónico.
Es una persona que se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y asi poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alvaro comes from a very hardworking family that struggles every day to earn a living and get ahead. He works and studies at the same time so he can pay for his electrical engineering courses. He is the kind of person who makes a great effort so he can improve his living conditions and those of his family.

Alvaro is seeking a loan to pay for his university courses so that he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: pay for his university courses

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.es:
Bienvenido es de la ciudad de Santaní, es estudiante de ingeniería agrónoma, trabaja a la vez en una tabacalera para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Está poniendo sus mayores esfuerzos para poder tener su título y de esa forma poder convertirse en un buen profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Bienvenido is from the town of Santaní. He is an agricultural engineering student and also has a job in a tobacconist at the same time so he can improve his standard of living.

Bienvenido is putting in a great effort to graduate and get a good professional job. He is seeking a loan to cover the expenses he is facing in order to graduate.

loans.use: pay for his university graduation expenses

loans.name: Cintia

texts.es:
Cintia continua con sus estudios en ingeniería comercial, por medio de sus conocimientos quiere poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Ella es una persona luchadora que se esfuerza para recibir su titulo y ayudar a través de el a su familia.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Cintia continues with her studies in commercial engineering. Through her knowledge she wants to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones, She is a fighter who is trying hard to get her degree and with it help her family.

She is requesting this new loan to be able to pay the fees for her course and in this way she can continue with her studies. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to be somebody in life.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es de la Ciudad de Villarrica, es una persona que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Lidia está estudiando una especialidad en psicología clínica, y por medio de su estudio quiere abrirse camino para hacerse conocida para poder ayudar a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lidia is from the town of Villarica. She is the kind of person who works hard to get ahead and help her family. She is studying clinical psychology and hopes to open up a path so she can become known as a person who can help others.

Lidia is seeking a loan to pay for her university courses so she can continue her studies.

loans.use: pay for her university courses in clinical psychology

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL RÍOS DE AGUA VIVA ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTE SIETE MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES CON DIES HIJOS TODOS MEJORES DE EDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DE MALPAISILLO, LUGAR QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR LA PRODUCCIÓN DE LECHE, EN LA ACTUALIDAD SE DEDICAN  A SUPERARSE EN EL CAMPO LABORAR COMO PERSONAL, PARA ASEGURARSE QUE SUS HIJOS TENGAN LA ESTABILIDAD QUE SE MERECEN.
GRACIA  A SUS GANA  DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES RAQUEL Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA DE FRITANGA NEGOCIO QUE CONSISTEN EN LA VENTA DE COMIDA CASERA COMO: GALLO PINTO, TACOS, ENCHILADAS, MADUROS, QUESO FRITO, CARNE ASADA, POLLO ASADO, TAJADAS  MANUELITAS ETC. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, ELLA DEDICA SU NEGOCIO UNAS DIES HORAS DIARIAS DESDE LAS 2:00 PM HASTA 12:00 PM OFRECIENDO SU COMIDA.  EL OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES COMPRA PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES PARA LA ELABORACIÓN DE LA FRITANGA Y VENDER A LOS CLIENTES. LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL RÍOS DE AGUA VIVA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONA DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The community bank Ríos de Agua Viva is made up of eight members: seven women and one man. They are responsible mothers and fathers, with a total of ten children, who are all grown. They are originally from Malpaisillo, a place that is characterized by its production of milk. Currently, they are dedicated to excelling in the workforce in order to ensure that their children have the stability that they deserve.
Thanks to her motivation to get ahead, the coordinator is Raquel. Her economic activity is selling fried foods.
Her business consists of selling prepared foods such as: beans and rice, tacos, enchiladas, plantain, fried cheese, beef, chicken, rolled pancakes, etc.
The business is located in her home. She works in her business some 10 hours everyday, from 2:00pm until 12:00 midnight, offering her food. The objective of the loan is to buy products for making the fried foods that she sells to her customers.
The community bank Ríos de Agua Viva is grateful for the help from the Kiva investors who give to people of limited resources and poor countries, such as Nicaragua in order that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to make fried foods such as: beans and rice, tacos, enchiladas, plantains, fried cheese, rolled pancakes, fried chicken, etc.

loans.name: Willie

texts.en:
Willie is engaged in copra (coconut meat dried for oil production) production in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She has been doing this type of business for almost 30 years. This business activity had supported her family and continuously supports even her grandchildren. She is also an active member of Paglaum MPC, making it her fiancial partner.

Recently, she availed a loan to buy coconuts for copra making.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for copra making.

loans.name: Mary Lord

texts.en: Mary Lord is juggling managing her farming business and supervising the renovation of her home. Mary Lord hopes to live comfortably in a house of good cemented walls supported by her loan of Php 25,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with good repayment record. Mary Lord was given a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. She is thankful that all her financing needs on her farming business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement, hollow blocks, iron rods, and other materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Doniyor

texts.en:
Doniyor is married and has four children. He is a kind and hardworking man. He lives in a house which is located in a rural area. Doniyor raises potatoes in 1 ha land and wheat in 1 ha land, which he has been doing for 15 years. His children and wife help him with managing his business.

Doniyor must make new sowing but he has no money to buy mineral fertilizers and potato seeds. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase those items.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and potato seeds.

loans.name: Romano

texts.en:
Romano wants to see all his children finish college and land good jobs so that they will be spared from poverty. He is a hardworking and honest security guard and a responsible family man. He never gets too tired to work hard for his family.

Romano requested a loan from Paglaum MPC, which he will use to pay the tuition fees of his daughter .

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees of his daughter.

loans.name: Phirlita

texts.en:
Phirlita is 41 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Phirlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Phirlita has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Phirlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 59 years old now.

Lucita has a spice-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of spices to sell.

Lucita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of spices to sell.

loans.name: Sherlee Bona

texts.en:
Sherlee Bona is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sherlee Bona is 55 years old now.

Sherlee Bona has a buy-and-sell home care products business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like mosquito killer, soap, etc..

Sherlee Bona has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like mosquito killer, soap, etc.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is 46 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She sells a variety of items.

Luzvilla requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as eggs, coffee, personal care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items such as eggs, coffee, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
Lida estudia la carrera en Nutrición gracias a que cuenta con  la ayuda de sus padres. Ella con  esfuerzo y dedicación  está siguiendo su carrera y comenta que cuando culmine sus estudio quiere un consultorio privado y también trabajar en un hospital público.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera,  y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lida is studying Nutrition thanks to being able to count on the support of her parents. With effort and dedication she is continuing her course. She commented that when she completes her studies she would like to work in a private practice and also work in a public hospital.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the payment of her course fees and in this way be able to continue her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: May Marie

texts.en:
May Marie has always enthusiastically managed her retail store that gives her an approximate income of PHP 9,000 per month. She needs to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family, especially since their eldest child is already in college.

May Marie is 42 years old and an active member of Paglaum MPC, her partner in all her financial needs for her business ventures.

Recently, she availed a loan of PHP 20,000 as additional capital so that she can supply the demands of her growing number of patronizers. The amount will be used to buy additional inventories of beauty soap, whitening agents and other things.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories of beauty soap, whitening agents and other things.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira has had a piggery business for more almost a decade. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed.

Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring, and harvesting. She has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, Saturnina has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Saturnia requested a loan, which she will use to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. She hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate to add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 41 years old and married with four children.

Angelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

Angelita has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Angelita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 44 years old and has three children. Betty is married and has two children who are in school.

Betty is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Betty requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Betty has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Betty would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, tiene 21 años, está en el cuarto año de la carrera de Administración de empresas agropecuarias, proviene de una familia muy humilde integrada por 5 personas.
Él está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder cumplir con sus metas de ser un profesional exitoso y luchador.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is from Caaguazú city, is 21 years old, and is in his fourth year of the Farm Management Program.  

He comes from a very poor family made up of 5 people.

He is putting his utmost efforts to meet his goals of being a successful, dedicated professional.

He is requesting this loan to invest in his career fees and thus able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la Ciudad de San Ignacio, está estudiando la carrera de ciencias contables, luchando por ser un profesional útil para los demás.
Ella está luchando y esforzándose por mejorar cada día, desea ser una profesional exitosa que quiere lograr sus objetivos propuestos como persona y estudiante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mariais from the city of San Ignacio. She is studying Accounting Sciences striving to become a professional useful to others.

She is fighting and trying hard to improve each day. She wants to be a successful professional and wants to fulfill her personal objectives and her objectives as a student.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the payment of her course fees and in this way be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 61 years old, married, and has four children.

Elisa is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Elisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Elisa has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Yanny

texts.es:
Yanny es una joven estudiante de Psicologia, ella solicita un prestamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: 

Mi nombre es Yanny, tengo 23 años de edad y soy soltera. Nací La República Dominicana, donde vivo en la actualidad con mis padres y mis dos hermanos, los cuales se dedican al cultivo y venta de flores.

Estudio en la Universidad la carrera de Psicología, porque me gusta ayudar a las Personas en especial a los niños y adolescentes que tienen problemas de aprendizaje. 
Las materias basadas a la psicología son mis favoritas. 

Este préstamo me es necesario para yo poder estudiar, ya que en el lugar en donde vivo no hay fuentes de empleo y tengo que trasladarme a la universidad más cercana que es a 30 km. Si no recibiera el préstamo no podré estudiar, porque no tengo el dinero para pagar pasaje y a la vez la mensualidad de la universidad.

Mi meta académica es aprender mucho sobre la Psicología para ayudar a la comunidad y sobre todo a mi familia. Después de terminar la carrera quiero trabajar en un centro educativo en el sector de La Palma de Constanza, ya que en este lugar hay muchos niños/as con problemas de aprendizaje.

A la persona que me favorezca el préstamo le estaré más que agradecida ya que este préstamo cambiará mi vida.
texts.en:
Yanny is a young woman studying Psychology. She is applying for a loan to cover her educational expenses, this is her history: 

My name is Yanny, I am 23 years old and I'm single. I was born and raised in the Dominican Republic where I live currently with my parents and my two brothers, who work growing and selling flowers. 

I study psychology at a local University, because I like to help people, especially children and adolescents who have learning problems. The courses based on Psychology are my favorites. 

This loan is necessary for me to be able to study, since in the place where I live there are no sources of employment and I have to get myself to the closest university, which is 30 km away. If I don't receive this loan I won't be able to study, because I don't have the money to pay the transit fare or the monthly university fee. 

My academic goal is to learn a lot about Psychology to be able to help the community and, above all, my family. After finishing the degree, I want to work in an education center in the sector of La Palma de Constanza, since in this place there are many children with learning problems. 

To the people who choose to fund the loan, I will be more than thankful since this loan will change my life.

loans.use: to cover higher education expenses.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria continua con sus estudios en ciencias contables, esta poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar en todo lo que se propone como profesional y como estudiante. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder cubrir parte de sus gastos de titulacion.
Ella pide este nuevo préstamo para cubrir la totalidad de sus gastos de titulacion, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria continues with her studies in accounting sciences, and is putting her best efforts to grow and improve in everything that she puts her efforts into as a professional and as a student. 

She mentions that her previous loan was used to cover some of the graduation costs.

She is requesting this new loan to cover all of her graduation expenses, and thus able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay graduation expenses.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan vive en la ciudad de Itá, junto con sus padres y hermana, trabaja en la empresa de Confecciones hace más de dos años, estudia la carrera de Agronomía.
Él es una persona muy luchadora que quiere ser alguien en la vida, es por eso que se esfuerza mucho para cumplir con sus metas.
El préstamo lo pide para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the city of Itá, together with his parents and his sister. He has been working in a clothing manufacturer for more than two years. He is studying Agriculture.

He is a fighter who wants to be somebody in his life so he is trying hard to fulfill his goals.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for his course and in this way be able to continue to study.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Filoemana

texts.en: Filoemana is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as sugar, noodles, slippers, milk, biscuits, coffee, shampoo, detergents, candies, soft drinks, and other things to sell. Filoemana opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $500. She started with a small kiosk, so now she wants to open her kiosk to a bigger store. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, slippers, milk, biscuits, coffee, shampoo, detergents, candies, soft drinks, and other things to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 43 years old. She is known in the Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte area for her food-vending business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she has applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for: when all of her financing needs for her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en: Felimon has started corn and rice production financed by Paglaum MPC. Felimon feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used in his business. Recently, he availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Felimon wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply goods to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Hydie

texts.en:
Hydie is married and has four children. She is 40 years old and lives in Sulipat, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Hydie used her previous loans for farm inputs and improvements. She is a successful farmer who works tirelessly to improve her family's living standards.

She is able to cultivate the adjacent farm land and she needs money for fertilizer, such as manure, and to provide for plowing labor costs. She borrowed a loan recently and made her plan a reality. In the future, she hopes to be able to expand her business and continue to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure and to provide for plowing labor costs

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La señora Hilda oriunda del Departamento de Chuquisaca provincia Nor Cinti del Municipio de Janqoyu actualmente concubina, madre de tres hijos, muy humilde que se vino a trabajar desde muy joven junto a su esposo Nolberto a radicar al trópico de Cochabamba provincia Carrasco del municipio de Chimore de la población Senda en busca de nuevas oportunidades diferentes lugares del trópico de Cochabamba y tales trabajos como cosechas de diferentes tipos de cultivos y mantenimiento de difeentes cultivos en el área de producción, con el pasar de los años lograron comprar un lote con una superficie de 480 m2 en el municipio de Chimore, de esa manera tuvieron mejores ingresos toda vez que el marido trabajaba de jornalero y la señora en la agricultura, la señora necesita un préstamo para poder concluir los tramites de registro de derecho propietario del lote que adquirieron en tiempo a tras, de esta manera poder formalizar su producción agrícola y no tener ningun observación por instituciones de control y fiscalización de la región y de esta manera poder generar ahorros de sus ventas
texts.en:
Hilda is native of the province of Chuquisaca, Nor Cinti Township, Janqoyu .  Currently living common law, is mother of three children, and very humble .  She came to work at a young age along with her partner Nolberto, at the Tropic of Cochabamba, Carrasco province , Chimore Township of Senda Neighbourhood.  

They were in search of new and different opportunities in places like the Tropic of Cochabamba and looking for work such as farming and maintenance of different types of crops in the area of ​​production.
