With the passing of the years they managed to purchase a plot with an area of 480 m2 in the town of Chimoré thus being able to have higher income whenever her husband worked as a laborer and she in agriculture.  

Hilda needs a loan to be able to finalize the process of registration of ownership rights of the lot they acquired a while ago.  In this way, they will be able  to formalize their agricultural production and have no observation control from supervision institutions in the region and thus will be able to generate savings from their sales.

loans.use: with payment procedures for purchased lot, and to formally get established with the sale of her farm produce and generate savings for her family.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 57 years old and has five children. Cecilia is married and has two children who are presently in school.

Cecilia is in the agricultural business, specifically pig fattening, in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Cecilia has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Ana Cleotilde

texts.es:
Ana vive con sus dos hijos de 14 y 8 años de edad, ella es una mujer que quedo viuda y con la responsabilidad de cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, es propietaria de un comedor, el cual abrió hace 5 años, trabaja de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, por el momento no presenta dificultades en su negocio.
Comprará arroz, frijoles, aceite, verduras, especias, leña, etc., su finalidad es tener materia prima para ofrecer un menú variado a sus clientes, con ello su negocio se fortalecerá para cubrir nuevas demandas y generar mayores ganancias.
Sus sueños son tener mejores recursos económicos y sacar a sus adelante.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her two children aged 14 and 8 years old.  She was left a widow, and with the responsibility to cover all the needs of her family.  

She is the owner of a cafeteria, which she opened five years ago.  She works from six in the morning to four in the afternoon.  At the moment,  she has had no difficulties with her business.

She will purchase rice, beans, oil, vegetables, spices, wood, etc. with the goal to have raw material to offer her customers a varied menu.  With this, her  business will be strengthened to meet new demands and generate higher profits.

Her dream is to have better financial resources and to be able to continue [providing for her loved ones].

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, vegetables, spices, wood, etc.  Her goal is to have raw materials to offer a varied menu to her customers

loans.name: Ana Abigail

texts.es: Ana es una microempresaria habitante del municipio de Barranquilla en donde reside en compañía de su único hijo de 11 años, ella está separada de su cónyuge y en medio de esta situación se vio forzada a conseguir un empleo para solventar los gastos de su hogar y fue su oportunidad para conocer a fondo el negocio de expender carnes de res. Durante años estuvo empleada en el expendio de carnes del que hoy en día es propietaria, puesto que su anterior dueño decidió dejar la actividad y ella le solicitó que le cediera el local con toda la infraestructura a lo cual él aceptó. En la actualidad cuenta con dos años en esta actividad, ofreciendo todos los cortes de carne de res y vísceras a transeúntes del sector y restaurantes, ella labora todos los días de la semana a partir de las 3 a.m. hasta las 10 a.m., y realiza sus compras al igual que sus ventas de contado, es por ello que debe contar con un capital muy amplio para mantener bien surtido su negocio.  Ella está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar cortes de carnes de res y vísceras. Su meta a futuro es incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar una vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is a small business owner and inhabitant of the town of Barranquilla where she lives with her only child who is 11 years old.  She is separated from her spouse and in the midst of this situation she was forced to get a job to cover the costs of her home.  This is how she was faced with the opportunity to get to deeply know the business of dispensing beef. 

For years she was employed in the sale of meat, a business which she now owns.  When the previous owner decided to stop working in this sector, she asked him to transfer the place with all the infrastructure to her and he agreed. 

Currently, she has been in this activity for  two years, offering all cuts of meat and entrails to passers-by from the area, and to restaurants.

She works every day of the week from 3 am to 10 am, and conducts purchases as well as cash sales, which is why she must have a very large capital to maintain her business well stocked. 

She is requesting a loan, her first credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation,  to purchase beef cuts and entrails.

Her future goal is to increase her working capital and purchase a house.

loans.use: buy cuts of beef and entrails

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas is a strong-willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is 37 years old, married, and lives in Siayan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

She operates a hog raising business at her own backyard. Her business is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC and gives her quarterly income of approximately PHP 15,000, which sufficiently provides for the needs of her family.

Recently, she accessed another loan to buy piglets and purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy piglets and purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Teyfa

texts.en: Teyfa is 54 years old and married. She also is mother of 4 children. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives in the Bilesuvar region. Her husband is also her work partner. She is a farmer. Teyfa is an experienced woman because she has been working in this job for over 20 years. Teyfa does not earn enough money so she is not happy. Her biggest dreams are to expand her business and get better family living conditions. She needs some funds to buy farming equipment. For that, Kiva lenders should show their support.

loans.use: to buy farming equipment

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Previously, Rosalinda signed up for membership with PMPC and obtained the capital needed to start sari-sari (general store) business. She is thankful for the capital that was loaned to a small-time borrower like her. As a result, Rosalinda has been able to turn the tide in her favor. She is making good sales and she wants to take advantage of the good fortune. She has requested a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish-vending. Lilia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as vegetables and fish.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream - to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as vegetables and fish.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from abaca weaving. Maria is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlene is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Arlene has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Zuurabubu

texts.ru: Зуурабубу, 54 года, многодетная мать-героиня 9 детей. Все дети взрослые, самостоятельные, но помогают по бизнесу. Семья очень дружная и уважаемая в селе. Зуурабубу много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Бизнес она начала в 1985 году, на сегодняшний день она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: 3 коровы, 40 овец, 3 лошади. Также у Зуурабубу в наличии есть 3,87 ГА, где она ежегодно выращивает картофель и люцерну. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет до 36,000 сом (KGS). Всю прибыль от бизнеса Зуурабубу старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Зуурабубу хочет развить ее бизнес, чтобы в будущем приобрести автомобиль для ее семьи.
texts.en: Zuurabubu is 54 years old and a mother-hero of nine children. All of her children are grown and independent, but help with the business. Her family is very friendly and respected in the village. Zuurabubu has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for many years. She started her business in 1985 and is currently a successful farmer on her small farm, containing 3 cows, 40 sheep and 3 horses. Zuurabubu also has 3.87 hectares of land, where she annually grows potatoes and alfalfa. Her monthly profit amounts up to 36,000 som (KGS). Zuurabubu tries to invest all of her business profit into developing her business. She requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock. Zuurabubu wants to grow her business in order to buy a car for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to grow her business

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en: Florencio is getting a head start on the next cropping season. He wants to be well-prepared and he's especially concerned about critical land and seedbed preparations. He has applied for a loan from the cooperative to ensure that he has a sufficient supply of corn fertilizer. Florencio hopes to save enough money to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa has a sari-sari (general store) business. She took out a previous loan and she is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Josefa recently requested a new loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Baken

texts.ru: Бакен, 56 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Бакен высшее образование, она на пенсии, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством. Свою деятельность Бакен начала в 1998 году, у нее очень хороший опыт. У Бакен есть 11 коров, 13 овец. На 3,0 Га земли она выращивает ячмень, пшеницу, кукурузу для реализации. Бакен обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и последующей перепродажи. Бакен намерена направлять свои доходы на развитие бизнеса  и образование ее детей.
texts.en: Baken is 56 years old, married and together with her husband raising 4 children. Baken has a college education and is retired. To provide additional income for her family, she is involved in agriculture. Baken started her business in 1998 and has good experience in it. She has 11 cows and 13 sheep. She grows barley, wheat and corn for sale on 3.0 hectares of land. Baken requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy sheep for fattening up and subsequent resale. Baken intends to channel her earnings toward developing her business and educating her children.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up and subsequent resale

loans.name: Eha

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Eha, who is 29 years old, married and lives with two sons. Eha has been selling pillows and mattresses for ten years, She has asked for a loan of IDR 6,700,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build water sanitation at their home to improve access to clear water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Eha will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to build water sanitation at their home to improve access to clear water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Khalimjon

texts.ru: Халимчон молодой муж. Он женат и пока не имеет детей. Халимчону 26 лет. Он в городе Худжанд живет вместе с матерью и женой. Матерью 60 лет. В семье только работает, и обеспечить семью это Халимчон. Он занимается мастером по ремонту домов. У него 4 года опыт работы. Его жена студента она учится в университете. Мама домохозяйка, она не имеет работу. Халимчон всегда думает о семье, и он трудится, чтобы кормить и одевать семью.  Он не боится трудиться. Халимчон обратился за кредитом, чтобы оплатить за учебы жены. Без оплаты его жена будет исключена с университета. По этой причине Халимачон был вынужден взять кредит. Он ждет поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en: Khalimjon is a young husband. He is married and does not yet have children. Khalimjon is 26 years old. He lives in the town of Khujand with his mother and wife. His mother is 60 years old. Khalimjon is the only person working in his family and is the sole provider. He is involved in house repairs and has 4 years of experience. His wife is a university student, and mother is a homemaker and not employed. Khalimjon always thinks about his family and works hard to feed and clothe the family. He is not afraid of hard work. Khalimjon requested this loan to pay for his wife's tuition because without payment, she would be withdrawn from the university. This is why Khalimjon had to request this loan. He awaits Your support.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's university tuition

loans.name: Jose Pedro

texts.es: José de 47 años de edad reside en vivienda propia en la cual ha vivido durante 20 años, él es un hombre trabajador quien ofrece sus servicios de mecánico automotriz en un pequeño taller que se encuentra en su comunidad en la cual lleva ya 30 años laborando y de esta manera puede satisfacer sus necesidades básicas. José tiene dos hijos de 11 y 14 años de edad, que a pesar de no vivir al lado de ellos les ayuda económicamente para cubrir sus necesidades y también para sus estudios. Gracias a la experiencia que José posee en su trabajo, sus servicios son solicitados constantemente por muchas personas, ayudando esto a maximizar el trabajo y por ello los ingresos. En busca de mejorar su negocio José  solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: máquina pulidora, máquina de soldar, taladro, entre otras herramientas para mejorar sus servicios al contar con herramientas nuevas. De esta forma cubrir los gastos de su hogar y continuar ayudando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old, he has lived in his own home for 20 years. He is a hardworking man who offers his auto mechanic services in a small workshop, which is found in the community that he has worked in for 30 years. In this way he has been able to satisfy his basic needs.
José has two children, ages 11 and 14. Although he does not live with them, he supports them financially to cover their needs and to help with their studies.
Thanks to José's work experience, his services are always been sought after by many people, which helps him to maximize his work and accordingly his income.
Seeking to improve his business, José is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: a polishing machine, a welding machine, and a drill, among other tools. He is relying on the new tools to improve his services. In this way he can cover the costs of his home and continue to support his children.

loans.use: to invest in: a polishing machine, a welding machine, and a drill, among other tools to improve his services.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 62 years old, married, and is known in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte for her food vending business. She is also an active member of Paglaum MPC, where she accesses financial assistance for her business.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, condiments, and others for food vending.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, condiments, and others for food vending.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
With her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, Analiza was able to buy stocks of used clothes for her buy-and-sell business. She wants to express her deepest gratitude to all of the lenders and to the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for providing her financial assistance.

Analiza knows it's not easy to manage a business, but she’s determined to succeed in order to sustain the needs of her family. She aims to save money for her family that can be used for future needs.

Analiza is lacking the capital needed to run her business as a result of certain events in her life. To prevent this from happening again, she has applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will use the money to buy quality used clothes, which she believes will attract more patrons and increase her revenue. She will also buy variety of shoes and personal care products like lotion, perfume, etc. to sell.

Analiza regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, discuss her business experiences, and to draw strength and inspiration and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of quality used clothes, footwear, and personal care products needed for her business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 54 years old and has two children. He has agricultural land that he cultivates, and integrates other commodities for more income.

Jimmy plans to expand his pig raising. He approached Paglaum MPC to buy more head of pigs for commercial sale. He wants to take advantage of the high demand for pigs for butchering.

In the future, Jimmy hopes to sustain his business and would love to open an eatery.

loans.use: to buy more head of pigs for commercial sale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old now.

Rosa has a vehicle repair business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business such as spare parts, etc.

Rosa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business such as spare parts, etc.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao and her husband own a small grocery shop and have two dependent children. She needs to stand by in the shop the whole day and consume a lot of energy to run her business until nighttime; however, the car battery is not reliable. Sometimes, the battery runs out without notice. She has no choice but to stay in the pitch black until morning. This disturbs not only her lifestyle but also her business. Therefore, she is applying for a KIVA loan to buy a solar home system to sustain her business’s energy usage and also her family usage. With a solar home system, she doesn’t have to have concern about sudden power loss anymore.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Damnak Sasar Village, Thma Andoeurk Commune, Chetr

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Alma has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Alma has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Da

texts.en: Da and her husband, farmers for a generation, lives in Damnak Sasar Village and has five children. Da and her husband are hard-working farmers. They always get up early to prepare their equipment to do farming. They put in all their effort to make their family live in better conditions. With five children as a burden, Da and her husband are always concerned about the kids' safety since they are often not at home. Moreover, they have to go to charge their car battery every day for daily usage. It is a time- and money-consuming activity. Therefore, Da decided to apply for a KIVA in order to buy a solar home system. After using a solar home system, she would be relieved because she would have no worry about her children's safety. Her family also can live in convenient conditions with bright light.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Damnak Sasar Village, Thma Andoeurk Commune, Chetr

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A few years ago, Maria became involved in business activities. She started with her own working capital of USD 500.

Now, she is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to improve her business. She has come to the age of 42, but she is not too dependent on her husband. She has a kiosk in front of her house and she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin which she will use to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, including slippers, sugar, detergent, biscuits, sardines, milk, cooking oil, tea, cigarettes, noodles, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell.

Maria said that she will improve her management with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy slippers, sugar, detergent, biscuits, sardines, milk, cooking oil, tea, cigarettes, noodles,  soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: 35 летняя женщина Латофат. Она проживает в городе Худжанд. Латофат развелась мужем, у нее один маленький ребенок. Она живет вместе с отцом, матерью и братьями. Латофат воспитывает ребенка без мужа. Хорошо, что у Латофат есть свой бизнес. Она продает гриль. У нее  имеется бытовая техника для приготовления гриль. Путем продажи гриль она кормить ребенка. Еще ей помогает ее братья. Латофат хочет расширить деятельность. Она решила взять кредит и купить больше замороженную курицу для приготовления гриль. И еще хочет купить соусы. С такими планами Латофат запрашивает кредит.
texts.en: Latofat is 35 years old. She lives in the town of Khujand. Latofat is divorced from her husband and has a small child. She lives with her father, mother and brothers. Latofat is raising her child without a husband, but at least it is beneficial that she has her own business. She sells grilled products and has grilling equipment. She supports her child by selling grilled products, and her brothers also help out. Latofat wants to expand her business. She decided to obtain a loan and buy more frozen chickens for grilling. She also wants to buy sauces. This is why Latofat is requesting this loan.

loans.use: to buy more frozen chickens and sauces for grilling

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has mastered her farming activities, including growing, tending, harvesting, and earning income as well. She works alongside her husband. Just like she nurtures her crops, Susan has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Susan hopes to purchase another rice field to cultivate to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Blanca Deysi

texts.es: Blanca de 50 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con su hija de 16 años de edad en su vivienda que es propia ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora para darle lo mejor a su hija a quien ama mucho y se esfuerza día con día para darle lo mejor. Ella presta sus servicios de costura a una empresa que se encuentra cerca de su municipio, su jornada comienza desde muy temprano para hacer un poco de limpieza en su hogar y preparar a su hija para ir a estudiar, su hija también le ayuda en los oficios del hogar. Ella ha trabajado muy duro estos años para tener una vivienda digna para vivir con su hija; ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en lámina, madera, clavos, y ventanas para construir un cuarto y de esta manera ampliar su casa y tener más espacio, ella espera una respuesta favorable al crédito pues sabe que de esta manera ella cambiara la calidad de vida de ella y principalmente de su hija.
texts.en:
Blanca, is a 50-year-old single mother who lives with her 16-year-old daughter in the home that is her own.  She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who strives everyday, to the best of her abilities, to give the best to her daughter whom she loves very much.  

She works as a seamstress with a company that is close to her town.  Her day starts very early, and she does some cleaning in her home and prepares her daughter to go to school.  Her daughter also helps with the chores at home. 

She has worked very hard all these these years to have a decent home to live with her daughter.  

She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in galvanized/metal sheets, wood, nails, and windows to build a room and thus expand their home and have more space. 

She hopes for a favorable response to the loan knowing that in this way her quality of life will change and especially that of her daughter.

loans.use: to invest in: galvanized/metal sheets, wood, nails, and windows for a room and extend their humble home.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Her name is Edna, 58 years old, a member of CCT's Gen. Trias Branch. She is single and has adopted a baby, who is now a high-school student whom she loves so much. She went into a direct-selling business to support their personal and household needs.

Her direct selling of food supplements, beauty, skin products and cleaning agents of popular brands has earned her not only friends, but moreso, funds for their everyday needs. To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a Php 40,000 loan to meet the increasing orders of food supplements, whitening soap, lotions, and toiletries. Your assistance will be a great help to grow her direct selling and thus allow her to cover her adopted child's schooling.

Edna's precious dream is to have a store of her own to display her personal products and send her child to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital,and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for food supplements, beauty and skin products, and cleaning agents to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 29-year-old, married woman with three children.

To earn a living, she has a small plantation where she grows cucumbers, cabbages, and tomatoes, that sell in her community.

Ana needs a loan to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer, and vegetable seeds.

She will use her profits to expand her business and to financially support her family.

Ana joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer, and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is an active member of Paglaum MPC who enjoys all the perks of membership. She is a 67-year-old married woman with adult children. Alicia keeps busy tilling her land, a business venture that was supported by the cooperative. Alicia is confident that she can always turn to the cooperative for help, but in order to be prepared for unexpected life events, she has taken out a life insurance policy. Her one-year life insurance policy expires soon so she has requested a loan to pay for insurance renewal for her family. Alicia believes that it is best to be prepared for unexpected circumstances.

loans.use: to pay for her family's life insurance renewal.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Adalberto

texts.es: El Sr. Adalberto es soltero no tiene hijos es el hermano mayor de cuatro hermanos, desde muy pequeño tuvo que trabajar en varios talleres de carpintería para ayudar a su padre con los gastos de su hogar pues su madre se encontraba muy delicada de salud y no podía trabajar. El Sr. Adalberto entro a un instituto de capacitación donde le enseñaron más de trabajos de carpintería y de electricidad, logrando armar un pequeño taller con un préstamo que saco en su entonces, taller que se encuentra en la avenida que va al aeropuerto pero lamentablemente están asfaltando el mismo por lo cual no pude llevar sus maderas hasta su taller y tuvo que paralizar este taller hasta por lo menos dos años, pues es el tiempo que tardara en habilitarse dicha avenida, por lo cual está realizando trabajos de instalaciones eléctricas en varias construcciones, por lo que requiere del préstamo para poder comprar equipos y máquinas para realizar instalaciones en construcciones grandes, de esta forma tener sus ingresos para poder cubrir las cuotas de su préstamo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adalberto is single and does not have any children. He is the oldest of four siblings. Since he was very young, he had to work in various carpentry workshops to help his father with the costs of the his home, as his mother was very sick and was not able to work. Adalberto attended a training institute where he was taught more about carpentry and electricity.
He has been able to supply a small workshop with a loan that he took out. The workshop is located on the road that goes to the airport but unfortunately they are paving that road and so he cannot take his wood to his workshop. He has had to close this shop for at least two years, as this is the time that it will take for the road to be completed.
This is why he is doing work in electrical installations at various construction sites. For this he requires the loan, to be able to buy equipment and machines to use for the installations in large projects. In this way he will have an income to be able to cover the payments of the loan and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy equipment and machines to use for installations to improve his work and in this way have an income to improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is 32 and living in Goravan village. She is the mother of three daughters, all of whom currently attend school. Lusine has been involved in the farming business for over 10 years now. Her mixed farm consists of livestock (three pigs, piglets and hens) and also wheat cultivation. Lusine's husband is a policeman and her mother-in-law works at the local supermarket, so mainly Lusine and her father-in-law take care of the farming business.

Lusine is asking for this loan to purchase two oxen, seeds, fuel for land cultivation and also forage for feeding the livestock and preparing the farm for the winter.

Lusine hopes that extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children, and will allow her to provide proper nutrition for the family.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, seeds, fuel for land cultivation and also forage for feeding the livestock and preparing the farm for the winter

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 54 years old and married with six children. Two of Carmelita's children are still in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, home care products, and other groceries.

Carmelita has been in this business for 3 years and she sells a variety of items.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Aigerim

texts.ru: Айгерим, 23 года, замужем,есть сын, ему 2 года. У Айгерим среднее образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2013 году, благодаря упорному труду Айгерим, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 2 лошади и 3 овцы. На земельной доле мерою 1,95 Га она выращивает ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. На ежедневной основе Айгерим продает экологически чистое домашнее молоко. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айгерим обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 12 овец для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Айгерим планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества скота.
texts.en: Aigerim is 23 years old, married and has a 2-year-old son. Aigerim has a secondary education. To provide additional income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2013. Thanks to Aigerim's hard work, today her business contains 2 cows, 2 horses and 3 sheep. She grows barley on approximately 1.95 hectares of land for the business consumption and sale. Aigerim sells organic, farm-fresh milk daily. To further grow her business, Aigerim requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy 12 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount. Aigerim plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy 12 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Fualole

texts.en:
Fualole is a 47-year-old woman who is married, with two children.

To earn a living, she has a plantation where she grows cabbages, cucumbers, and eggplants that are sold in the market.

Fualole needs a loan to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer, and vegetable seeds.

She will use her profits to expand her business and to financially support her family.

Fualole joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer, and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en:
Litia is 31 years old and married with 1 child. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily consumption goods such as drinks, snacks, frozen food and more. She has been doing this for more than 10 years.

Litia needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, bags of flour, bags of rice, drinks, bags of chicken, sausage, snacks and more. She hopes to use her profits to support her family financially and to expand her business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, bags of flour, bags of rice, drinks, bags of chicken, sausage, snacks and more.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a 21-year-old woman who is single without any children. She plans to start a small business, planting and selling vegetables in her community for a living.

Tima needs a loan to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer and vegetable seeds. She will use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially.

Tima joined SPBD in the beginning of September this year 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 30 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones.
texts.en:
Ana is 49 years old and lives in her own home with two children. She has made a living for the past 30 years by selling fruits and vegetables. Her business is located in the municipal market and she has many customers.

She uses the income that she earns to pay for household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit and vegetables in bulk so that she can provide a better quality of life without limitations for her children.

loans.use: purchase more fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 50 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Fe has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Fe has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en: Fidela is 58 years old and married. Fidela is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Fidela has raised pigs for the past 5 years, and she has previously borrowed 4 loans from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Fidela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José, es un agricultor que específicamente cultiva maíz y frijol, tiene trabajando en el campo muchos años de su vida, su negocio propio lo tiene desde hace 30 años, su horario de trabajo es de siete de la mañana a una de la tarde. José es casado, vive con su esposa e hijos, él abastece a su familia de todo lo necesario para subsistir.
Con el financiamiento comprara abono y semilla mejorada para sembrar granos básicos, espera que la cosecha le permita abastecer a su familia de alimentación y atender las demandas que sus clientes hacen, el objetivo de José es tener mejores circunstancias  económicas.
La visión que él tiene es tener un negocio mucho más grande y reconocido en su localidad.
texts.en:
Jose is a farmer who grows corn and beans specifically.  He has been working in the field for many years of his life.  He has had his own business for 30 years.  His work schedule is 7:00am  to 01:00pm. 

Jose is married, and lives with his wife and children.  He provides for his family with everything that they need to survive.

With the loan he will purchase fertilizer and improved seed to plant basic grains.

He hopes that the harvest will allow him to supply his family with enough supply to feed them, and also be able to meet the demands of his customers.

Jose's goal is to have better economic circumstances.

The vision he has is having a much bigger and recognized local business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and improved seed to plant basic grains

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.es:
Santiaga considera que los créditos son de mucha importancia para mantener su fuente de ingresos, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz, verduras y variedad de bebidas, podrá elaborar la venta de comida y tortillas, espera contar siempre con la fidelidad de sus clientes.
Después de utilizar el crédito anterior en su negocio ha logrado incrementar sus ingresos, atender a nuevos clientes y mejorar las circunstancias de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Santiaga knows that loans are very important for maintaining her source of income. She is requesting a new loan to buy corn, vegetables and a variety of drinks, to be able to make food and tortillas to sell. She hopes that she can always rely on the loyalty of her customers.
After having used the previous loan for her business, she was able to increase her income, attend to more customers and improve the circumstances of her family's lives.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetables and a variety of drinks, to be able to make food and tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Sunilata's Group

texts.en:
Sunilata is an industrious lady standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She hails from an interior village of Bhadrak district, Odisha, India. She has a family of three consisting of her husband and two children.

Sunilata is a grocer by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood. The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic and clean toilet in her home to safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses.

She has a dream of providing her children the best education.

loans.use: to build a hygienic and clean toilet in her home.

loans.name: Zvart

texts.en:
Zvart is 45 years old and the mother of 4 children, ranging in age from 11 to 24 years old. Zvart and her husband have run their farm for many years now. Their livestock includes 6 cows, 8 calves, 4 sheep, 8 pigs, and 50 hens which they keep in the barn near their house. Zvart and her husband also earn income from growing wheat on the family's arable land near the village. They work hard to sustain their farming business and manage the family's expenses.

Zvart is requesting a loan to purchase wheat seeds to prepare for autumn cultivation. She will also purchase forage to feed her livestock during winter season so the farm will continue to earn income for the family. She is very grateful for the loan and to be able to prepare her farm for the upcoming winter season.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds to prepare for autumn cultivation and purchase forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season.

loans.name: Tapaswini's Group

texts.en:
Tapaswini is a humble lady standing to the extreme left in the photograph in a red saree. She hails from an interior village of Bhadrak district, Odisha, India. She has a family of four consisting of her husband and three children.

Tapaswini is a mason by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood. The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Fashionista Group

texts.en: Ildesita is the featured borrower of Fashionista group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back home. Ildesita is a 43-year-old married mother of two children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved children and improve their living conditions. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children increasing living needs in the Philippines (clothes, medical treatments, food etc..). Ildesita is on the left. As for the other group members, Jovelyn is standing at the center of the picture and Imelda is on the right.

loans.use: to pay for her children living needs (clothes, medical, food, etc) in Philippines

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a married man and father of five children, three of them are still studying. He’s a 45 year-old hard working man, looking to support his family. He has many years of experience in his recent job. He owns a poultry shop and always tries to offer his customers the best results he can.

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase fodder to feed the chickens in order to develop his business and thus his income by a large percentage.

loans.use: to purchase fodder to feed the chickens

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann has been running her business for many years. She engages in the business and makes a working  profit.

loans.use: to cover the cost of maintenance of her videoke for rental.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 47-year-old, Lebanese, married woman living with her husband and one child. Her husband represents the main income source in the family in order to enhance their way of living.

Today, she hopes to help her child with his education. For that reason, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the last installment of the study fees. She will be more than happy to see him graduating and achieving his education suitably.

She said that she is very happy with this loan that will allowed her to ensure a good education for her child

loans.use: to pay the last installment of the study fees.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 48-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and her three children. Her husband represents the main income source in the family in order to enhance their way of living.

Today, she hopes to help her child with his education. For that reason, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the last installment of the study fees.

She will be more than happy to see him graduate and achieve his master’s degree.

loans.use: to pay the last installment of study fees.

loans.name: Fidelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Fidelina utilizo el crédito anterior en la compra de materia prima para la venta de tortillas y para reparar la cocina artesanal que utiliza para desarrollar sus actividades, su situación financiera ha mejorado y su familia se mantiene, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en el negocio.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito con el cual podrá comprar maíz y leña, considera que con la inversión ahorrara y podrá mantener la continuidad de la venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Fidelina used her previous loan to purchase raw materials to make tortillas and also to repair the artisan stove that she uses for her business. Her financial situation has improved and she is supporting her family. She hasn't had any challenges with her business.

She is requesting another loan, which she will use to purchase corn and firewood. She hopes that the investment will allow her to save more money and continue to sell tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood so that she can save more money and continue to sell tortillas.
